loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad S. is from the village of Tubod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old and a widowed mother of five adult-aged children. To make a living, Natividad owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. She chose to lower the amount of her loan from PHP 10,000 to PHP 5,000 because she finds it easier to pay back smaller amounts.

In 2008, Natividad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Natividad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice C. is currently in the business of selling beans, pulses, and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish and tomatoes to sell.  Alice is 39 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock dried fish and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Harselina

texts.en:
Harselina G. is from the village of Maligaya, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 49 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Harselina owns & operates a general retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Harselina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Harselina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Harselina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products for sale. Harselina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be Harselina's 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen tiene 51 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, ella ayuda con la economía del hogar, Ella inicio su negocio vendiendo pocos productos como ropa y calzado pero como necesitaba más dinero para tener su negocio, comenzó a realzar financiamientos para ofrecer una gran variedad.  Ahora trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días.  El destino del crédito es para comprar pantalones, ropa interior, cosméticos, toallas y sabanas. Es muy conocida por la cuadra y tiene mucha clientela, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
51-year old Maria del Carmen sells general merchandise. Her income helps to support the household. She started out selling a few products like clothing and footwear, but as she needed more money, she obtained loans to stock her store with a greater variety of goods. Maria works from 7am to 8pm every day. She plans to use this loan to buy pants, underwear, cosmetics, towels, and sheets. Well-known in the neighbourhood and with many customers, Maria is responsible and hardworking. She is very grateful to the institution and the support that she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice B. runs a "sari-sari" (general) store. Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. “Sari” is a native Filipino word for variety. This is a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage, not far away from the owner’s house. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who lives far from the marketplace. 

Janice started her variety store through her initiative in dealing with customers. She wants to continue her business; it gives them good proceeds to support the education of her three children. She is requesting a loan of PHP18,000 so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. With profit from her business, she wants to buy a hog for fattening for supplementary income. After four months of raising or fattening, pigs will be sold either alive or slaughtered for meat to be sold per kilo. Her long-term goal is to have her own restaurant someday, so that Janice will give the opportunity of employment to others. 
  
Janice dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to another village, so as to send her three children all the way through college, and to have their own beautiful house and lot for comfortable living. Her three children are her inspiration to pursue her variety store. She now feels very happy about the service of ASHI and its KIVA partnership. It gives them a great possibility to pursue their family dreams. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

She has shown herself to be hard-working to make her dreams come true and hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and improve the overall living conditions of her entire family.

loans.use: will buy more food products and basic household necessities

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and some smaller items. She is requesting a loan to buy more items and some new ones to sell in order to increase business.  

Christine is 38 years old and widowed. She has seven children and four of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats and chickens to keep at home.

loans.use: Buy more items to sell

loans.name: Boniface Adula

texts.en:
Boniface Adula, age 25, is married to Ivy Wanjiku, age 22, and together they have two daughters, ages 4 and 2 years old. He lives in Umoja and has a carpentry shop there. The carpentry business is located in a highly populated area with a lot of potential and Boniface has many clients. He serves them with a lot of respect and they always give him business. Boniface has been running his carpentry shop for four years and his monthly profit is 25,000 Kenyan shillings. His wife Ivy is a business woman and she contributes to the family income. 

Boniface was introduced to KADET by one of the loan officers in charge of Eastland office. With this loan, Boniface intends to buy strong boards, paint and wood glue of all of different types and colours. If the loan boosts the business, Boniface intends to expand the business and employ more people to help him. Boniface likes listening to his customers to give them good service. He is very ambitious and dreams of his business becoming one of the biggest in the country.

loans.use: To buy boards, paints, wood screws, nails and wood glue

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man H., 52, is a single mother living in Phnom Penh City. She was married but her husband died several years ago. She has eight children; two are married and live away from home and the other six are single. One of them them is a hairdresser in the local market. Man H. has earned her living by selling fish in her community since 2005. She sells fish that she buys from her supplier. She also rents her house to make additional income.  Because selling fish is her main way to earn money, Man H. is applying for a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in Kamoki, which is a small city in Punjab Pakistan known for its rice production. She lives in the area named Chungi no.7 with her family in a 2 room brick house. She moved here many years ago with her family. 

Shahnaz is 46 years old, married to A. A. and has 4 children: 2 daughters and 2 sons. Her children couldn’t get an education due to financial reasons and started working in their teens. Her both sons work in the local factory. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. With this rickshaw, he provides transport services to passengers. 

Shahnaz herself is a very supportive lady by nature. She supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. She is a very talented embroidery artist and receives regular orders every month from her neighborhood clients. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy clothes and embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity. That will help her finishing orders on time and offer more embroider variety to her clients. 

She hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and she will increase her household income. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy clothes and  material for an embroidery business

loans.name: Karim Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karim; ella tiene 37 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche,menestras,golosinas entre otros, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su familia. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su pequeño negocio y así poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Karim is a member of the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Karim is 37 years old.  She is separated and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She sells essentials such as rice, sugar, milk, pulses, candy, etc.  She is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead.  She works together with her family.

Karim is requesting this loan to keep her small business running and thereby get her children ahead in life.

She is grateful to those who will take part in this dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To keep her small business running and thereby get her children ahead in life

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 31-year-old married man who is blessed with two children who attend school.  For four years, Antony has been selling charcoal. Previously, he earned a living from farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Antony has learned how to manage his finances which is helping him to run his business well.  

Antony is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy charcoal. In the future, he dreams of expanding his business to the wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Toktogul. Dinara is 49 years old and married to a driver. Together, they bring up two sons and two daughters; all four children are students.  

Five years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms, Dinara started to breed cattle. Reselling cattle after fattening, she earns 1500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of cattle. In the future she wants to expand her business to be able to support her children financially.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es compra y venta de fruta, ella viaja a la ciudad de Yanatile en donde compra frutas y después vende sus productos en la ciudades del Cusco y Calca. Soledad es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora y actualmente está estudiando la carrera profesional de contabilidad. Soledad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas.

Soledad pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en: Soledad, age 19, is single and lives en the city of Cusco, Peru.  Her main work is buying and selling fruit.  She travels to the city of Yanatile where she buys fruit and later sells her products in the cities of Cusco and Calca.  Soledad is young, hard-working, and enterprising. She currently is studying to become an accountant.  Soledad requires a loan to buy more fruits.  Soledad belongs to the community bank "Caminemos Juntas (We walk together)" of the UMF association Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is made up of enterprising, hard-working people that search every moment for opportunities to uplift and help their children.

loans.use: To buy more fruits.

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es:
Marlín Narváez tiene 43 años y vive en la ciudad de Cartagena en el departamento de Bolívar.  Ella tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 9, 19 y 25 años que son inspiración para trabajar y sacarlos adelante. Cuando inició un negocio lo hizo vendiendo prendas de oro, a las que gradualmente  adicionó ropa  y electrodomésticos menores que traía de Maicao, un municipio fronterizo y también compraba en la ciudad de Barranquilla así fue como construyó su principal capital;   en la actualidad vende productos de acuerdo a la temporada, así es como en temporada escolar vende lápices, cuadernos, útiles y papelería , en la época navideña , adornos, ropa cosmético calzado, en las fiestas novembrinas todo lo que compra la gente para las fiestas ; así es que ella  distribuye toda clase de mercancía variada en una moto,  entre todos su clientes que viven en los diferentes barrios de la ciudad de Cartagena,  donde se encuentra su principal mercado y también adecuó una   vitrina, en un espacio de su vivienda,  que progresivamente  se  convirtió en una variedad donde sus clientes,  entre vecinos amigos y familiares se acercan para comprar los productos que allí exhibe.  
Cuando inició con la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo, trabajó en la modalidad de grupo solidario y gradualmente,  cuando ya estuvo preparada decidió obtener financiamiento ella sola. De esta manera logró acceder a  tres créditos en la modalidad de grupo y dos de manera individual; este es su quinto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también el primero que hace mediante el fondo de Kiva, con el cual planea comprar papelería, ropa cosméticos y calzado. Su sueño es tener una casa  propia,  lo cual es su gran desafío,  porque tiene como misión, apoyar la educación profesional de sus hijos y mejorarles sus condiciones de vida. Así Marlín Narváez una excelente madre,  cada día que pasa trabaja arduamente y con un gran entusiasmo,  pensando en apoyar la construcción de un futuro  prometedor para sus hijos .
texts.en:
Marlín Narváez is 43 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena, Bolívar state.  She has three children aged 9, 19, and 25, who inspire her to work and help them get ahead.  When she started a business she was selling gold jewelry.  She gradually added clothing and small appliances which she brought from Maicao, a border town, and also from the city of Barranquilla.  That is how she built up her initial capital. She now sells products that change with the season, for example during the school year she sells pencils, notebooks, other supplies and paper products.  During Christmas, she sells ornaments, clothes, cosmetics, and footwear.  In the November festivals she sells everything people buy for the festivities.  She delivers all types of merchandise on a motorbike to her customers who live in the different neighborhoods of the city of Cartagena, her primary market.  She also set up a window in her home for sales, which over time became a small shop where her clients, neighborhood friends and family, come to purchase the items she has on display. 

When she joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she was part of a lending group, and over time, when she was ready, she decided to take out a loan on her own.  In this way she has been able to request 3 loans as part of a group and 2 loans individually.  This is her 5th loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and the first through Kiva.  She will use the loan to purchase paper goods, clothes, cosmetics, and footwear.  

Her dream is to have her own home, which is a great challenge, because her mission is to support her children in their education to become professionals and improve their living conditions.  Marlín Narváez, an excellent mother, works hard every day and with great enthusiasm, thinking about building a promising future for her children.

loans.use: To purchase paper goods, clothing, cosmetics, and footwear

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make peanut products for sale

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Чаборов Рустам проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ему 43 года. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сыновья находятся в городе Москве. Сам Рустам уже четыре года как занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Rustam C. lives in the J.Rumi region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker. His sons are now in Moscow. Rustam has been doing animal husbandry for four years now. He breeds large cattle for future resale. He is taking out this loan to buy large cattle to increase their headcount.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo P., age 49, tends and raises livestock. He raises pigs for fattening and sale. Timoteo has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP every four months. He is from the village of Baracbac Sta. Fe, Nueva Vizcaya. He and his wife have four school-aged children. 
 
Timoteo has just recently joined ASKI in the hopes of gaining access to financial services. He wants to help improve his family's living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Timoteo is requesting his first loan from ASKI in the amount of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Denyse

texts.en:
Denyse is 36 years old and is still married with three children between the ages 5 and 11 year old. She is the only one in her family who works. She owns a small business selling various products such as body lotion, cooking oil, sugar and so on. Her business is clear and well-organized.

Denyse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods like soap, biscuits, cooking oil and body lotion to sell. Denyse hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to save money for her future and she will build a owns house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like body lotion, cooking oil, sugar etc.

loans.name: Virgen De La Misericordia Group

texts.es:
Virgen de la  Misericordia se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra. Silvia D., contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Una vez asesorada acerca del programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
La sra. Silvia se dedica a la venta de carnes, es una actividad que lo viene realizando desde hace varios años, y es el medio mediante el cual mantiene a su familia, como posee mucha clientela la demanda supera su capacidad de abastecimiento, por eso solicita el crédito, para poder comprar más carnes de modo a poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group of extraordinary women is called “Virgen de Misericordia” (Lady of Mercy) and is located in the city of Ita, thanks to the current manager, Silvia D..  She contacted the advisor at a weekly meeting in the same zone, to find out about the work of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women).

Once she got advice, she was able to bring 16 women together and they are all now comfortably working on their fourth cycle.

All of them do different things to gather funds to mutually help one another to reach their common goals within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.  Silvia sells meat and has been doing so for several years.  She supports her family this way, but since she has many customers, the demand is greater than supply, so she is asking for this loan to be able to buy more meat to satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 40  años de edad, ella es casada.  Vive en casa propia y tiene 04 hijos dependientes, reside en el  Caserío Monte Grande, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope. 

Yolanda se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de  pescado. Ella le compra a un vendedor mayorista y posteriormente lo distribuye en su localidad y en zonas aledañas, cuenta con muchos años de experiencia en este rubro, lo que le ha permitido tener clientela fija.  Además se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta.

Yolanda desea invertir en su negocio de pescado para poder ampliar su zona de distribución y comprar alimento para sus animales, de esta manera ella podrá percibir mayores ingresos económicos , por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 100 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Yolanda es una clienta nueva para Edpyme Alternativa, sin embrago ya ha manejado otros créditos, con un buen historial crediticio, ha demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 40 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her four dependent children. They reside in the village of Monte Grande, which is five minutes away from the city of Mórrope.

Yolanda sells fish as a traveling merchant. She buys from a wholesale vendor and distributes her product within her community and in the surrounding areas. Yolanda has many years of experience in this business and has accumulated regular customers. In addition, she raises small animals in a few pens that have been set up near her home. She feeds the animals grains and natural grasses. Once they have developed properly, she offers the animals for sale.

Yolanda wants to invest in her fish business so that she can expand her distribution area, as well as buy feed for her animals, in order to generate more income. For this reason, she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN in order to accomplish her goal.

Even though Yolanda is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa, she has managed previous loans and has achieved a good credit history. She has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments.

loans.use: to invest in her fish business and to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es:
Doña Emilce esta accediendo al credito #33 y a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprará mercancías para responder a clientes que le han solicitado telas, perfumes, colonias, artículos D. aseo personal, ella quiere preparar su negocio, para el día del padre que ya se acerca,  y es una temporada D. alto movimiento comercial en la que planea aumentar sus ventas. Con su anterior credikiva fabricó ropa D. bebé y su rotación fue muy rápida porque lo hizo sobre pedidos, así mismo reparó su máquina y reinvirtió con sus utilidades logrando surtirse  D. mercancías que le habían solicitado sus clientes.
Para doña Emilce a sus 68 años, ha sido muy satisfactorio recibir apoyo D. Kiva y D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque es muy difícil encontrar financiamiento para la tercera edad y con ello pueD. seguir surtiendo su negocio. Si usted quiere conocer la historia D. Emilce ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/179440.
texts.en:
Emilce is taking out her 33rd loan and her second Kiva loan. With it, she will buy merchandise to respond to customers who have asked her for fabrics, perfumes, colognes, and personal hygiene items. She wants to perpare her business for Father's Day, which is drawing near. It is a high volume time and she plans on increasing her sales. With the previous Kiva loan she maD. baby clothes, and her turnover was very fast because she maD. them to order. She also repaired her machine and reinvested the profits in supplying the merchandise her customers had asked her for. 

For Emilce, who is 68, it has been very satisfying to receive Kiva's support as well as Fundación Mario Santo Domingo's, because it is very difficult to fnd financing for eldery people. With it, she has been able to continue investing in her business. If you want to know Emilce's story, go to the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/179440.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, perfume, colognes, and personal hygiene items.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María madre de familia de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo y  sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado  en el distrito de Olmos que peretenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

María se dedica  a la crianza de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas son apropiados y espaciosos están en la parte posterior de su casa, a sus animales los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una  vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo las ofrece en el mercado de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, con el dinero que va adquirir por sus ovejas podrá atender las necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos y mejorar su corral de sus animales, asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de sus animales para ofrecerlos aun buen precio en el mercado, lo que permitirá cubrir su crédito y brindarle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.   María es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora, dispuesta ayudar a otros, pero quiere que su familia se supere en especial sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 47, is a mother living with her husband and two children in her own house which does not have basic utilities located in Olmos District that belongs to Lambayeque Department.  It’s noted for being a zone with much farming and livestock raising activities.

María has raised sheep for several years.  The corral her sheep are kept in is spacious and adequate and is in her back yard.  She feeds her animals nutritionally balanced feed like natural grasses and once they reach optimal size and weight she sells them at the market in Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  She will be able to attend to daily household needs with money earned from their sale.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 600 new sol loan to buy feed and to make some improvements to the corrals for her animals assuring their good growth and development so that she can ask for a good selling price at the market which will allow her to repay the loan and provide her family with a better standard of living.

María is well known in her zone for being a very hard working woman willing to help others but she wants her family to get ahead, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to make improvement to their corrals.

loans.name: Khaleil

texts.en:
Khaleil, who is photographed in Jenin's Branch, is a 41-year-old father of six sons. He is married and works with his wife at their house making clothes for the neighbors and some of the stores in the city of Jenin.

Khaleil's oldest son finished school and wanted to help his parents' work, as they are getting old and have a big family to take care of. Khaleil took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a sewing machine for his son, as he also learned the profession when working with his parents during summer vacations.

loans.use: to  purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 52 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artesanía, ella vende al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas que venden artesanía, la socia trabaja independiente, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas, polos y muñecas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Inti Quilla" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 52 years old, married, and has six children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling handicrafts.  She sells wholesale to stores that sell handicrafts.  She works for herself and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  The borrower would like to improve her business selling handicrafts.  She is requesting this loan to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, tops and dolls.

The borrower is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, tops and dolls

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is married with three children. She is 42 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Pilar has a general store business. She has run this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP. She has requested a loan for 40,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Pilar has been a member of PMPC just for this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 28 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is single and has 1 child. Her child is currently in school. Sarah has a business of a beauty salon, which she has had for over 10 years. She sells produce, like maize, as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her child. In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Trust Association Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Trust Association” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a group loan of 500,000 SLL for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, increase sales, and consequently improve their individual and family living conditions. 

Alie is the leader of this group. He is 40 years old and married to a trader. The couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. For the past ten years, Alie has been a businessman who sells drug store items and cosmetics. With his share of this loan, he will buy more medicines and cosmetics to add to his inventory.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and drugstore items to sell

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Amivi est une femme âgée de 47ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 01 enfant. 
Amivi travaille comme restauratrice depuis 1990. Elle sert ses clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Amivi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter du riz, de l’huile, de la tomate et divers.
texts.en:
Amivi is a 47-year-old woman who is married to a merchant. She has one child.

Amivi has been working as a restauranteur since 1990. She serves her customers out of her home. She gets her supplies from Lomé. 

Amivi has requested her first loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy rice, oil, tomatoes, and various other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, tomatoes, and various other items

loans.name: Las Rescatadas Para Dios Group

texts.es:
el grupo RESCATADAS PARA DIOS, esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista Sur de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Los integrantes de este grupo se conocen muy bien, la señora Maria Angela es líder del grupo, tiene de 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de ella, se ha dedicado a la compra venta de ropa nueva, sandalias, venta cosméticos, este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante de casa en casa por las aldeas y caseríos aledaños a su comunidad. Maria tiene mas de dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
al igual que sus otras dos compañeras de grupo las señoras Isabel se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pescado, y Dina Alexandra se dedica a la venta de tortillas y charamuscas.
el préstamo lo utilizaran para surtir sus negocios.
El sueño de doña Maria Angela es mejorar su casa en el menor tiempo posible.
texts.en:
The Rescatadas Paradios group is located in the Buena Vista Sur neighborhood in San Lorenzo.  All the members know each other very well and Maria Angela is the group leader.

She is 37, a single mother, and she has four dependent children.  She has  bought and sold new clothing, sandals, and cosmetics for more than two years.  She goes from house to house selling in the villages and small farms around her communitiy.  

As do her other companions in the group, Isabel sells tortillas and fish, and Dina Alexandra sells tortillas and juices in plastic bags.

They will use the loan to supply their businesses.

Maria Angela's dream is to improve her house in the shortest time possible.

loans.use: to buy sandals, clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 38 years old and married with three children. To earn a living, she runs a grocery stall. She has operated the business for eight years. She has retained her business because of the financial support from Faulu Kenya. Previously, she was in farming. Esther hopes to have a fully established business within five years so that she can generate more income for her family. With 40,000 Kes, she will buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” del distrito Ilave en el departamento Puno y tiene 32 años. Está casada y tiene una hija y un hijo de dos y cuatro años. 
Desde pequeña le gustaba vender y su madre se lo enseñó. Desde hace cuatro años lleva su puesto de chiflería y hace un año que tiene una bodeguita instalada en su propia casa. Inició este negocio con un capital de S./ 1,000.00. Con el nuevo préstamo de S./ 1,000.00 va a comprar productos para su tienda como leche, atún, gaseosas y aceites.

Nos cuenta que aún vende sus productos de chiflería (varios/diversos de uso personal) de forma ambulatoria.
Su madre fue quien la invitó a ser socia en Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años. Lo que le gusta mucho con Manuela es el ahorro y las reuniones, donde se divierte y ríe mucho.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Generacion 2000” in the district of Llave in the department of Puno. She is 32 years old, married and has a daughter aged 2 and a son aged 4. 

From childhood she loved to sell and her mother taught her. For the past 4 years she has had a street stall selling natural remedies and for the past year a small store located in her own house. She started this business with a capital of S./1,000.00 (PEN). With the new loan of S./1,000.00 (PEN)she  is going to buy products for her shop such as milk, tuna, sodas and oil.

She tells us that she still sells her natural remedies (various/miscellaneous for personal use) as a street vendor.

Her mother was the one who invited her to become a member of Manuela Ramos 2 years ago. What she likes a lot about Manuela is the savings and the meetings where she has a lot of fun and laughs.

loans.use: to buy tuna, oil and other products for her shop.

loans.name: Melanio

texts.en: Melanio is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. He has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Melanio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melanio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 58 años de edad, convive con Adrián de 59 años, con quien tuvo un solo hijo fruto de una relación amorosa y duradera. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en distrito de Pichari. Por sus venas corre sangre de agricultor, dedicado al cultivo de cacao, ya que generalmente en su comunidad casi todos se dedican  a la actividad agrícola. Actualmente ella se ocupa a cultivar cacao con ayuda de su hijo, su esposo, pero cuando es tiempo de cosecha, debe contratar peones. Ella ya viene ejerciendo esta labor desde que era pequeña, y hasta el momento continua ejerciéndolo, pero más adelante desea comprar más terrenos, para así producir en grandes volúmenes y por consiguiente, vender su productos a los centros de acopio de Pichari. El único inconveniente que tiene es que su parcela se encuentra en un lugar accidentado, que no tiene acceso de movilidad y le es muy forzoso el de trasladar sus productos cosechados a la ciudad. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que ella esta agradecida y comprometida una vez más en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en contratar peones que le ayuden a cuidar y limpiar sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en: Marcelina is 58 years old. She lives with Adrián who is 59 years old and with whom she had an only child, fruit of a loving and lasting relationship. They live in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Farmer's blood runs through her veins and she grows cocoa. For the most part the people in her area are farmers. Currently she grows cocoa with the help of her son and her husband but at harvest time she has to hire farm labourers. She has been doing this work since she was very young and continues to do so up until now. However, in the future she wants to buy more land in order to produce bigger quantities and so sell her produce to the Pichari collection centres. The only drawback she has is that her plot of land is located in an isolated area without public access which makes it very difficult for her to transport her harvest to the city. This will be her 2nd loan with MFP for which she is very grateful and she agrees once again to make her repayments punctually. With the money that she is requesting she will hire farm labourers to help her care for and maintain her cocoa plantations.

loans.use: to hire manual labourers.

loans.name: That

texts.en:
That (in the photo) sells Chinese noodles with soup in her village. Her husband, Mao, is a construction worker and helps his wife in the business when he is free. The couple has been married since 1993 and has three children--one son and two daughters. One is a garment worker, one attends school, and another one is still young. The family is living in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

That asked for a Kiva loan once already. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of US $1,000 to buy one more motorbike for her daughter who is a garment worker to get to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her daughter to get work

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 47 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hijos en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías y las vende también.
Se dedica exclusivamente a la artesanía fabricando hamacas, frazadas, colchas etc. Vende sus productos en su propio domicilio otros vendedores ambulantes de la zona. Comenta que cuenta con un buen promedio de clientes ya que sus productos son de primera calidad y los precios son muy rentables para la compra y venta.
Aprendió la profesión de su madre ya que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la  artesanía y su padre se dedicaba al cultivo haciendo labores de la campo. Fue su mama la que le  inculcó para que se dedique de lleno en la artesanía y a la  venta para que así pueda crecer como persona y como profesional y de la misma forma poder ayudar  a su familia  a crecer económicamente.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y tintes de color para la fabricación de las artesanías que ella elabora. Está muy contenta con la ayuda que le brinda la fundación y kiva, pues es de gran ayuda todo lo que ellos hacen.
texts.en:
Matilde is 47 years old and lives with her three children in the city of Carapeguá.  She makes and sells arts and crafts.

She makes hammocks, blankets, bedspreads, etc. and sells her products out of her home to other mobile salespeople in her zone.  She says that she has a good number of customers because her products are of good quality and very profitable for buying and selling.

She learned this art from her mother who used to be an artisan.  Her father was a farmer.  It was her mother who encouraged her to make and sell her crafts so that she could grow as a person and as a professional, and at the same time help her family financially.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy thread and dyes so she can make her crafts.  She is very happy about the support from Kiva because what they do is very helpful.

loans.use: to by thread and dye.

loans.name: Doris Janette

texts.es: Doris Janette tiene 22 años su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general desde hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a este tipo de rubro. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con este medio de vida, ella siempre esta agradecida por brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, perfumes, calzado entre otros productos.
texts.en: Doris Janette is 22. She has sold general merchandise for over three years. Through great hard work, she has been able to get ahead through this work. She is always grateful to be able to offer her family an income. She will use this loan for the purchase of shoes, cosmetics, general clothing, perfumes, and other products.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, general clothing, and perfume, among other items.

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en: Vin is 61 years old.  She is married and the mother of five children, only one of which is a dependent. She is a farmer in a village of the Prey Chhor district.  She has been farming for 28 years.  In addition, she supplements her income by growing spices.  At this time, she earns about $6 per day with her current business and saves $1.50 per day for the future.  Given her current income and positive business results after her first loan, Vin and her group member are applying for another loan.  Vin will use this loan and her cumulative savings to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm for $175.  This loan will enable her to increase both her crop yield and her income, as well as to build some savings for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is 38-years of age, a hardworking and loving family man. He has been engaged in the cultivation of agricultural crops for more than eight years. Mainly, he grows rice as a source of income. He carefully takes care of his business to gain high profits. Truthfully, he is asking for the loan amount of P13,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his business.

He hopes to produce abundant crops through the farm inputs to be purchased to save for his three children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his business.

loans.name: Quenia Mercedes

texts.es: Quenia, de 39 años de edad, originaria de Leon,esta agradecida por la ayuda recibida atravez del prestamo kiva este es la primerra vez que trabaja con este tipo de prestamo que ha sido muy positivo para su negocio pues lo invirtio en compra de materia prima, como maiz, cal y leña sus ventas aumentaron. Ahora ella solicita un segndo credito para compra de materia prima para hacer tortillas, tambien cemento,arena y madera. Ya que quiere comenzar hacer reparaciones en su casa poco a poco asi mismo mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Quenia is 39 years old and is from Leon originally. 

She is grateful for the help she has received through a loan from Kiva. This is the first time that she has worked with this type of loan, and it has been very positive for her business. She used it to buy staples such as corn, lime and firewood. Her sales have increased. 

Now she is asking for a second loan in order to buy staples such as tortillas, also cement, sand and wood. She wants to begin to make repairs to her home little by little and likewise improve her business conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make tortillas, and also to buy cement, sand, and wood

loans.name: Jorelyn

texts.en:
Jorelyn is from Macupa Tangub. She is 40 years old. Jorelyn is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Jorelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting & harvesting banana for sale. Jorelyn has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Jorelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jorelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,551 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Jethro

texts.en:
Jethro is 60 years old.  He has four children aged 30, 25, 22, and 18 years.  His spouse, Gladys, is a primary school teacher.  He is a poultry farmer in Kapsabet and has been in business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of 16,000 KES.

He has borrowed a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD.  This is his third term loan after servicing the previous loan successfully.  He wishes to use this loan to purchase more chickens to rear on his farm.  He will use the anticipated profit to improve the living standards of his family.

He hopes to increase the number of chickens he rears and also to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Nyame Nti Group

texts.en:
Ajara is 52 years old woman who is  happily married with six children. Her youngest child is 15 and is still attending school. Ajara lives with her family in Efutu Koforidua in the Central Region of Ghana. 
 Ajara is a member of the Nyame Nti Group. All the group members reside within the same community. 

Ajara has been farming for the past 25 years with a lot of experiences. She grows palm and oranges for a living. She also owns a small provisions shop at her home to supplement her income.

Ajara and her group members are active members of their farming association. The association is responsible for marketing their crops to local industrial buyers. 

Ajara's main challenge  is the maintenance of her farm as it is physically demanding. She is faced with the challenge of financing the cost of hired labour in pruning and weeding the farm. Additionally, Ajara has to buy fertilizer and insect traps to ensure her crops grow well and are protected from pests.  A micro-loan of GHC1,000 will allow Ajara to maximize her yield and profit. Ajara plans to invest her profit into her provisions store, as well as to further her child's education. Ajara thanks all micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to hire laborers and purchase important farming inputs such as fertilizer and insect traps.

loans.name: Flor De Pisonay De Cachona Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FLOR DE PISONAY DE CACHORA.
La socia Beatriz tiene 34 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con du negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.

Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos por la cantidad de socios y las socias que estan adjuntas pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
This [communal bank] member belongs to the communal bank "Flor de Pisonay de Cachora."

Bank member Beatriz is 34 years old. She has three children and lives with her partner. She divides her time between her daily tasks and working in her business of selling food. She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes to be able to obtain more earnings through her business so that in the way she can continue supporting her family. She makes various types of dishes for her customers who come to her, since this is the way she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan for the purchase of rice, oil, and meat, among other items.

The members who are shown in the added photograph asked permission to arrive late for the meeting for work reasons.

The members in general are grateful for the loan granted [to them] and promise to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and meats, among other items.

loans.name: Adakou

texts.en:
Madam Adakou A. is 43 years old. Today, she is a widower and with six (06) children at her charges. This big responsibility recommends her to undertake income generative activities in order to be able to provide for her childrens needs: feedings, health cares, education. That is how she is launched in the fire wood trade with the modest amount of $ 55 which she had at her disposal. This activity consists concretely to travel to the villages to buy fire wood and in return to sell it at Kpémé where she is living and where the wood is very rare, especially for the kitchen. Madam A. does not succeeding to satisfy all her customers because she hasn’t enough fund to make a permanent storage of fire wood. She tries sometimes to refer to the usurers, who destroyed her more for the interest rates are high, more than 300%. So, today, she needs $ 450 to constitute a working capital for the supplying, the fire wood transportation and storage to increase her activities and to improve her family living conditions.

Madame A. Adakou âgée de 43 ans. Aujourd’hui, elle est une veuve et a à sa charge six (06) enfants. Cette grande responsabilité lui recommande d’entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants : alimentations, soins de santé, scolarisation… C’est ainsi qu’elle se lança dans le commerce du bois de chauffe avec la modeste somme de $55 qu’elle disposait. Cette activité consiste en pratique à aller dans les villages pour acheter du bois de chauffe et venir le revendre à Kpémé où elle réside et où le bois se fait très rare, surtout pour la cuisine. Madame A. n’arrive pas à satisfaire tous les clients parce qu’elle ne dispose pas d’un capital suffisant pour faire un stock permanent de bois de chauffe. Elle tente parfois de faire recours aux usuriers, ce qui l’a ruiné davantage car les taux d’intérêt sont exorbitants, plus de 300%. Elle a donc besoin aujourd’hui d’un crédit de $ 450 pour constituer un fond de commerce pour l’approvisionnement, le transport et le stockage du bois de chauffe pour augmenter ses activités et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Fire woods supplying,transportation and storage

loans.name: Kossi T.

texts.en:
Born in 1967, Mr. Kossi T. M. is married and father of one child. He is a mechanic by trade, although he makes very little in this profession. He has changed his career focus and is now a vulcanizer. Mr. M. is finally starting to turn a small profit thanks to this change in careers. He is honest and is a good risk to the loan. He is asking for a loan of $800 which will allow him to buy chemicals and equipment needed in the vulcanization process. Through this loan he will be able to improve the quality of life of his family.

Translated from French by David Pigott, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1967 Monsieur M. T. Kossi est marié et père d’un enfant. Mécanicien de profession, il constate que ce métier lui remportait peu de bénéfice. Alors il changea de spécialité et devient vulcanisateur et il arrive subvenir aux besoins exprimés grâce aux revenus que lui procure son métier. Honnête, il fait preuve d’une bonne gestion de ses activités. Il sollicite un crédit de $800 qui servira à l’achat de certains matériels de vulcanisation. Il pourra ainsi contribuer efficacement à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of rubber vulcanization materials.

loans.name: Shakar

texts.en: Shakar G. lives in Beylagan, where she has a small booth in the village of Ashigli. She established her business 5 years ago. In 2007, she received a loan from Normicro, Beylagan Branch, and was able to buy more products for her booth. Now her business is doing very well.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en: Mrs. Yorng P. is 44 and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia with her husband and their 7 children. She sells Khmer noodles to the people in her village, and earns about 3 USD a day in profits. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns about 5 USD a day. This loan will be used for the purchase of a motorbike so she can stop paying daily fees for taxis. This way, she can take her children to school and her husband to work for a cheaper price per day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her husband to work

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 40 years old and has 8 children. Her husband works in the corn fields. Maria makes table clothes, napkins and hand embroidered handicrafts and then she sells them to the wholesalers of the city. She belongs to the group EscueL. 3 along with Mrs. Rosa Lopez D. L. C. who also works as an artisan, but she sells them at the handicraft market. They will both invest the loan in buying embroidery floss, and they will mend the looms they use for the making of their hand-maD. fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 40 años, 8 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en el cultivo del maíz, elL. se dedica a L. confección D. manteles, servilletas y prendas artesanales bordadas que venD. a los mayoristas D. L. ciudad. Pertenece al grupo EscueL. 3 junto con doña Rosa López D. L. C. quien también trabaja como artesana D. prendas D. vestir bordadas pero ellas las venD. en el mercado D. las artesanías. Con el préstamo ambas invertirán comprando telas, hilos D. bordar y arreglaran sus telares manuales que elL. mismas confección para bordar sus telas.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Wendy Amarilys

texts.en:
Wendy is 27 years old and is a single mother. Her 8-year-old only-begotten son goes to a private school in Santo Domingo, the capital. Wendy is finishing the last semester of Basic Education at the university. Six months ago, Wendy started her business with a loan that she had taken from our organization. She used her loan wisely and repaid it in the agreed time.

Wendy sells shoes, clothes, spreads (for beds), earrings and bracelets. She has a well established clientele in her university. Wendy is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more products to sell during the Christmas season. That way, she’ll increase her income and continue taking care of her son.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, spreads and earrings in order to satisfy her customers' needs, and to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda is married and has one child.  Mavjuda first came to Microinvest 5 years ago. With her first loan she was able to expand her business and become more poriftable. Mavjuda plans to get a new loan to purchase an assortment of children clothes and expand her business once again.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: for purchasing winter assortment of children clothes

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando Mendez is a married man responsible for three sons. For 10 years he has been selling basic grains which he sells in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua.

He began his business with U$200 that he saved over a long period of time. It is necessary to note that he is a strong and hardworking man that has known how to respond to the call of being a father who supports his three small children that study in elementary school.

He has worked with Ceprodel for two years, having received loans that he has taken advantage of wisely to better his and his family’s living conditions. He has a history of 13 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Fernando Mendez es un caballero casado y con tres hijos a su responsabilidad. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la veta de granos básicos los cuales son vendidos en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Inició su negocio con un capital de U$ 200 que los obtuvo por medio de sus ahorros de largo tiempo. Es de suma necesidad destacar que es un hombre esforzado y trabajador que ha sabido responder al llamado de ser padre manteniendo a sus tres pequeños hijos que cursan la etapa escolar.

Desde hace dos años ha trabaja con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado créditos que los ha aprovechado muy sabiamente para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Actualmente tiene un record de 13 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Kurbongul was born in 1962, is divorced and has 4 children. She has been selling clothing at the “Safariyon” market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan for 4 years. She brings her products herself from Bishkek. (Kurbongul is on the right in the photo and Baroat is on the left). Baroat is Kurbongul’s close friend and they often help each other on their trips from Bishkek. Kurbongul is an honest woman and has a strong character.

Kurbongul successfully pays back her loans and has a stable business with good profits. Her products are in demand among local customers. When she heard about KIVA, Kurbongul decided to apply for an additional loan to expand her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонгул,1962 года рождения,разведена,имеет 4 детей.Торгует одеждой уже 4 года на рынке"Сафариён",Душанбе,Таджикистан.Товары привозит сама из Бишкека вместе со своей подругой Бароат.(Курбонгул с права и Бароат слева)Она является её близкой подругой и часто они помогают друг другу в дороге из Бишкека.Курбонгул честная женьщина и сильная по характеру человек.Она успешно погашает свой займ и имеет стабильный бизнес с хорошей прибылью.Её товары имеют хороший спрос среди местных потребителей. Услышав о КИВЕ она захотела получить дополнительный займ на расширение ассортимента.

loans.use: Purchase of winter jackets and warm cardigans

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta is a member of the communal bank called, "Friendship and Peace", and lives in the San Martin region, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in her own home in Jirón La merced Nº 301. She has a small grocery store where she sells staple goods, sweets, and other edible products of daily consumption. She started selling lollipops, ice, and carbonated drinks in a little kiosk store and bit by bit it has been growing to its current level of success.

With a loan of US$450, which she will repay in six months, Enriqueta will buy noodles of different varieties and brands in packets, cases of jam, rice and sugar, and cooking oil in liter bottles. She buys these products because they are in high demand in her area, and to also supply a stock of carbonated beverages and sweets.

Enriqueta is 51 years old, has three children: a daughter and two sons. She is a very responsible woman. Her dreams of getting ahead in life and helping her husband with the education of her children, motivated her to develop herself as a business woman. She considers herself a fighter and perseverant, and feels that her dedication to business and her unconditional support to her family is a great example for her sons.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Enriqueta es socia del banco comunal “Amistad y Paz”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, distrito D. Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa ubicada en el Jirón La merced Nº 301, tiene una Bodega donD. venD. abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles D. consumo diario. Se inició vendiendo chupetes, hielo y gaseosas en un pequeño puesto D. ventas y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta lograr lo que ahora tiene. El préstamo D. S/. 1,300, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará fideos D. distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botellas D. un litro. Estos productos los compra debido a que son muy requeridos en la zona y también para surtir el stock D. bebidas gasificadas y golosinas. Enriqueta tiene 51 años D. edad, 3 hijos, una mujer y dos varones. Es una mujer muy responsable, sus deseos D. salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la educación D. sus hijos la impulsó a desarrollarse como pequeña empresaria. Se considera luchadora, perseverante y siente que es un gran ejemplo para sus hijos por su dedicación al negocio y apoyo incondicional a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of staple items (noodles, rice, sugar, jam, etc.)

loans.name: Marina Genoveva

texts.es:
Marina works in a noodle manufacturing plant. She works as an operator in different shifts. In her spare time and during the weekends she earns money cleaning and doing laundry for two women. She has been cleaning their houses for a long time. Her husband works in the auto bodywork business in the Abra area of the city. This couple has three children ages 12, 9 and 5.

Marina has many years of experience in the cleaning business. On the other hand, she has been working at the noodle plant for one year. Her husband has over five years of experience in the auto bodywork business. The competition in the different businesses is significantly high, but the families that hire Marina trust her, which means she always gets work from them. Additionally, her husband's clients know him well and trust him to do a good job.

The loan will be used to purchase tools for modern auto bodywork. Marina has a good credit history and a good payment record.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Marina trabaja en una fabrica de fideos como operaria en diferentes turnos y en los momentos libres y fines de semana se dedica a efectuar labores de limpieza en la casa de dos señoras desde hace mucho tiempo atrás, también en las mismas casas lava ropa. Su esposo es chapero y trabaja en la zona del Abra. Esta pareja tiene tres hijos de 12, 9 y 5 años respectivamente.

En el rubro de limpieza tiene muchos años de experiencia, mientras que en la planta de fideos trabaja desde hace un año, por otra parte su espos tiene una experiencia de más de 5 años en el negocio de la chapería.

La competencia en los diferentes negocios es bastante elevada, pero la confianza de las familias que contratan los servicios de Marina hacen que ella tenga trabajo seguro en estas casas, además que los clientes conocen también muy bien a su esposo y confian en él sus trabajos. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de herramientas para la chapería moderna. Marina tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y un buen comportamiento de pagos.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her husband's auto bodywork business.

loans.name: Chantha Mech Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha M. is the group leader of a group of four members in Kralanh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 29 and a widow with two children whom are students. She is a basket and mat seller who can generate a small income to support the family. The household relies only on Mrs. Chantha Meh's work. She never obtained a loan from any MFI and now she has the chance to obtain one in order to improve her business and thus her family's conditions. With this loan, she would like to buy raw materials to make her baskets.

loans.use: These women would like to buy raw materials to make baskets to sell.

loans.name: Esthela

texts.es:
Esthela started her business to add an additional source of income. Her husband no longer has a stable job, and surely they fought hard to maintain the education costs of their children and when someone got sick. She began on year ago by herself, making and selling tamales.

Now Esthela is applying for a six month US $600 loan to buy ingredients for her tamales and to buy a larger steamer.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Esthela inició el negocio para poder tener un ingreso adicional, ya que su esposo al no tener un trabajo estable y seguro batallaban mucho debido a los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos y tambien gastos cuando se me enfermaban. Comenzó hace mas de un año, por iniciativa propia con la elaboracion y venta de tamales.

Solicita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir mas materia prima y poder comprar una vaporera mas grande.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her tamale sales, and invest in a larger steamer

loans.name: Sdeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Sdeung Y., age 46, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country's famous Angkor Wat Temples. Since 2000, she has been selling rice to earn a living and is able to earn up to 5 USD per day. Her husband, Chan Ra, is a local doctor who also earns around 5 USD per day. Together the couple has six children, two of whom are married.

Mrs. Sdeung is seeking a loan of 700 USD to help her husband's medical business, with $500 going toward the purchase of a motorbike so he can visit patients in their homes. The rest of the loan will be applied toward medicinal supplies.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and medicine

loans.name: La Salvacion Group

texts.en: Elias J., 70, is the father of 6, aged 19, 19, 28, 30, 32, and 33.  Though he is supporting only two of them, he still struggles since he is a single father.  With his first Esperanza Bank of Hope loan, Elias is starting a business distributing goods like crackers, gum, and mints, but hopes to open his own store with future loans.  For now though, his main focus is on maintaining a stable income.  Elias is a group leader in his Bank of Hope, La Salvacion ("The Salvation").

loans.use: Goods distribution

loans.name: Chamroen

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroen N., 41, is a farmer while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. They live in Vatamim Commune, Battambang Province. Chamroen has five children, all of whom live in the family's home and attend school. She has been growing rice since 1996 and the rice crop provides the main income for her family. She always takes care of this business. 

It is rice growing season in Cambodia. In order to increase the family's income, she would like to request a loan to plow more farmland, and also to purchase fertilizer in order to increase the rice yield. This loan will allow her to improve their living conditions. Chamroen and her husband are pictured with their children.

loans.use: To plow more farmland and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing so as to keep operating her small business

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionisia tiene 35 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente y madre de 03 hijos (una mujer de 15 años y 02 varones de 12 y 04 años de edad). Vive en el Barrio San Martín, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde hace 05 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri. Con su crédito inicial de S/.300 compró fibra de alpaca, lana de ovino y cuero de alpaca. Desde hace 05 años se dedica a la compra y venta de fibra de alpaca, sale a las comunidades a comprar y vende a los mayoristas de Juliaca conjuntamente con su esposo.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará S/.500 de fibra de alpaca según calidad y con los otros S/.500 comprará cueros de alpaca a S/.16 la libra.

Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave para que sus hijos estudien en dicha ciudad.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 35 years old and she finished primary school. She has a common law partner and she is the mother of 3 children (the girl is 15 years old, and the two boys are 12 and 4 years old). They live in the region of San Martin, in the district of Conduiri within the province of El Collao in Puno.

She has been a member for 5 years at the community bank "Maria Parado de Bellido" in Conduiri. With her first loan of S/.300 she purchased alpaca and sheep wool and alpaca hide. For the past 5 years she has been buying and selling alpaca wool, going to communities to purchase and sell to wholesalers in Juliaca together with her husband.

With this loan of S/.1000, which will be repaid in 3 terms, she will purchase S/.500 worth of alpaca wool, depending on quality, and with the remaining S/.500 she will purchase alpaca hide at S/.16 per pound.

Her dream is to purche a house in the city of Ilave so that her children can attend school in that city./p>

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca wool, depending on quality, and alpaca hide.

loans.name: Muniran Ali Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Muniran baji is a wife of A. A.. They live in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Muniran baji has been living in this city for the past 10 years.

She is a very hardworking lady. She helps her husband to improve the financial condition of their family with her business. She knits clothes. Her husband works in a workshop.

They have two sons. Both of her sons help their father in repairing vehicles in the workshop.

Muniran baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy tools to start a motor workshop for her husband and her sons so they can have their own shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy chicken for her chicken selling business. Asia parveen baji wants a loan to buy tools for her bicycle repair business. Kaneez baji wants a loan to buy items such as chairs and tables for her barber saloon. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy tools to start a motor workshop

loans.name: Chun's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group of three members. 

Mrs. S. was selected to be group leader. Chun S., 26, is an ice-cream seller in Battambang Town, which is located in the west of Cambodia. She is married to Mr. Sok Vanny who is motorcycle taxi driver. They have one child. Her older sister and aunt also live with family. 

To bring more income, S. needs a loan to purchase a cart to transport her ice-cream to sell by transporting it to the customer's home. 

The other three are:
Mrs. S., 46, is a seller of cooked rice and needs a loan to use for her business. 
Mrs. Yen K., 45, is housewife and needs a loan to use for her husband's business. 
Mrs. Van Y., 57, is vegetable seller and needs a loan to use for her husband's business. 
These people live in Orchar Village, Battambang Province.

loans.use: to purchase a cart to transport her ice-cream

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Amalia P. S. tiene 49 años es presidenta de su Banco Comunal, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Victor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3er ciclo de contabilidad, tiene 02 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Amalia se dedica a la venta de ollas, inicio su negocio vendiendo de puerta en puerta, poco a poco se hizo conocida y ahora tiene clientes que llegan a buscarla a su casa, a la vez tiene a su cargo un wawawasi,  negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ollas.
Amalia tiene el sueño de construir su casa y viajar a EE.UU.
texts.en:
Amalia P. S. is 49 years old and has 2 dependent children. She is the president of the Community Bank. She took an accountant course. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Amalia sells kitchen supplies. She started her business selling products door to door and now she has clients who go to her house to purchase her products. She also runs a Wawa Wasi (children’s daycare center) at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to make improvement to her business facilities. With this $250 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase more kitchen supplies. Amalia’s dream is to finish building her home and travel to the US.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen supplies for her business

loans.name: Halimdjon

texts.ru:
