Абдуалимов Халимджон, 1973 года рождения, женат, имеет 3 детей. Начал свой бизнес с продажи хозтоваров и его стаж в этой деятельности 4 лет. Он торгует на рынке «Панчшер» города Душанбе хозяйственными товарами. В его ассортименте имеются электропечь, электроплита, пылесосы, светильники, ведра. Также в продажи имеются разновидность чайников, посуды, термосы, утюги, кухонные комбайны и т.д. С увеличением спроса на электроплиты и печи, Халимджон  хочет пополнить свой товар, увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая. 
Халимджон хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить электропечи.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Halimdjon A. is married and has 3 children. He started his business of selling household products four years ago and has a retail outlet at the Panchsher market in Dushanbe. His goods assortment includes electric stoves, vacuum cleaners, lamps and buckets. He also sells tea pots, dishes, thermoses, irons, food processors, etc. He buys his goods at the Korvon wholesale market and from Chinese distributors. Due to an increasing demand for electric stoves, Halimdjon wants to add goods to his inventory, increase turnover and profits. He wants to obtain an $1100 loan to purchase electric stoves.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electric stoves purchase

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: E. is 36 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has three children; all of them are single and attend school. She is married to Ra, 39, who works as a motor taxi driver. E. has been a fish seller since 1999. She gets up early every morning to buy the fishes from the fishermen along the riverside and takes them to the market. She uses a bicycle for her business but it is difficult for her as she is now becoming older. E. is looking for a loan to buy one motorbike for her business and her family. The loan will help the family have a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy one motorbike for her business and her family

loans.name: Tsermaa

texts.en: Tsermaa M. is 44 and married with two children in elementary school. She and her family moved from the countryside to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, 15 years ago. They sold all of their livestock when they moved, and opened a small butcher business in the city. Tsermaa purchases wholesale meat from the countryside and resells it in her stall in the local market. She is requesting this loan to buy more mutton to resell. One day she hopes to be able to supply meat to her clients on a larger scale. She would like to be able to invest in her children's higher education and purchase an apartment with running hot water in the future.

loans.use: to buy more mutton

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake is a hair stylist. She fixes and braids hair for people living in her area. She is thirty-one years old and married with three children. She is planning to sell drinks in her shop, and is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase a generator and refrigerators for selling cold drinks. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and refrigerators

loans.name: Sidikat

texts.en: Sidikat, 55 years old and married with four children, has a store where she sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase additional foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
This is Mariatu K., Ramatu C., Ramatu K., Wullamatu K., Adamsay K. and Hassan T.. They have named their group Believe in God. This is a group of local entrepreneurs in Makeni City. This is the fourth time they’ve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one of them in the group received a loan of (~US$250) SLL 800,000. Meaningful changes were created in lives of these people with those previous loans. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees, in cases where times were difficult for their husbands. They also were able to add to the daily allowances that their husbands gave them for food. Today, they are requesting a loan of (US$ 315) SLL 1,000,000, each, to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Mariatu K. (second from left) is the leader of the group. She is 30 years of age. She was born in Sanda Kamaranka, one of a series of small villages about thirty miles from Makeni. She has four children: one in secondary school, two in primary schools and the last is still quite young. Her husband is a schoolteacher. Mariatu sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been in the business for three years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business of ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Richel Mae

texts.en: Richel Mae D.  is 26 years old, single, and presently resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her hogs. She has been a member of PAGLAUM MPC since February 2008 and she says that with the help of PMPC-Micofinance Program, her business has grown in a way that she has better income now than before. She hopes to have her own family someday and able to provide a decent life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Maria Emília

texts.pt:
Maria Emilia C. nasceu em Gaza no distrito de Guija (onde produz se muito caju), casada e mãe de 3 filhos de idades compreendidas entre 19 e 29 anos encontrando se todos a estudarem.
Maria tem formação media pelo Instituto comercial de Maputo. Saiu de Guija com os seus pais quando tinha apenas dois anos de idade e cresceu na cidade de Maputo, com a sua família.
Vive em boane e em casa própria, sem ninguém mais pessoas sob sua responsabilidade. É coordenadora adjunta numa Organização social que opera no distrito, onde ganha um salário mensal no valor de 8.000,00MT por mês.

Desenvolve actividade de venda de panelas há mais de quarto anos, aprendeu com sua cunhada que também faz à mesma actividade. O custo de cada item varia de 120,00MT a 500,00MT e com boa rotação.
Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo com a hluvuku e já se beneficiou de outros créditos com outras instituições. Aderiu ao hluvuku através de informações que os amigos deram de encorajamento para tal.

O seu primeiro crédito com a hluvuku foi de 6.000,00MT e 12.000,00MT, respectivamente, que os aplicou neste negocio. Concluiu pagamentos em harmonia com o combinado do contrato de empréstimo.
Diz que o seu negocio vai melhorar com este valor de 15.000,00MT que se destina ao reforço do negocio.
Tem como objectivo expandir o negocio e comprar um molde para fazer panelas, pessoalmente e contratar trabalhadores para lhe ajudarem no trabalho.
texts.en:
Maria Emilia C. was born in Gaza Province, in the Guija district (where there a lot of cashews are produced). She left at the age of two with her parents, and was raised in Maputo. Maria is a married mother of three. Her children are between the ages of 19 and 29 and are currently studying. She lives in Boane (Mozambique), in her own home and is not responsible for any additional people. Maria has studied at the Commercial Institute of Maputo, and is the coordinator of a social organization located in her district, where her monthly salary is 8,000 MZM. Maria has sold pots and pans for more than four years, learning the business from her sister-in-law. The cost of each item varies between 120 and 500 MZM, and her inventory turnover is good. Maria received information about Hluvuku from friends, who encouraged her to apply for a loan. While Maria has benefited from loans through other institutions, this is her third loan with Hluvuku. The first loan from Hluvuku was for 6,000 MZM and the second was for 12,000 MZM; both were applied to her business. Each loan was repaid based on its terms. Maria will use this loan to buy a mold to make the pots and pans herself, hiring other workers to help her. She believes her business will grow by 15,000 MZM with this new investment.

Translated from Portuguese by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a mold for pots and pans in order to increase her inventory

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida M. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Missamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and married with four adult children. Adelaida owns a sari-sari (general) store. Her income comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. to the local community. She has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2000 PHP per month. In 2009, Adelaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business activities and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to put any additional revenue back into her business to continue to grow it. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Nakasero East Namboze Kevin Group

texts.en: N. Kevin is a married twenty-five-year-old lady blessed with two children going to school. She is the group leader of Nakasero East and has a restaurant which has been operating for more than four years. She is planning to use the loan to purchase restaurant items, such as food (bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, sauce, meat, fish, vegetables, ground nuts, etc.). She is an active businesswoman whose dream is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: Purchasing restaurant supplies

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna M. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 21 years old. Joanna is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Joanna's main source of income comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Joanna has been in  business for more than a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Joanna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joanna has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Joanna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Joanna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and supplies

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca M. sells groceries at a market in Cape Coast. Rebecca has received a junior high school education.  She is a widow and has four children.  Rebecca has been selling groceries since 1991. She is responsible for providing food for her children, paying their school fees and also paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to purchase more groceries and other goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and other goods for sale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana P. is getting close to retirement age but never seems to get tired of the things she does every day. She is now 59 years old and all her five children are now grown-ups. She lives with her husband, Gabino, 60, a carpenter. Juliana owns and manages a general store which she started two years ago. She also makes foot rugs weaved from scrap fabric trimmings she gets from neighboring garment factories. She has a small workshop for the foot rugs in her backyard. Juliana also maintains a gaming arcade where kids and kids-at-heart enjoy playing. All these business activities provide Juliana with a sure monthly net income of P10,000. Juliana became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006, the same year when she ventured into making foot rugs and started making money out of scrap fabric. She currently applied for a loan in the amount of P8,000 to buy more scrap fabrics from garment factories which she will use for the production of foot rugs. Juliana is very thankful for having a happy family. She has been dreaming of owning a vehicle they can use to sustain their business. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap fabric trimmings for her foot rug business

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita M. is from the village of Claveria in Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Normelita is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Normelita runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Normelita just started this business.

In 2009, Normelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Normelita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be  Normelita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Almar

texts.en:
Almar M. is from the village of Danao. He is 19 years old. Almar is single. To make a living, Almar owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Almar is just starting this business.

In 2009, Almar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Almar is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Almar from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anjelyn

texts.en:
Anjelyn is a single mother of two: Dennis and Scholar (20 and 14 years-old respectively).

She was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and this will be her second loan from KADET. Anjelyn has no bad credit history. She has been in the curios business for four years and with this loan she intends to increase her stock of wild animal carvings. These are in high demand during the festive season.

Anjelyn's area of business is situated in a densely populated area. She relies on foreigners as her customers, as they are the ones that most often purchase curios. With the extra profits she earns, the client hopes to pay school fees for her children.

Anjelyn's dream is to venture into foreign markets. She believes she is focused and hardworking.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase her stock of animal carvings to sell to foreigners

loans.name: Nortoji

texts.en:
B. Nortoji is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Nortoji's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and family. That was why Nortoji decided to start her own business twenty-five years ago, selling fabrics for the national dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by offering her clients to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $1400. With this money, Nortoji will be able to buy seasonal fabrics. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fabrics, increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Marilu Dolores

texts.es:
La socia MARILU DOLORES pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos; dos mujeres y un varón. Los hijos mayores estudian en el colegio en el nivel secundario y el menor en el nivel primario. Ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella trabaja por las mañanas como auxiliar en un jardín y por las tardes alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de leña y madera. Nuestra socia viaja los fines de semana a las ciudades de Chicheros y Anta para cotizar el precio de la leña y madera para luego comprar. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere casar a adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y leña así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marilu Dolores is a member of the Communal Bank “Vilcanota”. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children (two daughters and a son). The two older children attend high school while the youngest one is in elementary school. She and her family live in the province of Urubamba, which is located north of the city of Cusco.

Marilu works in the mornings as an assistant gardener. In the afternoons, she divides her time between her household activities and selling firewood and lumber. Marilu travels on the weekends to the cities of Chicheros and Anta to negotiate the price of firewood and lumber for subsequent purchase. She has been in this business for a number of years and has done very well thanks to all of her efforts. Marilu is a hardworking and enterprising mother who wants to succeed for the sake of her children. She is requesting this loan in order to buy lumber and firewood as a way of generating more income. This will enable her to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Marilu is grateful for this opportunity and promises to submit her payments on the scheduled due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood & lumber

loans.name: Javier Arnoldo

texts.es: Javier es padre de familia, tiene un hijo de 14 meses, el señor realiza una actividad comercial de servicio de moto taxi, tiene 2 años de trabajar en este negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo a podido salir adelante el y su familia, por lo que busca la manera de cómo ganarse la vida y mantener a su familia de una manera decente. El está muy contento con este negocio que es su principal fuente de ingresos ya que siempre se preocupa por mejorar cada en el servicio de su negocio. el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo como es proporcionarle mejoras a sus moto taxi, y reparar ciertas cosas como llantas, asientos entre otras cosas. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio.
texts.en:
Javier has a 14 month old son. His business is a “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). He has had this business for two years. Thanks to his effort, he has been able to get his family ahead. He looked for the way to earn a living and support his family in a decent manner. He is very happy with this business, which is his principal source of income. He is always concerned about improving every aspect of his business. The loan he is asking for is for working capital to make improvements on his moto taxi and to make repairs on certain things like tires, seats, and other things. His wish is to get ahead with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esperanza Emperatriz

texts.es:
Esperanza C., vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento tiene caminos pavimentados, no esta casada pero es madre soltera tiene 3  hijos ya todos son adultos.

Esperanza empezó haciendo un curso para aprender a coser esto le valió para que ella comenzara como costurera de su sector, saco su maquina de coser por mediante créditos. Ahora Esperanza trabaja desde las 08h00 pero no tiene horario fijo para terminar por lo que trabaja en su casa una de las dificultades que tiene es estar sola pendiente de su negocio en conjunto con los quehaceres de su casa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos y poner una parte para el techo de su casa, en le futuro quiere poner agrandar el negocio y tener ingresos suficientes para hacer la losa de su casa.
texts.en:
Esperanza C. lives in a cement house in Paraíso, an area with paved roads just outside the city of Guayaquil. She is not married, but is a single mother of 3 adult children. Esperanza started taking a class to learn how to sew so that she could start a seamstress business in her area. She got her sewing machine through a loan. Now she works from 8am, but she does not have fixed hours to finish her work because she works in her home and one of the difficulties she faces being alone is dealing with unresolved business along with the chores of her house. With the loan she wants to buy fabric and thread. She also wants to use a part of the loan for the roof of her house. In the future she wants to enlarge her business and to have sufficient income to put a slab under her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús P. P. de 25 años de edad, reside en San Antonio del Monte ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores de 6 años de edad. Manuel posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en  su casa de habitación. El se encarga de elaborar el pan y de repartirlo con los diferentes clientes que posee. Manuel solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, azúcar, manteca y toda la materia prima necesaria al por mayor, ya que el desea poder comprar a menor precio, debido a que en la actualidad compra el producto en menores cantidades, lo cual es negativo para su negocio, ya que no obtiene muy buenas ganancias. Manuel tiene la esperanza de mejorar su negocio y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias lo cual beneficie a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús P. P. is 25 and lives in San Antonio de Monte, which is located in the department of Sonsonate. He lives with his wife and 3 children, who are all younger than 6. Manuel has a bakery that is located in his home. He is in charge of making bread and delivering it to different clients that he has. Manuel is requesting a loan that he will use to buy flour, sugar, butter, and all of the supplies he needs on a wholesale basis since he hopes to be able to buy them at a lower price. Currently he buys his supplies in smaller quantities, which is negative for his business because he doesn't make very good profits. Manuel hopes to improve his business and in this way obtain better profits that will benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, and butter to make bread.

location.town: San Antonio del Monte, departamento de Sonsonate

loans.name: 02 Group

texts.en:
Huyền Thị Nguyễn was born in 1977. (id: 010117090067). She is married and has two children. She lives in Dai Bi village with her husband and her children. She sells beverage (coca cola, beer, fruitjuice). She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has been taking part in SEDA for five years and repays ontime. This time, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 vnd. She hopes she has a life better.
 About the other borrowers in her group: 
 Vinh Thị Thành Nguyễn is 29 years old. (id:010117090048). She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell.
 Mai Thị Nguyễn is 35 years old. (id: 010117090065).She is a tailor. She sells clothes in the market, too. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy clothes.
 Lê Thị C. is 40 years old. (id: 010117090058). She sells fish in the market. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: To use for her small business

loans.name: Kiira Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
N. Shamim is 35 years old and the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a friendly business lady with a kiosk on Kiira road in Jinja, where she sells cold drinks of various kinds, chips, and other confectioneries. She has owned her kiosk for four years and she is grateful that her business started with a loan and it still goes on. 

She is able to make about 120,000 Ugandan shilling (UGX) in profits each week, and she makes sure that she always handles her customers well for better profits. She hopes to expand her kiosk further, buy a plot of land for her two children and her stepchildren, and, together with her husband, pay for their further education. Shamim needs a loan to be able to invest more in her business as well as pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To restock her kiosk with more goods as well as pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is into rentals and catering services. She rents out canopies and chairs for various parties and also supplies drinks and food for such parties. She has been in the business for four years and started borrowing from LAPO two years ago. Her previous loan helped her meet the demands of customers, maximizing her profit, and her family needs are better met.

Elizabeth has finished repaying her previous loan and she is requesting a new loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase catering items in bulk at a cheaper price.

Elizabeth is 46 years old, married and has four lovely children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and promises to repay on time.

loans.use: To purchase more catering items.

loans.name: Petrona Isabel

texts.es: Petrona Isabel de 36 años de edad es casada con el el Sr. Melvin Lazo, con quien procreo 2 niños, Melvin Antonio de 6 años estudiando 1er grado de primaria y el menor Isaac de añitos de edad.  Petrona es vendedora de productos cosmeticos Vogue desde hace varios años, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido quien asume los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando su 1er credito para poder comenzar la construccion de su casa, pues su mamá le cedio un terreno para que tuviera su propio techo, ya cuenta con una parte de los materiales, pero le hace falta comprar cemento, hierro y pagar la mano de obra de los albañiles.  El mayor sueño de Petrona es poder ver construida su casa, ya que es el patrimonio que sus padres le estan dando y en el futuro piensa mejorarla para que sus hijos tengan mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Petrona Isabel, 36, is married to Melvin Lazo, with whom she has two children: Melvin Antonio, 6, who is in first grade and Isaac, who is still an infant. Petrona has sold Vogue brand cosmetics for several years; her husband supports her efforts and pays household expenses. She is asking for her first loan to start building her house because her mother ceded a lot to her so that she could have her own home. She already has some of the materials but still needs to buy cement and iron and must pay the bricklayer labor costs. Petrona's greatest dream is to see her house completed because this is her parents' legacy to her and she plans to improve it in the future so that her children can have more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Magido Abudu

texts.en: Mr. Magido Abudu K. is 34 years old and owns a retail shop. He has been operating the business for over seven years. He is using the loan to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil, sweets, biscuits, and so forth to expand his business. He is a married man and a father of one child. His dream is to work very hard for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil, sweets, biscuits, and so forth\

loans.name: Chandrika

texts.en:
Chandrika is a 35-year-old married woman living with her husband, two sons, and one daughter in the town of Telijjawilla.  She and her husband manage a bakery and have done so for a long time now. They manage this bakery together with her husband's brother and his wife, Shirani Hewawellage, who is also a BRAC Sri Lanka borrower on the Kiva website.

Chandrika has requested a 25,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business and purchase bakery materials. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Happy And Unity Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Kwasi is a 43-year-old man, who describes himself as trustworthy and hard-working.  He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 6 and 17. 
 
Kwasi has been a “kente” seller for the past 22 years.  “Kente” is one of the traditional cloths that depict the rich culture of the Asante people in particular and Ghana as a whole.   Kwasi will use the loan to buy more “kente.”  He hopes to one day expand his “kente” business and supply more customers.  Kwasi would also like to help his children further their education. 
 
Kwasi is currently the leader of the trust bank group called 'Happy and Unity'.  There are 10 members in this group.  All group members intend to use the loan to purchase more “kente” cloth to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
Mercy W., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Love. A 52-year-old married mother of six children who range from 14 to 39 years old, she was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 25 years, Mercy has been selling charcoal, soap, sugar and cooking oil at the Redlight Market outside Monrovia, Liberia, a business she started with the limited funds she received from her husband and some family members.  Mercy plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more charcoal, soap, sugar and cooking oil, hoping to grow her business and make more profit so as to continue to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, soap, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van V., 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She produces traditional baskets to sell for an income of about $3.30 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about $4 per day.  V. is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more baskets for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more baskets for resale

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Santa Rosa de Curvan del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales para agenciarse de ingresos. El cría ovejas en establos ubicados cerca a su vivienda y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitanel lugar para adquirir animales y revenderlos en diversos puntos del norte del paíz. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el sustenta la economía de su familia.

José desea adquirir alimento para su ganado de modo que puedan desarrollarse de mejor manera y sean vendidos a un mejor precio, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

José es un padre que siempre trabaja buscando el bienestar de su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Jose is 67 years old, married and lives with his family in Santa Rosa de Curvan in the district of Tambogrande, an area known primarily for cultivating fruit. It is part of the province of Piura and is located about 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

Jose raises and sells sheep for a living. The stables are located close to his house, and when the animals are old enough, he sells them to the people who visit the region to purchase animals which they then sell in various locations in the north of the country. With the income he earns, Jose has been able to support his family.

Jose would like to purchase top quality feed for his animals, to help with their development and secure a better price when he sells them. He is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternative to help him achieve his objective.

Jose is the kind of father who has always worked for the well being of his family. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and acquaintances consider Jose to be a kind and trustworthy person.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high quality feed for the sheep he raises and sells.

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et 3 enfants qui  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à N’djinina, un des villages de la sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, le pois de terre,   le petit mil, le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MINATA M. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,3 hectare d’arachide et de pois de terre.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs. 
Elle comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 42500FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 4 group are ten married women with an average age of 48 and an average of three children. They mostly live in polygamous families in N'djinina, a village in the subprefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, earth pease, millet and corn. This will be their fifth seasonal loan. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Minata M. will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to work about 1.3 hectares of peanuts and earth peas. The harvest will be sold in Fana to customers who will mostly resell it. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 42,500 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and pay hired help

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Nol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
These twelve people have selected Mrs. Mom N. as the village bank president. She is 35 years old. All the members make up a village bank loan located in Trapeang Chhuk village, Takeo province, and they will each use their portion of the loan for varied purposes. 

Mrs. Mom N. is a widow with three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the youngest one is five years old. She works as a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, so to increase rice yield in this current year, Mrs. Mom N. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the rest of the loan to pay farm laborers to help her to do farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay farm laborers

loans.name: Ann Mary

texts.en:
Ann Mary is married to a retired doctor with whom she has four children. None of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  Ann Mary changed her business enterprise from a retail shop to charcoal selling.  She has been in this business for a few months.  She buys bags of charcoal from villages of Nakasongola District in central northern Uganda. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Besides this charcoal business she owns rental rooms. She sells to all categories of people but wholesale only.  Her business challenges include transportation of bags of charcoal from Nakasongola to her home and defaulters.  She is aspiring of owning a delivery van. Ann Mary joined MCDT because of low interest charged.  She resides in and owns a four-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes food and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda K. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs such as bags of rice, maize flour and beans.  

Zubeda is 41 years old and married. Her husband is a retired army man. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs such as bags of rice, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn L. owns and operates a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, soap powder, and canned goods in her community. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Guiwanon Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Marilyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,400 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase inventory and for working capital. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is married. She is 40 years old, with four children whose ages range between 20 and 11 years old. Her husband is a driver. She sells cattle which is used for slaughtering and it's now two years since she started her business. With this loan she will buy more cattle and with the profits she will pay her children school fees. In the future, she wants to buy a vehicle for transporting cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle for slaughtering

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He has made his life as an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing big construction projects. He works closely with construction entrepreneurs. He started his business in 2000. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more tools for his newest project. In the future, he plans to open a construction office as his own business.

loans.use: To purchase more tools

loans.name: Kanungu Development Club, Kihihi Group

texts.en: Here we see Charity T., a member of the Kanungu Development Club. She is a hardworking lady who has seven children, five of whom are still in school. She makes a living selling drinks such as water and soda as well as porridge in the market in Karuhinda. Her customers are mostly people who live nearby. Previously, she made a living managing a hotel until she decided to specialize in her current business. Her dreams are to expand her business and build a happy, well-educated family. She has applied for a loan to buy the supplies, such as sorghum and millet, that she needs to make porridge.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as sorghum and millet to make porridge

loans.name: Chaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur Chaka D. est âgé de 46 ans marié à deux épouses et père de 4 enfants. Il loge dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala. 
Son enfance a été perturbée par des problèmes familiaux qui lui ont empêchés  d’étudier. Pour pouvoir réussir dans la vie,  il  n’a pas  pris du temps pour embrasser les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père depuis son jeune âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il s’est intéressé à la vente de poissons fumés qu’il apprit auprès de ses amies il y a 20 ans. Les poissons fumés sont très prisés dans le milieu Miniaka puisque le prix est abordable et il peut valablement remplacer la viande  qui revient très chère. 
Pour pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de  rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 mois. Il est à son premier prêt individuel, qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 10 paniers de poissons fumés à Konna  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs et effectue sa vente au  marché à poisson de Koutiala,  à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’ hommes  en détail au comptant et à crédit. 
Chaka envisage obtenir un bénéfice de 180.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les charges de la  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr Chaka D. is 46 years old, he has two wives, and is father to 4 children. He lives in the Hamdallaye neighbourhood in the town of Koutiala.
His childhood was disrupted by family problems which prevented him from studying. In order to succeed in life he has not taken the time to engage in activities that could bring him some income at his father’s side since he was very young. Having had several unsuccessful occupations, he became interested in the sale of smoked fish, an activity that he learned from his friends 20 years ago. Smoked fish are very popular in the Miniaka location since the price is reasonable and it can genuinely replace meat which is very expensive.
In order to increase his stock and reinforce his sales capacity, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution two months ago. This is his first individual loan, which he intends to use to buy 10 baskets of smoked fish at Konna (in the Mopti region).He will purchase the fish from the fishermen and sell his goods at the Koutiala fish market to  a clientele of both men and women, retail for cash ,and on credit.
Chaka foresees a profit of 180.000FCFA per month which he will use to pay the Soro Yiriwaso interests, to meet the family needs and to invest in his business.

loans.use: Purchase of smoked fish

loans.name: Virginia Griselda

texts.es:
Virginia Griselda S. R. tiene 53 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Virginia se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ahorrar y seguir trabajando para la familia e incrementar el negocio.
Le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old. She lives with her common-law husband and their children in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province. She has 3 children.
The members of the community bank V.R.C. El LA UNION can be found in the Aguas Frías precinct which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. This group works in agrictulture, growing crops such as maize, rice, and beans. They have been doing this work for a long time. 
Virginia is a farmer and mostly grows maize, rice, and beans, and has been doing this for 15 years. She buys her supplies in Ventanas and sells them in the marketplace in Ventanas in the same precinct. 
She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the crops. The loan will help her to meet her financial needs. She faces challenges such as agricultural pests and diseases and climatic variability. Her dreams is to save and to be able to continue working for her family and to grow her business. 
She likes to go out walking.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa, D. 55 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor D. 58 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy pequeña, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar con la tierra, motivo por el cual cuando obtuvo su mayoría D. edad, compró sus propios terrenos para trabajarlos ella misma. Actualmente ella siembra cacao, café y hojas D. coca, ya que sabe que son los productos que mejor se están vendiendo actualmente en el mercado, es por eso que pone todo su esfuerzo en que su producción sea D. muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es trabajar en la agricultura, ya que siente que es lo que mejor sabe hacer, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todos los días sin importar las condiciones del clima. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar su crédito puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro en el futuro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, además invertirá parte del dinero en abrir una tienda D. abarrotes, la cual ella misma atenderá.
texts.en:
Felipa is 55 years old.  She is an enterprising and very kind woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband, 58 year-old Víctor, and her 5 beloved children who she wants to offer a better quality of life.

When she was very little, Felipa's parents taught her to work the land.  When she came of age, she bought her own plots of land so that she could work them herself.  She currently grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  Since she knows that these are the products which are currently selling the best in the market, she puts all her effort into producing good quality crops.  What she most likes about her work is farming since she feels that it is what she best knows how to do.  She has been doing this work for 35 years and considers that the most difficult part of her work is having to work every day no matter what the weather is like.  In the future, she would like to buy new land so that she can increase her production.

This is Felipa's first loan with MFP.  She knows that she must make her loan repayments punctually if she would like to have access to another loan in the future and she is ready to do this.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops.  She will also invest part of the money in opening a grocery store which she will serve in herself.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and also to buy essential groceries so that she can open a store

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
La Sra. Arminda tiene una despensa  muy bien surtida en la esquina misma del asentamiento la Gloria sobre la ruta Sto. Zaracho de Cnel. Oviedo.
 La misma manifiesta que tiene una muy buena clientela porque tiene casi de todo en su despensa y le trata muy bien a sus clientes.  Esta en pareja con el Sr Aníbal Cáceres el mismo trabaja como mototaxista y así se ayudan mutuamente. 
También comenta que está muy agradecida con la entidad por haber confiado en su persona porque gracias al préstamo que le ha otorgado rápidamente la fundación ya compro todas las mercaderías que le faltaba y está trabajando tranquilamente ahora en su negocio.
texts.en:
Arminda has a very well stocked grocery store on the corner of La Gloria settlement on Sto. Zaracho de Cnel. Oviedo road.

Arminda tells us that she has a very good customer base because she stocks almost everything in her store and she treats her customers very well.  She lives with her partner, Aníbal Cáceres, who works as a driver of a 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers and cargo).  They both help each other.

Arminda also tells us that she is very grateful that we have placed our trust in her because, thanks to the loan that we quickly provided her with, she has already bought all of the merchandise that she needed and is now working peacefully in her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baked goods, oils and noodles

loans.name: Mohbigul

texts.ru: Давлатова Мохбигул проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года. Замужем, имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Уже три года как занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом у нее имеет продуктовый магазин. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: D. Mohbigul lives in the Vahdat region. She's forty-three years old, married and has four children. She has a high school level of education and has worked in sales for the past three years. She owns a grocery store near her home. She's requesting a loan to increase her goods turnover.

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Juana es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de peluches con la forma de animales oriundo de la región de la sierra, ella reparte y vende sus productos a personas que se dedican a la venta de artesanía. Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo cuero, lana y muchas cosas más. 

Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old.  She has three children and lives in the city of Cuzco, Peru.  She is a hardworking mother and entrepreneur who sells stuffed animals in the form of animals native to the mountain region. She distributes and sells her productions to people who sell handicrafts.  She needs this loan to purchase materials such as leather, wool, and many other things.

Juana belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas"of the UMF Associación Arariwa in the city of Cuzco, Peru.
 

.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials such as leather, wool, and many other things.

loans.name: Sonia Maritza

texts.es:
la señora Sonia Maritza M. B. tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal como cremas, lociones, esmaltes, talcos, jabones, tintes para cabello etc.
en estos momentos ya no tiene dependientes porque sus hijos estan grandes y viven en USA.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra mercaderia y zapatos para epoca de escolar, ya que es epoca donde los niños comienzan sus clases y desea comprar al por mayor zapatos y tenis para surtir su negocio y asi de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Sonia Maritza M. Berros, 47, is single and sells personal products such as creams, lotions, nail polish, talcum powder, soaps, hair dye, etc. At this time she has no dependents because her children are grown and live in the United States. The loan will be used to buy merchandise such as school shoes as it's back-to-school time for children. She wants to buy wholesale tennis shoes as a means to improve business and increase her earnings which she needs to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy deodorant, creams, perfumes, lotions, body oil, nail polish, nail polish remover, nail cutters, hair dye, Vaseline, hair gel, talcum powder, face soaps, and shoes

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo L. Jr. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 31 years old. Arturo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arturo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. Arturo has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arturo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arturo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Arturo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Arturo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 39 años y disfruta de la compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Es una persona muy creativa que ha demostrado durante 17 años salir adelante con su negocio, en un inicio solo vendía cocina y artículos de plástico, sin embargo este negocio no le ha dado muchas rentas por lo que tuvo que cambiar de rubro, actualmente vende objetos artesanales, que ella misma los elabora. Han transcurrido 5 años trabajando en esta actividad, y cuyo taller se encuentra dentro de su casa, y además que su familia le ayuda en este negocio.  Es así que ella elabora adornos llamados, “ollitas de la abundancia” por lo que tiene mucha demanda en otras ciudades, por ello tiene que viajar constantemente, así asegura la venta y sus ganancias. Disfruta la actividad que realiza, por que además de considerarlo como un pasa tiempo se ha convertido en su fuente de ganancias, permitiéndole sostener junto a su esposo a su familia, es por esta razón que tiene proyecciones de incrementar su producción artesanal. Es su  sexto  crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos que necesita para  fabricar más artesanías como ollitas de barro, barniz, semillas entre otros.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 39 years old and enjoys the company of her husband and 3 children in their own home.  She has shown that during her 17 years running her business that she is a very creative person.  In the beginning, she only sold kitchen and plastic items, however, she didn't make much profit so she had to change her merchandise.  Currently, she sells crafts that she makes herself.  She has been doing this for 5 years and has a workshop in her house.  Her family also helps her in this business.  She makes ornaments called "ollitas de la abundancia" [abundance pots] for which there is a high demand in other cities.  Because of this she has to travel constantly to ensure her sales and income.  She enjoys this activity because she considers it a hobby that she has turned into a source of income, thus allowing her to support her family along with her husband.  It is for this reason that she plans to increase her craft production.  

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support as she has always been responsible with her payments.  She is also pleased to be a part of her communal bank because all the members are very unified and responsible.  She is grateful to all that will make this loan possible since it will be very useful for the progress of her business.   With the loan she will purchase the materials that she needs to make her crafts such as clay pots, glaze, seeds, etc.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, glaze and clay to make her crafts

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is a married man with four children. He lives in Trinidad, Bohol, with his family. He owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store there. Carlito sells assorted products that his neighbors and other people in his community regularly buy from him.

Carlito is requesting a loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and other merchandise to sell.

Carlito works hard to improve his business and sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Haiyotjon

texts.en:
Haiyotjon, 35, lives with his wife and 4 children. He has been a farmer since he was a young. He comes from a family of farmers, who taught him everything about this business. He mostly plants potatoes and onions. 

Throughout all these years of work, Haiyotjon was able to succeed in his business. In the future Haiyotjon is planning to have a bigger stable. He will extend the fields he cultivates. 

Now he has asked for a loan of 10,100 Somoni that he will spend for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. He promises to work responsibly and sincerely thanks all lenders who have decided to support him. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a mother of 3 children who started a small business as a hair stylist at her home two years ago. She customized one of the rooms in her house to be her work place.

During these two years she has added more than one seat to her beauty salon, and took training to be a make-up artist, too. Now Huda has applied for a loan to buy more equipment and cosmetics to help her improve the service she provides at her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy more equipment and cosmetics.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Fe y Esperanza, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de  19, 17, 15, 14 y 5 años  de edad, tres de ellos estudian en colegio, el menor en escuela y el mayor trabaja, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables.

Ella se dedica a la limpieza de pinchaguas (pez pequeño con el que se elabora las sardinas), además de esto junto a su esposo también se dedican a la compra y venta de pescado, el esposo se va en su embarcación mar adentro a sus faenas de pesca y en alguno de los casos hasta donde están los barcos más grande para completar la carga que ellos tienen que entregar. Una vez en tierra firme el se desplaza en un carro fletado a la ciudad de Manta para entregar sus productos  a las grandes empresas que elaboran el atún y las sardinas. Trabajan 22 días  al mes ya que los días restantes está  prohibido pescar.

Este crédito es para  comprar pescado, combustibles y materiales de pesca.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio carro para así no pagar en fletes ya que estos son muy caros.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish, in Portoviejo Canton, we find a place known as "Los Arenales".  Here the members of the communal bank "Fe y Esperanza" meet every two weeks.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy and warmth of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Maria, age 33, who is married and has five children, ages 19, 17, 15, 14 and 5.  Four of them are in school, the eldest works and they all live at home.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She has been in the communal bank for five years and enjoys it because her friends there are very responsible.

For a living she cleans "pinchaguas" fish (a small fish used to make sardines).  Also, together with her husband, she buys and sells fish.  Her husband takes his boat out to sea to fish and sometimes supplies fish to larger boats needing to complete their loads.   Once he is back on land he ships his catch to the city of Manta where he sells to the large companies who make tuna and sardines.  They work 22 days a week because the rest of the time fishing is prohibited.

This loan will be used to buy fish, fuel and fishing supplies.

Her dream is to have her own car to avoid paying the high  transport costs.

loans.use: To buy fish, fuel and fishing supplies

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El Sr. Nicolás tiene como actividad la fotografía, actividad que desarrolla en la zona donde reside, atendiendo cumpleaños, matrimonios y otros acontecimientos  siendo muy conocido por su trabajo, el destino del crédito en esta ocasión es el de comprar material fotográfico por mayor para su estudio además de comprar un mini laboratorio de fotografías instantáneas. El es una persona muy activa el vive junto con su esposa, sus hijos pese que ya son completamente independientes viven junto a el en  el mismo domicilio es una familia muy trabajadora y unida  con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es Sr. Nicolás esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Nicolas has a photography business which he developed in the area where he lives by attending birthdays, weddings and other events, and becoming well-known for his work.  This loan will be used to buy photographic supplies at wholesale for his studio.  In addition, he will buy a mini-lab (a small photographic developing and printing machine) to make instant photographs.  He is a person who is very active.  He lives with his wife and their children; his children support themselves but they all live together in the same house.  This is a very hardworking and united family, where the members have a strong desire to get ahead.  Nicolas is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy photographic supplies and a photo minilab machine

loans.name: Mercedes Vanessa

texts.es: Mercedes vive en el barrio San José al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí tiene una sala de belleza y ofrece servicios de corte, peinado, blower,  tinturado, manicure y pedicure. Su negocio nació hace dos años cuando decidió generar ingresos para su hogar,  una vez llegó A Barranquilla procedente de Ciénaga Magdalena y estudió este arte.  Su sala de belleza comenzó pequeña y poco a poco con su dedicación ha logrado construir una buena clientela, que cada día aspira a extender. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace Mercedes a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará masajes, champo, enjuagues, tintes, y pinta uñas para el consumo de su negocio y para venderle a sus clientes, pues ofrece asesoría en tratamientos, como valor agregado y esto gusta mucho a sus clientes. Su máximo sueño y desafío es tener una casa propia, donde pueda adecuar una habitación para su negocio y en la actualidad su capital de trabajo no le alcanza para responder a este propósito. Mientras Mercedes trabaja por alcanzar su sueño, continua manejando una rentabilidad  sobre las ventas de un 30% que planea aumentar con el ejercicio persistente de su trabajo.
texts.en: Mercedes lives in the San José neighborhood in southern Barranquilla.  There she has a beauty salon and offers haircuts, hairstyling, blow drying, dying, manicure, and pedicure services.  Her business was born 2 years ago when she decided to generate income for her home, once she arrived to Barranquilla from Ciénaga Magdalena and studied art.  Her beauty salon started off very small, but little by little, with her dedication, she has managed to form a good clientele, which she hopes to expand every day.  This is the first loan that Mercedes has had with the Fundación Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy masage supplies, shampoo, conditioners, dyes, and nail polish for her business and to sell to her customers.  She offers accessories to her treatments for an extra charge, and her customers like these a lot.  Her biggest dream and challenge is to have her own home where she can have an adequate space for her business.  Currently her working capital isn’t enough for this.  While Mercedes is working to reach her dream, she continues to make a profit of 30%.  She plans to expand this with perseverance in her work.

loans.use: to buy massage supplies, shampoo, conditioners, dyes, and nail polish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his laptop and television sales department.

loans.name: Juana Jacinta

texts.es: La Sra. Juana  Jacinta  ella es trabajadora activa del Ministerio de Educación trabajando para el colegio Público los “Navarrete” desempeñándose como Directora del Colegio tiene  Catorce  años  de trabajar para esta institución es casada  actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha obtenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Juana Jacinta is an active worker with the Ministry of Education. She works for the “Navarrete” public school, in the position of School Director. She has worked for this institution for fourteen years. She is married and has two children who are currently of school age. She has obtained eleven loans from CEPRODEL, and each one of them has been used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stones, stone tiles, concrete blocks, etc., to expand and improve the house where she lives. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, since they have allowed her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stones, stone tiles, concrete blocks, etc.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: From Baray district in Kompong Tom Province, Mrs. Eng is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been in the fixture business since 1992. In her village, she owns a kiosk where she sells different kinds of miscellaneous materials. She sells items such as perfumes, beauty products, and some fast foods, soft drinks and cooking ingredients, gasoline and other items necessary to people who come to buy anything in the market. Mrs. Eng is married to 46-year-old Mr. Sear, who makes furniture such as chairs and tables. The couple is blessed with a young kid who is still enrolled in school. In order to earn extra profit and to make her husband’s business successful, Mrs. Eng will be using the loan she requested for her husband to buy additional poles for making tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy additional poles for making furniture

loans.name: Elena Filadelfia De La Cuz

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

La señora Elena es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene  61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos pero dos fallecieron, los 4 restantes  ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario y con esto ayudar a su esposo se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños, luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa los mismos que los trasladan hasta los centros de faenamiento o a los distintos mercados de la ciudad a comercializar la carne. Su esposo le ayuda cuando puede en la alimentación y cuidado de los animales.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimento y medicinas  para pollos y chanchos.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y  tener salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish.  The canton is known as the birthplace of the old warrior, Eloy Alfaro.  It is also known for their famous Panama hats, which are valued within and outside of the country.

Elena is a founding member of her communal bank.  She likes it because the interest is lower than in other lending institutions.

She is 61 years old and married.  She had six children, but two of them died.  The other four are grown and independent.  He husband is a farmer.

In order to earn a daily living and to help her husband, Elena raises pigs and chickens.  She buys these animals while they are still small.  She then keeps them for three or four months until they have gained enough weight.  She later sells them to commercial dealers who come to her home. The dealers take them to slaughterhouses or to the various markets of the city and sell the meat in those places.  Her husband helps her when he can with the feeding and care of the animals. 

She will use this loan to buy feed and medicines for chickens and pigs. 

Her dreams are to get ahead and to have good health for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Verónica Del Rocío

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 38 años vive en Ibarra junto a sus hijos que tienen 1 y 7 años, se describe como una persona responsable y trabajadora.

Trabaja en la comercialización de perfumes y cosméticos durante un año. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cosméticos y perfumes para abastecer su negocio, este negocio si crece le ayudaría para poderles dar el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es poder ponerse una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Veronica, 38, lives in Ibarra with her two children, 1- and 7-years old.  She is a responsible, hard-working woman.  

She has made a living buying and selling perfumes and cosmetics for a year.  This is her first FODEMI loan and she will use it to stock her business with cosmetics and perfumes.  If this business grows, it will help her provide her children with an education.  

Her greates wish is to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Upendo-Kahembe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Asha, leader du groupe d’affaire «Upendo-Kahembe », est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 21 ans, mère de 2 jeunes enfants. Elle est  vendeuse de poissons et des boissons.  Son mari est chômeur. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de Kahembe. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 5 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 paniers de poissons  à marchander et  10 casiers de boissons (Fanta, Primus, Aigle).  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et acheter une  parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
