texts.en: The client is a young entrepreneur by the name of Asha. She is the leader of the “Upendo-Kahembe" group. She is 21 years old and the mother of two young children. She sells fish and beverages. Her husband is unemployed. She sets up her goods for sale at the communal market of Kahembe. She has been doing these to earn some money for four years. She just finished five lending cylces with Hekima. This new loan will allow her to stock up by buying three baskets of fish and 10 cases of beverages (Fanta, Primus, Aigle) for resale. Moreover, she would like to see her children grow up in a comfortable environment and to buy a land plot. The clien thanks Hekima for its work in favor of impoverished women who  lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy three baskets of fish and 10 cases of beverages (Fanta, Primus, Aigle) for resale

loans.name: Jimy Nahun

texts.es:
el sr. Jimy Nahun tiene 28 años de edad y se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, tiene 7 años de experiencia de realizar ese trabajo, Jimy esta casado y es padre de 2 hijos. 
El Sr. Yimi utilizara el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar ya que no cuenta con este servicio básico, y la empresa gubernamental que presta estos servicios no tiene planes de llegar a esa zona.
Este proyecto servirá de mucha utilidad  para su familia y bienestar propio. con este sistema podra conectar un televisor, radio y varios focos en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Jimy Nahun is 28, and he  grows and sells coffee.  He has 7 years experience doing this work. Jimy is married and the father of 2 children.

Jimy will use the loan to buy a solar electricity plant, as he doesn't have this basic service.  The government agency that provides these services has no plans to reach that area.

This project will be useful for his family and his own well-being.  With this system, he will be able to connect a television, radio, and have several lights in his home.

loans.use: To buy a power plant.

loans.name: Mamikon

texts.en:
Mamikon was born in 1967 in the village of Gandzakar, Tavush Region. Mamikon is married and has two school-age children, a son and a daughter. Since 1993, Mamikon and his wife have been engaged in farming. On their farm they breed cows and pigs, and grow fruits and vegetables. Mamikon apportions his farm produce for his family's use and also sells some of it to fellow villagers. Mamikon produces high-quality dairy products that are always in great demand from his neighbors. Agricultural activity permits Mamikon to provide for his family.
 
Now he is seeking a 1,000,000-Armenian-dram (AMD) loan to buy two cows and a large lot of fodder for his cows and pigs. This is Mamikon’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy two cows and a large lot of fodder for his cows and pigs

loans.name: Sobresalientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Sobresalientes nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo D. otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar donD. residen las integrantes, que es la ciudad D. San Lorenzo. Las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento D. cada una D. ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
La Sra. Norma es una mujer casada, muy emprendedora e innovadora, durante todos este ciclo ha demostrado muchas ganas D. superación. Ella se dedica a la ventas varias, es decir D. todo tipo D. productos que trae D. muchos lugares, como ser prendas, sabanas, calzados y demás, gracias a su sacrificio diario ella pueD. mantener a toda su familia, como así también los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. sabanas, calzados, prendas y demás para su abastecimiento y posterior venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que Kiva y la Fundación le esta brindando.
texts.en:
The “Sobresalientes” committee was born thanks to the encouragement and support from another committee that was working in the same location where the members resiD.: the city of San Lorenzo. Each member's progress is the committee's main goal.  They are known in their location as very hardworking, enterprising women.

Norma is a married, very enterprising, innovative woman.  During the entire cycle she’s shown herself to be driven to succeed.  She sells assorted merchandise, that is, all sorts of products that she brings from many places.  They can be clothes, sheets, footwear and others.  Thanks to her daily sacrifice she’s able to support her entire family as well as cover household expenses.

She is asking for the loan to buy sheets, footwear, clothing and other items to stock up and later resell.  She is grateful for the opportunity Kiva and the Fundación are providing her.

loans.use: to buy sheets, footwear clothes and other things.

loans.name: Ullyses

texts.en:
Ullyses is single but has 1 child. He is 29 years old and he lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He has a small motor repair shop to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 6,000 doing this type of work.

He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional materials for his shop. He has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future, he hopes for success in his small business so that he can support the education of his only daughter.

loans.use: to purchase additional material for his shop.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: La socia tiene 40 años de edad, la socia tiene 5 hijos de 23, 19, 15, 12, 6 años de edad, la socia  trabaja actualemnte vendiendo artesanía en la plaza principal del poblado, la socia vende artesanía exactamente textiles, ella compra los materiales como lanas de diferentes colores ya previamente teñidas con oxidos naturales y los hila para la elaboración de textiles con diversos diseños, la socia requiere el prestamo para la compra de lanas de distintos colores, la soica invertira el credito en la compra de lanas. A la socia le encantaría poner su galería de venta de artesanía o venta de textiles hechos con lanas de alpaca a mano.
texts.en: This member is 40 years old and has five children aged 23, 19, 15, 12 and 6.  She currently works selling handicrafts (textiles) in the main square in her village.  She buys materials such as different colored yarns which have already been dyed with natural oxides and she spins them to make textiles in different designs.  She needs this loan to buy different colored yarns.  She will invest her loan in buying yarn.  The member would like to set up a gallery in which to sell handicrafts or textiles which have been hand-made from alpaca yarn.

loans.use: to purchase different colored yarns

loans.name: Sovera

texts.en:
Sovera is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Sovera has a food shop that sells homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 8 years.  

She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade longganisa. Sovera has been a member of HSPFI since 2004. In the future, Sovera hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade longganisa

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. She has been running an electronics shop for the last four years to bring up her family. She also rents out houses for extra income. Irene has employed two people to help in the business. In the next five years, she wants to open another outlet of her business. 

Irene has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy televisions and radios for resale.

loans.use: To buy television and radios.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 23 years old and is single. He has one year's experience selling various goods such as watches, glasses and bags. The hours of his business are from 7am to 8pm every day. 

Joel has requested a loan to purchase stock of watches, glasses and bags to sell. With any profits from the loan, Joel would like to satisfy his family`s basic needs and start saving for his future

loans.use: To purchase stock for his store

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a 25 year old married woman with three children, two of whom are still studying. She has a general store where she sells a variety of products. She had been doing this work for two years. Each day, she earns approximately PHP 500 for these activities.

Jenalyn is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell to the people of the community. She hopes that, through the loan, she can gain more customers.

In the future, Jenalyn hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Tahrir

texts.en:
Tahrir is from Israel’s Negev region. One of five siblings in her home, Tahrir decided after high school to gain training and experience as a childcare giver. Through her local municipality, Tahrir received training and certification to open an at-home day care for toddlers between the ages of three months and three years of age. Tahrir has opened a nursery in her home and is registered with the local municipality. This means they monitor the nursery school and guarantee her customers and monthly tuition payments. Tahrir has found a business she can develop and manage now and for the long term, expanding and growing in the years to come.

Tahrir needed this loan to purchase equipment for her daycare including educational toys, cots, cribs, table, chairs and supplies.

One day, Tahrir wants to open a large multi-classroom nursery outside of her home.

loans.use: To purchase educational toys, cots, cribs, table, chairs and supplies for her daycare.

loans.name: Ta Ma Lan Pin Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 42 village customers, including ten CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. Villagers usually grow groundnuts, sesame, pigeon pea, and green gram. 

In this village, transportation networks are weak, as the roads flood during the rainy season, and it is far, about five miles, from the main road of the village. It is struggling with sufficient access to clean water, because one of the water basins could not store enough water and is in need of repair.

The new loan will enable this community to purchase farming inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides. These are essential inputs to improve crop yields, and thereby crop income. In the future, villagers would like use increased incomes to set up a small store in the village where they can get various farming inputs. This will mitigate the challenge faced by most farmers of having to travel to other villages to buy inputs. 

In addition to farming, villagers will work as construction workers, tailors, and government employees. Young people will typically migrate to the cities in search of economic opportunity.  

Pictured above are the committee members from Ta Ma Lann Pin Village CBO: U Htay, U Khin, U Tin, U Hla are sitting behind, and U Win, U Soe, U Nyount, U Myint and U Sein are in front. Additionally, three non-committee members are in the back row.  Included in the photo (second from the left, behind) is CBO member U Khin. His main businesses are farming and livestock. He has six family members and is the father of a small child. He will purchase seeds and fertilizers with his new loan.

loans.use: to help 42 villagers purchase farming inputs, such as seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, to enrich and protect their crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Madam Yawa A. is a 42-year old married mother of five (05) children. After leaving her studies, she started her own business to share the household expenses with her husband, who was previoulsy an official. A very active woman, she manages her business well and brings in solid revenue. Her first two credits were reimbursed without problems.

She would once again like to ask for a $950 credit that would help her build her cloth business and equip her grocery store. She will then be able to increase her sales and contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 42 ans environs, Madame A. Yawa est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Abandonnant ses études, elle exerce ses activités commerciales et arrive à partager les dépenses du foyer avec son mari qui est un ancien préfet. Très active, elle maîtrise bien son commerce qui lui procure assez de revenus. Ses deux premier crédit ont été bien soldé sans incident. De nouveau, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui servira à renforcer son commerce de pagnes et à équiper plus sa boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle pourra alors augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of cloths and grocery store materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rahab would like to purchase food stocks for her grocery business.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma is 37 years old, she is married, has two children and her husband works as a sales agent in a pharmacy. Norma sells silver jewelry that she buys in Mexico City once a month and she sells it to acquaintances in her community and her family. She belongs to the group “Poderosas 1” together with Sandra Coronel H. (grocery store) and Gabriela P. H. (silver jewelry sales) . With this loan, Gabriela and Norma will travel to Mexico City to purchase more jewelry in order to increase their sales. Sandra will invest her part of the loan in supplying her store with merchandise and non-perishable food.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma tiene 37 años, está casada , tiene dos hijos y su esposo trabaja como agente de ventas en una farmacia. Norma se dedica a la venta de joyerías de plata las que compra en la Ciudad de Mexico una vez al mes y las vende entre las personas conocidas de la comunidad y su familia. Pertenece al grupo Poderosas 1, junto con: Sandra Coronel H. (tienda de abarrotes) y Gabriela P. H. (venta de joyerias de plata). Con el prestamo, Gabriela y Norma viajaran a la Ciudad de Mexico a comprar mas joyerias para aumentar sus ventas y sandra invertira su parte del prestamo en abastecer su tienda con mercaderia y alimentos no perecibles.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is an artisan. She embroiders napkins, tablecloths, shawls, and the clothing typically worn by women in her area. She travels once every 30 days to the town of San Cristóbal de las Casas (the market of Santo Domingo) to sell her pieces to wholesalers. She is not married and she supports herself with this activity. She is part of the loan group Merced 3. With her loan, she will invest in buying looms, thread, and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

CATALINA es artesana borda servilletas, manteles, chales, ropa típica que usan las mujeres de su localidad y viaja cada 30 días a la ciudad de San Cristóbal de las Casas (mercado de santo Domingo) para vender a los mayoristas sus artesanías. Ella es soltera y con esta actividad se apoya para su sostenimiento. Forma parte del grupo Merced 3. Con su préstamo invertirá en la compra de telares, hilo y telas.

loans.use: To buy looms, thread, and fabrics

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea K., aged 28, sells bananas in the market to earn $5 per day in revenue.  Her husband is a laborer who makes $1 each day.  They have one young child as well as Mrs. Chea’s brother who lives with them and depends on her income.  She is requesting a loan of $200 to help her brother start a transportation business and contribute to the family income. With this loan, she can purchase a horse and cart so that he can transport passengers among the villages and earn $2-4 per day.  This will greatly increase her family’s standard of living and provide the resources to educate her child.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart to start a transportation business.

loans.name: Patiniso

texts.en: Patiniso N. opened a children’s clothing store in Spitaman, Tajikistan in 2003. She has grown her business into a profitable store that offers a variety of clothes. Her friendly personality and business sense have allowed her to develop strong relationships with clients. She needs a lone to continue to expand her inventory and further grow her business, her continued success would allow her keep providing a necessary service to her community.

loans.use: to expand inventory and grow business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
For several years Hugo, Faustina’s husband, has been working at a gas distribution company. Eight months ago Faustina used Hugo’s knowledge of the business to start her own gas distribution service for families in her community.

This business has enabled her to accomplish her goals. She would like to expand her business, which will require more capital. She plans on using the additional revenue to build a home for her family. Your Financial assistance will help this hard working mother fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace varios años, Hugo, esposo de Faustina, venia trabajando en una empresa privada de distribución de gas, aprovechando el conocimiento de su querido compañero poco a poco por iniciativa de esta trabajadora madre que veía en ésta actividad una forma de apalear el hambre de su hogar, con el dinero ahorrado que tenía logró crear su pequeña empresa de venta y distribución de gas a domicilio.Esta actividad que emprendió hace 8 meses atrás y a la que ahora viene dedicándose diligentemente les ha otorgado mucha dicha por que rápidamente le ha permitiendo cumplir con sus objetivos.El deseo de esta empresaria pareja es lograr ampliar su mercado y para este propósito requiere aumentar el monto de su capital, con las ganancias que obtenga tiene planeado construir su casita con el fin de ofrecerle a su familia un techo propio y seguro. Con su deseo albergado en su corazón recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda a fin de acopiar la cantidad que necesita.Apoyemos a esta empresaria familia a prosperar con su nueva labor.

loans.use: Purchase of additional gas tanks to increase distribution to more families in her community.

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mrs. Mat S., 60, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a tailoring business at home making on average around $4 each day in revenue. Her husband is employed as a village chef making around $5 per day. Two of her children are employed as security guards and the other two are employed by a garment factory.

Mrs. Mat S. would like to request for a loan amount of $1200 to purchase one more sewing machine so that one of her daughters can help her when she is available from her work. This will raise her income generation.

(One of her daugthers is pictured because Mrs. Mat S. is not available)

loans.use: To purchase one more sewing machine so that one of her daughters can help her when she is available from her work.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura is a founding member of the communal bank “Las Brisas”; she lives in the San Martin region, province of Huallaga, and district of Bellavista. The restaurant that she runs out of her house was especially constructed so that it could be a nice, modern and spacious restaurant.

The need for giving her children the best education has motivated her to begin her own business. She works in the preparation of food and in attending the people that come to dine at her restaurant. Thanks to her perseverance and her strong work ethic, she will be able to get ahead and accomplish everything she proposes to do.

With a loan of 2,000 Soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will invest in her restaurant by buying items like kitchen utensils, different size pots and pans, a set of plates and silverware, etc. She will also buy some of the non-perishable ingredients for the preparation of the various dishes that she makes daily for her large group of clients.

Maura is a very enthusiastic woman. She is 47 years old, together with her husband they are humbly demonstrating how much they want to contribute to the community that gave them the opportunity to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Maura es socia fundadora D. banco comunal “Las Brisas”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia D. Huallaga, distrito D. Bellavista. El restaurante fue especialmente construido con este propósito, cuenta con una moderna y amplia infraestructura.

La necesidad D. dar una mejor educación a sus hijos le impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio D. la preparación D. comida tipo menú en un pequeño ambiente D. su casa, que luego gracias a su perseverancia, ganas D. salir adelante y lograr lo que se propone, obtener lo que ahora tiene.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la implementación D. restaurante con utensilios nuevos D. cocina, como ollas D. diferentes tamaño, vajilla y cubiertos, así como también comprará los insumos no perecibles para la elaboración D. los variados platos D. comida que a diario ofrece a su vasta clientela.

Maura es una mujer muy entusiasta y alegre con 47 años, que junto a su esposo y con la humildad que demuestra quiere contribuir al progreso D. la comunidad que le dio la oportunidad D. salir adelante.

loans.use: Invest in her restaurant by buying utensils, pots and pans, and some ingredients.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.en:
Remberto is 46 years old. He with his wife and 3 children live in a house located on Cuellar final Street, to the South West of Warnes. This house still is not registered to his name.

Remberto works as a lumber in a sawmill for tree trunks and wood. He has a lot of experience in this field, and as a result he has 2 chainsaws. His wife is a co-applicant for this loan and would like to open a small bakery run out of their home.

Remberto’s competition is small, since there are not many people who do what he does. On the other hand the bakery has more competition, but the family is very well known in the area.

They want to buy a new oven with the capacity of six trays, and a container all for the price of $210usd. The remaining money will go towards the wholesale purchase of flower, sugar, lard, and other goods that will be required. This is the third loan Remberto is making with our institution and has repaid all of them on time. He has no other loans out at this time.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Remberto es un señor de 46 años de edad que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la calle Cuellar final, al suroeste de Warnes junto a su esposa y tres hijos, este inmueble que habitan aún no se encuentra registrado a su nombre. Remberto se desempeña como motosierrista de madera en un aserradero de troncas o maderas, actividad en la cual tiene muchos años de experiencia, para este efecto cuenta con dos motosierras. Su esposa que es la codeudora quiere implementar una pequeña panadería artesanal en su domicilio. La competencia para Remberto es baja ya que no hay muchas personas que se dediquen a esta actividad, por otra parte la panadería tendrá más competencia pero como la famili es bastante conocida en la zona contarán con el apoyo de los mismos habitantes. Compraran un horno nuevo con capacidad de seis latas y una garrafa todo al precio de $us. 210.- el dinero restante será para comprar por mayor harina, azúcar, manteca y otros insumos que vayan a requerir. Esta es la tercera secuencia de Remberto en nuestra institución y todos los préstamos los canceló de manera puntual y no tiene otras deudas en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Operating capital for a bakery

loans.name: Subira's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Subira is 39 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 20 and 19. She and her husband also takes care of 2 other children. Subira owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 6am to 12pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Debora and Benadetha.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela B. is a former client of Paraguayan Foundation and received her first loan in 1996. She has been married to Aurelio Arias Notari for more than ten years and they have a son who attends school.

Manuela is a seamstress. She makes many types of clothing, primarily school uniforms, as several schools are her exclusive clients. She makes school shorts, t-shirts, trousers, etc. Manuela’s business is not the only source of family income; Aurelia, her husband, owns a warehouse selling building materials.

This loan will be used for the purchase of fabrics, buttons, and yarns for making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Manuela B. es una antigua cliente de Fundación Paraguaya, que en el ano 1996 solicito su primer crédito. Hace mas de 10 anos contrajo matrimonio con Aurelio Arias Notari. La pareja tiene un hijo que va al colegio.

Manuela es confeccionista; hace todo tipo de ropas generalmente uniformes escolares debido a que los colegios son sus clientes exclusivos. Confecciona shorts, remeras, pantalones, etc. Las confecciones de Manuela no son la única fuente de ingreso de la familia. Aurelio es dueño de un depósito donde vende materiales de construcción.

El dinero solicitado será utilizado para a compra de telas, botones, hilos para la confección de ropas.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and other clothing materials

loans.name: Pean

texts.en:
Mrs. Pean B. is 26 and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She works by collecting and purchasing recyclable items and selling them to companies that recycle the goods. Her husband also works in this line of business. Together the couple has one child.

Mrs. Pean is now seeking to increase her business efficiency and output. She would like to borrow $500 to buy a motorbike and trailer so that she can more easily collect and transport her recyclables.

loans.use: Pean would like to purchase transportation for recyclable goods.

loans.name: María Griselda

texts.es:
María is 24 years old, single with no children and has been working selling fast food with her mother in her own house for five years.

She is a very active young woman, who in addition to working, also studies, with her mother being her biggest support. With lots of sacrifice she is getting ahead in her business, which has allowed her to generate the necessary income to help support her family. Her desire is to grow day by day her snack food business and to give better comfort and quality to her customers.

With the loan she will purchase ingredients (meat, eggs, oil).

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita María, tiene 24 años de edad, soltera sin hijos, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas con su madre en su propia casa, hace ya cinco años.

Ella es una joven muy activa, que a la par que trabaja, también estudia, siendo su madre su mayor apoyo, con mucho sacrificio lleva adelante su negocio, que le ha podido generar el ingreso necesario para ayudar a sostener a su familia. Su anhelo es hacer crecer cada día más su copetin y dar mayor comodidad y calidad a sus clientes.

Con el crèdito comprarà insumos(Carnes,huevos,aceites)

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients and merchandise (meat, eggs, oil)

loans.name: Denisa

texts.en: Denisa is a 23-year-old married woman from Gračanica. She is a housewife, but her husband has a full-time job and he earns about 1000 KM (~ $700 USD) monthly. She already raises chickens and, with this loan of 800 KM, she will buy more chickens and tools for chicken breeding. Her wish is to become the chicken producer for her region and maybe for other towns beyond.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and chicken food

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
La señora Claudina es de la ciudad de Santani, tiene 4 hijos, tiene una despensa bien surtida en donde atiende con sus hijos. Comenzó a trabajar con su pequeña despensa hace 4 años, anteriormente era vendedora ambulante, luego tuvo un accidente lo cual la obligó a dejar ese trabajo.

Gracias a los créditos que recibió anteriormente de la Fundación pudo aumentar su stock de mercaderías. Su proyecto es construir un salón más amplio para su negocio. El crédito que solicita en esta ocasión será para la compra de un mayor stock de mercaderías como ser: gaseosas, golosinas, panificados, artículos para el hogar, alimentos enlatadas, etc.
texts.en:
Claudina is from the city of Santani. She has 4 children and a well-stocked store where she works with her children.

She began working at the store 4 years ago. Before that, she was a travelling saleswoman, but she had an accident and had to quit her job.

Thanks to the loans she received previously from the :Fundación Paraguaya" she was able to increase her stock of merchandise. Her project is to build a bigger locale for her business.

The loan she is soliciting on this occasion is to buy more stock of merchandise like sodas, candy, baked goods, household articles, canned goods, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sodas, candy, baked goods, household articles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Doña Josefa tiene 49 años D. edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada  y madre D. 04 hijos (dos con familia dos solteros). Vive en el distrito D. Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado D. Bellido” en Conduriri.

Con su crédito inicial compró productos D. primera necesidad (abarrotes). Quedó huérfana D. padre a los 06 meses D. nacida, sólo su madre la apoyó. A los 18 años D. edad empezó a vender frutas y pan en Conduriri. A los 21 años se casó y junto con su  esposo acumularon capital e instalaron una tienda D. abarrotes que hasta la fecha continúa con dicho negocio. También tiene un negocio D. compra y venta D. carne D. alpaca y fibra D. alpaca, compran D. la comunidad D. Circapampa y venden a los mayoristas D. Tacna.

Con este crédito D. S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 05 degollados D. carne D. alpaca a S/.130 cada uno y con el resto comprará fibra D. alpaca dependiendo D. la calidad y color.

Su meta es comprar más alpacas y ovinos para engorD., y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Josefa is 49 years old and she completed primary school. She is married and she has 4 children (two are still with the family and 2 are single adults). She lives in the district of Conduiri in the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a founding member of the community bank "Maria Parado D. Bellido" in Conduiri.

With her first loan she purchase items of primary need (groceries). Her father passed away when she was only 6 months old, leaving only her mother for support. At the age of 18 she started selling fruit and breads in Conduiri. At the age of 21 she got married and together with her husband they accumulated enough capital funds to set up a convenience store, the same store that she still runs today. She also has a business buying and selling alpaca meats and alpaca wool. She purchases them in Circapampa and sells to wholesales in Tacna.

With this loan amounting to S/.1000, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 5 alpaca at S/.130 each and with the rest she will purchase alpaca wool priced according to the quality and color.

Her goal is to purchase more alpacas and pork, and to support her children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meats and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a widow with two children who lives in Khachmaz, a small town in Azerbaijan. Three years ago she went into business for herself. She is applying for a loan of $1,200 to improve her business by buying additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 42 years old and married with two children. She makes a living selling fish and has been in this business for a long time. She buys her fish from various places and sells them in Benin City. Demand for her fish is high. She has applied for a loan to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: S. Solange est née le 23 avril 1968. Elle s’est mariée avec GLELE Ahanhanzo Armand. Elle était scolarisées jusqu’au primaire. Elle a cinq enfants – 20, 18, 16, 14, et 3 ans, tous scolarisés. Elle gère une activité depuis 10 ans. Au début, elle a vendu le divers. Actuellement, elle fait la distribution des produits. Ses clients commandent les pagnes, les colliers, et les chaussures qu ‘ils les achètent chez elle. Elle achète ses produits a Lomé. Son mari a aidé avec sa commerce. Les autres prêts de Kiva lui a permis d’augmenter les articles. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait ouvrir une poissonnerie et de vendre ses produits divers en gros.
texts.en:
Solange S. was born on April 23, 1968. She is married to Ahanhanzo Armand GLELE and has five children, ages 20, 18, 16, 14, and 3, who are all in school. She herself had been provided with a primary school education and has been working for ten years. In the beginning, she sold various goods. Currently, she distributes them. Her customers order pagnes (colorful West African cloth), necklaces, and shoes that they buy from her. She acquires her stock in Lomé. Her husband has helped. The other Kiva loans have enabled her to expand her offering. In the future, she would like to open a fish shop and to sell various goods in bulk.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes, necklaces, and shoes

loans.name: Makole F Group

texts.en:
Christina J. has been a drinks and bites seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 190. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more drinks and bites for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and pay school fees.

Christina J. is 26 years old, married, and has two children: ages 12 and 7. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Christina A. and Janeth. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and bites for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda C., 52 years old, a resident of Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City, started her sand and gravel business on a consignment arrangement which she got from her uncle. Rosalinda was grateful to HSPFI for the financial assistance that it extend to her which enabled her to grow her business. She is now on her fourth loan cycle and she is requesting for an additional loan of PHP14000 to further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sand and gravel for sale.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon G. is a dealer and retailer of “basi” (vinegar) in their village.  Her husband, Dominador, is a simple farmer and most of their products are root crops and vegetables.  Despite her age, she still strives in developing her business in order to earn and save for their future. She is presently requesting for a loan of PHP 6,000 that she will use as business capital for their farming business.  

Corazon said that by patience, she will somehow develop her business for its progress.  She is already 60 years old but still very determined to have a good life.  Through their hard work and the cooperation of their children, they were able to send them all to school which she considers the fruit of their sacrifices.

loans.use: Capital for farming business

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku N. is fifty-four years old. Kwaku is the name given to a Tuesday born Akan male. He is a married man and the father of four children. According to him, the first three of his children are out of school and the last-born is in the junior-high school. He also has one stepchild. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Kwaku is a carpenter by profession. He is into furniture making and the building of cargo car bodies. He procures hardwood that serves this purpose from sawmills in the nearby towns. Kwaku makes the furniture and places it by the roadside for sale. He has been in the carpentry business for nineteen years now and wants a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his carpentry business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
At 61 years old, Lolita S. owns a sari-sari (variety or mini grocery) store. She is a hardworking woman who is married to Plaxido, a carpenter with a meager income. They are blessed with four children. She started her business with a small amount of capital from her vegetable vending. She used and managed her money well until she could open another project, the sari-sari store, as their major source of income.

As of now, two of Lolita's children are working abroad and she is able to receive a monthly allotment as support. She needs a capital of PHP 20,000 to buy additional inventory. She looks forward to her two daughters finishing college and establishing their own careers.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha R. sells tea and is requesting for a loan to set up a little restaurant. She is 45 years old and married to a businessman. R. is the mother of one child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her child.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: opening a little restaurant

loans.name: Murod

texts.en:
K. Murod is a 49-year-old married man and the loving father of four children. For 13 years Murod has had a small shop near his house where he sells all kinds of household and foodstuff items. His children (one of them is pictured) help him with the business. He dreams that his children will enter higher education, and that is why he is working hard, together with his wife who always assists him in everything. Murod's business is successful in bringing considerable income to the family. Today Murod wants to expand his business and to increase his working capital for purchasing new goods to sell. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS. Murod has had loans from Kiva partner IMON several times already and has demonstrated that he is a reliable client. Murod promises to manage this loan reliably as well.  

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase his working capital for purchasing goods to sell

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira T. is from the village of Puntod. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Elmira owns & operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elmira has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Elmira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmira repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to  purchase additional products to sell. Elmira is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Elmira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the Kinegangosi B borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is a 41 year old married woman and the mother of three children: ages 18, 14, and 11. She also cares for one other dependent.

Six years ago, Jenny started her own shop selling soap, sugar, rice, and other goods. She works there 13 hours per day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian Schillings.

This is Jenny’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,0,00 Tsh in order to buy more products for her shop. 

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, she hopes to provide more food for her family, pay school fees, do repairs, and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase products for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mobile phone accessories in bulk for her business

loans.name: Kowuvi Komitse

texts.fr: Ce monsieur s’est spécialisé depuis 2007 dans la confection et la vente d’habits brodés. Il a appris la couture et a choisi la broderie pour se différencier de la plupart des tailleurs. Il reçoit beaucoup de commandes et est très connu dans son milieu. Cette activité lui permet surtout de prendre en charge sa femme et leurs 04 enfants. Pour acheter 20 pagnes à coudre de différente couleur, des fils à coudre et des fils à broder, il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour confectionner de nouveaux habits à vendre.
texts.en:
Since 2007, this man has specialized in the creating and selling embroidered clothes. He learned sewing and chose the skill of embroidery, in order to differentiate himself from the other tailors. He receives many orders and is very well-known in his area. This business enables him to take care of his wife and their 4 children. He is requesting a loan from WAGES (the micro-finance institution) to purchase 20 "pagnes" (colorful wax cloth) to sew in different colors, sewing thread and embroidery thread, so that he can prepare more clothes to sell.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase "pagnes" (colorful wax cloth) to embroider, sewing thread and embroidery thread

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
For the last seven years, K. Annet has made a living selling dried fish in the Wantoni and Nakawa markets. She is grateful for her success and pleased with how things have gone because she started with one stall and now has two. This new stand has meant more income and more profits. In one market, she now employs a helper to handle sales while she works in the other. She also puts lots of time and effort into make sure that the fish she sells is of high quality. 

Annet has a dream of one day buying enough fish to supply other sellers, and thereby becoming even more prosperous. In the meantime, she has applied for this loan to increase the amount of fish she can sell. Her goal is to increase her income so that she and her husband can take better care of her three children and the one niece they are also raising.

Annet also leads a loan group made up of people who are committed to expand their own small businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella S. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Estrella owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal care products and at the same time cellphone electronic loading to the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru: Иноятова Мехриниссо проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 52 года. Вдова, имеет 3 детей. По специальности Мехриниссо более 30 лет проработала учителем таджикского языка. Помимо этого она более 10 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливанием и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Mehrinisso I. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 52 and widowed with three children. For more than 30 years, Mehrinisso was a Tajik language teacher. In addition to this job, for over 10 years, she has been raising livestock, fattening the animals for resale. Mehrinisso is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly R. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child.

Merly owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Merly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Siring

texts.fr: Siring MANE est une femme de 53 ans elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont elle a la charge. Depuis son adhésion au Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO le 18 août 2005, elle ne cesse de faire des performances remarquables. Elle est vendeuse de bananes, ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de générer des bénéficies pour faire face aux différentes besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Siring Mané, aged 53, is married and the mother of four children whom she supports. Since she joined the village bank Kandé Banéto on August 18, 2005, she didn't stop improving her situation remarkably. She is a trader selling bananas. This loan will enable her to bolster her business and generate sufficient profit to meet the various needs of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her fruit trade

loans.name: Manuel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Ángel N. y su esposa la señora Mayra Patricia Sandoval son padres de tres pequeños hijos.
Tiene poco tiempo que adquirieron su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le está haciendo falta algunos detalles, pero el desea  poner las protecciones para más seguridad. En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el sé dedica a la herrería y  se encargara de  realizar las protecciones en horario adicional a su trabajo, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder abitar el patrimonio de su familia. 
Don Manuel Ángel es empleado de una taller de soldaduras en el departamento de diseño con una parte de este ingreso pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel Ángel N. and his wife, señora Mayra Patricia Sandoval, are the parents of three children. A little while ago, they acquired their house through a government credit, but it is lacking some finishing touches. He hopes to put protection on the doors and windows to have more security. Right now he doesn't have the money to buy the material. Since he does iron work, he will take care of putting the protection on in addition to his usual work. This is why he is requesting a loan to be able live in their family's asset. Don Manuel Ángel is an employee in a welding shop in the design department. He will pay back the credit with part of his income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put protecion on the windows and doors of his home

loans.name: Miriam Lucia

texts.es:
Miriam P. de 34 años, de la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, esta ubicada en un lugar periurbano y tiene una casa de cemento con escasos servicios básicos, comenzó a estudiar corte desde sus 15 años, a los 18 años trabajo en un gabinete como estilista donde aprendió a administrar un gabinete de belleza, esto fue un empuje para que ella pusiera su propio negocio a la edad de los 24 años alquilando un pequeño local.

Miriam actualmente hace 20 cortes de cabello por día, los fines de semana hace tinturados y cepillados, inicia su jornada de trabajo desde las 9am hasta las 18pm, una de las complicaciones en el sector donde vive son los ladrones ya que en una ocasión se le llevaron las herramientas de belleza con que trabaja, aunque su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la familia como maestro conductor quiere asegurar el futuro de su única hija de 15 años que estudia en un Colegio Particular.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más secadoras, tintes, planchas de cabello, en el futuro Miriam quiere tener más productos de belleza de la mujer para tener más clientela y así aportar para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam P., 34, is from the Paraíso area of Guayaquil. She is located in a periurban (immediately adjoining an urban area; between the suburbs and the countryside) area and has a cement house with few basic services. She began to learn to style hair at the age of 15 and at the age of 18 began to work as a stylist where she learned how to run a beauty salon. This was her motivation to set up her own salon at age 24 by renting a small locale for it. Miriam currently does 20 hair cuts per day. On weekends she does hair coloring and straightening. She begins her work day at 9am and works until 6pm. One of the complications inherent in the area where she lives is the number of robberies. Already on one occasion she lost all her equipment and tools to them. Although her husband helps out with household expenses with his earnings as a conductor, she wants to insure her 15-year-old only daughter's, who is in private school, future. With the loan she will buy more hair dryers, hair coloring agents, hair straighteners. In the future, Miriam wants to have more beauty products for women so that she can attract more customers and thus provide more to insure her family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl  de 28 años, vive con su esposa Delia de 20 años y su inquieto hijo Angelo de apenas 1 año,en su  humilde pero acogedora casa  en la que viven es alquilada y esta ubicada  en la sierra del Perú.Desde muy pequeño aprendió a cultivar las tierras, con mucho amor como lo hacían sus padres, pero por cuestiones de la vida migró a otra ciudad por varios años, hasta que conoció a su esposa y tuvo que regresar a producir los terrenos de su padre porque no conseguía trabajo, es así que desde hace 5 años cultiva papa (tubérculo peruano), alverja, habas y maíz; con la ayuda de su esposa, a partir de su primera cosecha observó que la siembra era rentable y que con las ganancias podía sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que a diario se esfuerza;en el futuro tiene pensado comprar una casa en la ciudad para aperturar un negocio de productos de primera necesidad, además desea sembrar en mayor cantidad porque esta seguro que sus cosechas son de calidad, también se dedicará a la crianza de animales, para hacer obtener aun mas rentabilidad.Es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y pagará puntualmente sus cuotas para acceder a más créditos, además esta satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal, porque esta compuesto por gente trabajadora como él.Con el dinero del préstamo comprará varios sacos de abono, botellas de fungicidas e insecticidas con lo que asegurará una buena cosecha; además tiene planeado guardar el dinero restante para pagar a sus trabajadores.
texts.en:
Raúl is 28 years old and lives with his wife, Delia who is 20 and their rambunctious son, Angelo who is 1. Their humble but hospitable home is rented and is located in the Peruvian sierra. Since a young child, Raúl, learned work the land with a lot of love like his parents did but due to life circumstances, he migrated to another city for a number of years until he met his wife and had to go back and harvest his father’s land because he could not find a job. For 5 years, he has cultivated potatoes, green peas, broad beans and corn. With his wife’s help on the first harvest he found that the sown field was profitable and with the earnings he can take care of his family, which is why daily he makes the effort to work hard. In the future he wants to buy a house in the city to start a business with essential household products, and wishes to sow more plants because he is sure that his harvest is of good quality and also wants to raise animals to have more profits. This is his seventh loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner), and will pay punctually his quotas so that he can have access to more loans, further, he is happy with the work of his communal bank because it is made up of hardworking people like him. With the loan, he will buy various sacks of fertilizer, fungicide bottles, and insecticides that will ensure a good harvest; he also plans to save some money to pay his workers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for his crops.

loans.name: Anibal Antonio

texts.es: Anibal de 22 años de edad es soltero, trabaja desde hace 6 años como colector de impuestos en la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa, no tiene hijos, habita en casa de su mamá a quien le apoya con los gastos de la casa (agua, luz, alimentacion). Esta solicitando su 2do credito para realizar algunas reparaciones en la casa de su mamá cambiando el techo y poniendo perlines, pues el que tiene se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y con el invierno se mete el agua, por eso desea hacer esto antes que inicien las lluvias y de esta manera darle mayor comoidad a su mamá.  Espera poder ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva para lograr realizar este pequeño proyecto, pues el asalariado solo con los creditos es que puede mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Anibal is 22 years old and unmarried. For the past six years, he's worked as a tax collector for the Juigalpa town government. He doesn't have any children. He lives with his mother and helps her by paying for the domestic expenses (water, electricity, food). He is requesting his second loan in order to do some repairs on his mother's house, replacing the roof and installing support beams, since the current roof is in bad shape and leaks during the rainy season. He wants to complete the repairs before the rains begin so his mother can be more comfortable. He hopes to receive funding from Kiva for this little project, since it is only through these loans that he is able to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing the roof

loans.name: Shadrack Ouma

texts.en: Shadrack is a 29-year-old tailor who operates his business (Shalo Dressmaking) in the Ngara area of Nairobi. He has been in this business for twelve years and says the business environment is good. He is requesting a second loan of 55,000 KES after successful completion of a first loan from the Kiva field partner, Faulu Kenya.  This loan will be used to add to his stock of fabric and to buy a sewing machine. A father to two, Shadrack hopes to establish an exhibition center in the future and have a stable family. He describes himself as polite and hardworking.

loans.use: Add stock of fabric and buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma M. is an entrepreneurial businesswoman. She is married and has two children. She has a business as a food vendor at Mbezi in Dar es Salaam.  She sells different kinds of food, both fried and cooked. She purchases her supplies from the city market and the retail shops around. Income generated is used to capitalize the business and to meet the family's daily needs. She wants a loan of 500,000 TZS to buy more business supplies.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA CASIMIRA ES UNA CLIENTE BUENA Y RESPONSABLE, ELLA  YA TRABAJO DOS SECUENCIAS EN LA INSTITUCION, EN SU COMPORTAMIENTO ELLA DEMOSTRO PUNTUALIDAD, LA SEÑORA  SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA DE NIÑO Y ABARROTES EN LA DIFERENTES FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, ELLA VENDE EN LAS FERIA DE ALTO LIMA, HUAYNA POTOSI Y LA FERIA DE  RIO SECO, SU ESPOSO TIENE LA PROFESION DE ALBAÑIL, EL TRABAJO DE SU ESPOSO ES INESTABLE POR LA FALTA DE TRABAJO QUE EXISTE EN BOLIVIA, EL CREDITO ANTERIORMENTE SOLICITADO FUE INVERTIDO EN LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU CASA EL CUAL FUE EJECUTADO POR SU ESPOSO QUE ES ALBAÑIL, SU HIJA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE TEJIDO DE MANTAS, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA POR MAYOR.

ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Casmira is a good, responsible customer. She had two previous loans, which were repaid on time. She sells children's clothing and groceries in various markets in the city of La Paz: Alto Lima, Huayna Potosi, and Rio Seco markets. Her husband is a builder. He can not work steadily because of the lack of construction work in Bolivia. Previous loan money was invested in the construction of her house. This work was done by her husband. Her daughter knits blankets. This loan will be invested in wholesale clothing. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown by extending credit to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La Señora Rosa María tiene 31 años. Ella tiene varios años de trabajar con Fundación. Por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa ambulante. Pues siempre le ha gustado este medio de vida. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Dio inicio a este negocio no tenía mucho tiempo para dedicarle a esta actividad, sus hijos mayores que le ayudan en su negocio. El financiamiento será para invertir en la compra de materia prima. Sueña con mejorar cada día su actividad.
texts.en:
Rosa María, 31, has collaborated with the Fundación for several years. She is a clothing merchant. She has always enjoyed this way of life. She has been in this line of work for over 11 years. When she started out in this business, she didn't have much time to dedicate to it; now, her oldest children help her with it. She will use the funds to buy stock items. She dreams with improving her business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy palm nuts

loans.name: Phai

texts.en: Phai O., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells groceries for an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband raises pigs and produces rice wine, earning an income of USD 8 per day to help cover the family's expenses. O. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to buy rice to produce more wine and pig food. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. O.'s husband is pictured.

loans.use: To buy rice and pig food.

loans.name: Enma Francisca

texts.es:
Enma tiene 53 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, hace años murió su esposo y quedo viuda con sus hijos. Vive sola porque ya sus hijos se casaron pero sus nietos la van a visitar todos los días (En la foto aparece con su nieto de 10 años). 

Su esposo era el que trabajaba pero al morir ella se quedo sin ningún ingreso económico, con unos cuantos ahorros que tenia ella compro pollos para vender a sus vecinos y amigos, poco a poco empezó a tener ingresos y compro un congelador porque en su refrigeradora ya no le alcanzaban los pollos. 

Ella continua con el negocio por lo que es el primer ingreso económico que tiene desde que murió su esposo. Trabaja todos los días vendiendo pollos, pavo y carnes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas pollos, carnes, pavos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una avícola de carnes, y así poder asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Enma, age 53, lives in the urban area of El Surburbio in Guayaquil. Her husband died years ago leaving her a widow with their children. She lives alone because her children are now married. But, her grandchildren visit her everyday. (She appears in the photo with her ten year old grandson.) Her husband was the one who worked. But, when he died she was left without any income. She used the savings she had to buy chickens to sell to her neighbors and friends. Little by little she started to get income. She bought a freezer because the chickens no longer fit in the refrigerator. She continues in the business as it is the first income she has had since her husband died. She works everyday selling chickens, turkey, and meats. She wants to use the loan to buy more chickens, meats, and turkeys for her business. In the future she wants to have a poultry farm to be able to have a secure old age.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens, meat, turkey

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 28 years old and married with a one-year-old child. He is a farmer from Rift Valley, Kenya, near Litein town. He has been farming for two years and employs one person from his community. His main product is milk, which he sells to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries in Sotik town. He is also a mason and earns income from offering quarry services to the local market. His main challenge in farming is the fluctuation in milk prices and lack of proper transport to the market.
Bernard has requested this loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, after successfully completing a previous loan of 30,000 KES. This loan will enable him to acquire an extra dairy cow, which will increase his milk production and earn the family enough income to improve their standard of living. In future, he would like to increase the size of his dairy herd and build a dairy unit. He will request more funds in future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata D. est mère  de 2 enfants avec deux autres personnes a sa charge. Elle habite à Nimzhat  Guediawaye. Elle est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis novembre 2004. Elle est couturière  de profession et gère  son propre atelier de couture. Elle a choisi ce métier  par vocation. Durant  la  période  des fêtes  religieuses et chrétiennes  son activité  marche très  fort. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs pour renforcer  son activité, augmenter la rentabilité de son activité.  Elle compte sur ses revenus pour assurer la scolarité  de ses 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Aminata D. had two children and has two other dependants. She lives in Nimzhat Guediawaye and is a member of the Baye Laye credit institution since november 2004. She is a professional seamstress and manages her own sewing workshop. She chose this trade by calling. During the religious and Christian holidays, her business is very active. She sollicits a 150,000 francs loan to build her business and increase her profits. She is counting on her revenues to pay for her two children's schooling.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build capital

loans.name: Nesipkul

texts.en:
Nesipkul D. is 52 years old and was born in the village of Stepnoe, where she still lives today. She was born in a low-income family with many children. She graduated from secondary school, but could not continue her studies because she had to help in the house: she pastured the cattle and milked cows. When she was 19, she was given into marriage and moved to her husband’s home, where she still lives with the husband and his elderly parents. At the husband’s place, she continued to work around the house. At that time, the family had one milk cow and a plot of land where they cultivated clover and barley. Later, their livestock grew and they got sheep and a horse.

In 1980, Nesipkul gave birth to their only son. During all these years, their efforts were aimed on supporting and expanding their household and Nesipkul never dealt with any other business. Five years ago, the D.’s son married and moved out. In 2009, Nesipkul got a loan from another bank to buy a car. The loan was used as intended and was repaid without any delays.

Now Nesipkul requests a loan to buy five calves and to harvest clover and barley. It will allow her to further develop the business. In the future, Nesipkul plans to help her son to buy a home in the Stepnoe village so that he lives closer to them.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben Y. is a 26-year-old man who takes care of his parents who are pensioners. Ruben has been in business since 2007 – he rents a trading booth in a marketplace from where he sells women’s clothing. With the help of this loan, Ruben is planning to buy more clothing for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for his customers

loans.name: Dahona

texts.en: Madame Dahona O. B. is 33 years old and is the proprietor of a general store in Lome, Togo. She sells grocery products like oil, rice, sugar, canned goods, and other items out of her home in the Agoe Quartier of Lome. She has had this business since 2005. Dahona is married to a man in the military, and they have 4 children. Dahona's income allows her to contribute to the family's expenses. Dahona has requested a loan of 400,000 CFA in order to purchase oil, rice, sugar, and canned goods.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally J. is from the village of Cabisera 15. She is 37 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sally joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sally is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mr. Suy R. is an old man whose wife appears in the photograph. Suy R. has been spending his life cultivating crops, a skill he learned from his grandparents when he was young. He is now married and has two children who are already married. His wife works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. 

Growing crops is an annual business with which he has had great success. Mr. Suy R. requests a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizer and crop seed to grow.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizer and crop seed

loans.name: Tongolo Development Group - Lugazi

texts.en: Selling fish is a lucrative business that has transformed the livelihoods of many Ugandans, especially those who live around areas where the River Nile flows. One of those areas is Lugazi. H. Hussein, age 38, has been one of the benefactors of this trade in his area. He has been plying this trade for the last 10 years. It is a business he began with encouragement from a close friend. He says he used the savings from his farming business to jump start this business. His determination, perseverance and diligence have been paying off, as exhibited by the 200,000 shillings he makes in a month. Hussein also ekes out a living with a commercial motorcycle business. Hussein is married with six kids and belongs to Tongolo Development Group - Lugazi. With this loan, he wants to buy new fishing nets for his business.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Beatrice Indoshi

texts.en:
Beatrice Indoshi M. is 37-years-old, married and a mother of four children aged between fifteen and eight years. She is a businesswoman who sells secondhand clothes on a busy street in Narok town. She has been in business for the last five years. Beatrice believes she is a hardworking woman who only needs the resources to attain her goals.

Beatrice learned about KADET from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her fifth loan. She is planning to buy more clothes to sell.

With her profits Beatrice hopes to rent a permanent shop from which she can sell her clothes. She plans to open another shop and so create employment for other people. Her future dream is to build her own house and run her shop from her own premises.

loans.use: To buy more second hand cloths for resale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single mother of a 10-year-old child. With the income she gets from her retail shop, she is able to raise and educate her child. 

Currently, she is running her business with one employee. She hopes to open more outlets for her business in the future.  

She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy margarine, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy margarine, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Jennifer has a pig production business which she has had for two years.  She also does agriculture.  

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase feed for the pigs.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jennifer hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. 

 In the future, Jennifer hopes to own a retail shop.    Jennifer is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her find new friends.

loans.use: feed for the pigs

loans.name: Teofilo Cesario

texts.es:
Teofilo Cesario V. A.  tiene 41 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con la compañera y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Teofilo se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es sembrar cacao.
Le gusta salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Teofilo Cesario V. A. is 41 years old. He lives in Unión Libre in the district of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos with his partner and three children.

The members of V.R.C La Union (the Union Community Bank) are located in the Aguas Frías area in the district of Ventanas. They pursue short-cycle agricultural work, harvesting corn, rice, and beans. They spend a lot of time doing this activity.

Teofilo has pursued agriculture, growing corn, rice, and beans, for 15 years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market in the same area.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The support from this loan will help him financially to supply the necessary goods. He faces obstacles, including plagues, illnesses, and variation in the climate. His dream is to grow cocoa. He likes to go out with his family.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Daina Pura

texts.es: La Sra. Daina vive en la zona del plan 3000, es casa propia donde vive junto a sus hijos y su  esposo. La Sra. Daina es cliente antigua en la institución, ella estuvo en el banco de emprendimiento Paraíso donde ella demostró buen comportamiento de pago, el banco de emprendimiento  Paraíso de cerro por dificultades de pago de otras 3 socias, por ese motivo la Sra. Solicito un crédito individual. La Sra. Se dedica a la venta de .colchas polar, edredones sabanas, cubrecamas, el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar mas mercadería por las fiestas de fin de año donde tiene una gran demanda, también realiza viajes a la población de tres cruces donde tiene clientes. La Sra. Dania es responsable, trabajadora y quiere mejorar sus ingresos para seguir superándose.
texts.en:
Daina lives in Plan 3000 neighborhood.  She lives in her own home together with her children and her husband.

Daina is a long-standing client of our institution.  She used to be a member of the Paraíso community bank where she had a good loan repayment history.  The Paraíso community bank closed because three of its other members had problems paying back their loans.  For this reason, Daina is currently requesting an individual loan.

Daina sells fleece bedspreads, quilts and sheets.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise for the end-of-year holiday season when there is a lot of demand.  Daina also makes trips to the town of Tres Cruces where she has customers.  She is a responsible, hard-working lady who would like to improve her income so that she can continue to better herself.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, quilts and sheets

loans.name: Conslater Akinyi

texts.en:
Conslater Akinyi O. is a 23 year old lady. She is married to Michael and they have one child. Conslater has been a water vendor for the last five years and the business is doing well. 

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase water pipes to improve on the services she offers and meet the demand of her customers.
