The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of the business. Conslater’s hopes and dreams are to grow the business and uplift the living standards of her family in the future.

loans.use: purchase water pipes to improve the services she offers her customers

loans.name: Leon De Judas Group

texts.es:
El grupo León de Judas está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Mariana P. Espinoza de 47 años quien vende ropa y productos Avon desde hace 7 años. Ella inicio con la venta de cosméticos y poco a poco invirtió en otros productos.
P. tiene nueve hijos mayores de edad de los cuales uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio.
Las integrantes de grupo son Cristhian María R. de 26 años se dedica al comercio de ropa hace un año y Rosa Argentina T. Hernández de 28 años vende calzado y ropa.
texts.en: The León de Judas Group is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising people who put a lot of effort into what they do.  One of them is Mariana P. Espinoza who is 47 years old and has sold clothing and Avon products for the past seven years.  She began with selling cosmetics and little by little, she invested in other products.  Ms. P. has nine children who are adults, and one of them helps her with the business.  The other group members are Cristhian María R., who is 26 and has worked selling clothing for a year, and Rosa Argentina T. Hernández, who is 28 years old and sells shoes and clothing.

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Ivan tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y residecon sus padres en el caserío San Pablo, en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de dos años, en un terreno de cultivo herencia de su padre siembra limón que cosecha semanalmente con el que cuenta, adicionalmente conduce una mototaxi ofreciendo servicio de transporte a sus vecinos y visitantes de la zona.

Ivan desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de limón con la finalidad de mejorar su producto y venderlo a mejor precio, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ivan  es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ivan is 29 years, single, and lives with his parents in the town of San Pablo, in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural region in the province of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has worked in agriculture for more than two years on a plot of land he inherited from his father. He grows lemons and harvests every week. He also drives a taxi and offers his transportation services to his neighbors and to people visiting the area.

Ivan wants to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his lemon crop and improve his produce in order to sell it at a higher price. He hopes this will allow him to obtain a better crop. For this reason he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles.

Ivan is a very laid-back and responsible person. His greatest desire is to grow as an entrepreneur and to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Fertilizer and pesticide for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying  coffee for sell.

loans.name: Donata

texts.es: Donata tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 5 años, Donata se dedica a la agricultura, en donD. siembra maíz y papa, productos principales para la estabilización D. su economía. Es así como se gana la vida y en cada temporada siembra o cosecha, tiene que contratar a jornaleros para que le ayuden a sembrar y extraer sus productos, D. esa manera ahorra tiempo. Sus productos son llevados a comercializar en el mercado central D. su ciudad, en ocasiones los productos que no llega a vender son usados para su propio consumo. Donata Esta acostumbrada a trabajar en el campo es por esta razón que en adelante sembrará más en terrenos que posee para así aumentar su producción. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono para su campaña D. siembra.
texts.en: Donata is 51-years-old and lives with her husband and two children in her own home.  More than five years ago, Donata began working in agriculture growing corn and potatoes which are the main products that proviD. her with a stable income.  This is how she makes a living and in each season she plants or harvests.  She has to hire workers to help her plant and harvest the products and thus save time.  Her products are taken to be sold in the central market of her city and sometimes the products that are not sold are used for their own consumption.  Donata is accustomed to working in the country and this is why she would like to plant more in the future in her plots of land so that she can increase her production.  This is her second loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support and that she has shown herself to be responsible with her payments.  Additionally, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and united.  She is thanks those who invest in the loan she is requesting as it will be very useful as her business progresses.  With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in sacks of fertilizer for her planting field.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.en:
The group "Dieu Est Grand", which means God Is Great, consists of 3 women who all live in the same neighborhood and go to the same church. They live in the Calavi district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's economic center. This is their first loan through ALIDE, and they have agreed to support each others' businesses and loan repayments.

Eugenie (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1969 in Cotonou, and has lived in Calavi for the past 10 years. Her husband, Elyseé, works with the police, and they have 2 children who both go to school. For 14 years Eugenie has run her stall from her house, where she sells primarily cloth but also food. With this loan she will restock her supplies with the aim of growing her business. Her strongest points as an entrepreneur are her client management skills.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth for resale

loans.name: C4818 Zamuka Group

texts.en:
Charles is 28 years old and is married with one child who is two years old. He is the president of a group which is called "Zamuka" in the local language. The group is composed of six people: three men and three women. Charles is the first person on the left side. He sells rice, bread, beans, cooking oil and so on. This business is well-organized. He works from 6am until 9pm every day and he has three years of experience.

Charles and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders. Charles wants to purchase additional rice, bread, beans, and cooking oil to sell. With the resulting profit, Charles and his team will be able to save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice, bread, beans, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mayita Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Girasoles, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Mayita, tiene 34 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 12, 9  y 1 año, el mayor esta en colegio el segundo en escuela. Su marido se dedica a la albañilería.

Es una ama de casa que además de cuidar su hogar y a sus hijos también se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas y edredones, trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana por las mañanas y por las noches desde las 18h00 hasta las 20h00, no trabaja en las tardes porque a esa hora tiene que ayudarles a sus hijos a realizar sus tareas escolares, y en las noches su marido se queda con ellos mientras ella realiza sus ventas. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones y un poco de ropa que le han pedido algunos clientes. Este es su séptimo  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque se divierte en las reuniones.
 
Su sueño es tener algún día un almacén.
texts.en:
In the El Progreso neighborhood of the city of Portoviej the community bank Girasoles meets every two weeks. This is a highly populated area on the outskirts of town. It is known as the jail district, since the women's jail of Portoviejo is in that area.  

Here we find Mayita. She is 34 years old and in a common law marriage which has resulted in three children, aged 12, 9 and 1. The oldest is in high school and the second child is on elementary schol. Her husband is a bricklayer.  

She is a housewife, who in addition to managing her household and her children, is a merchant. She sells sheets and comforters. She works three or four days a week in the morning and at night from 6 p.m. until 8 p.m. She doesn't work afternoons, because that is when she has to help her children do their homework. At night, her husband stays with them while she does her sales. She has been doing this activity for four years.  

This loan is to buy sheets, comforters and a little bit of clothing that some customers have asked her for. This is her seventh cycle with the community bank and she likes it because she has fun at the meetings. 
 
Her dream is to have a store some day.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters and clothing.

loans.name: Shelame

texts.en:
Shelame is from the village of Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is 26 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Shelame runs a business selling fish in the local community.

Shelame has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities. Shelame joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Shelame is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP with which she will purchase more fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Shelame from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mujeres De La Hondonada 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the group Mujeres de la Hondonada (Women from Hondonada) 2 & 3, which is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo. All the members of this group are engaged in different types of sales, such as clothing, shoes, groceries and many others.

Rosa, a single mother, makes her home in a simple structure with her three children, who attend school. She requires a loan to buy different styles of shoes, underwear, caps, cosmetics, accessories and clothes. This is her second loan with Esperanza International. She is taking a step towards improving her business by investing this loan to increase her sales. She has had her business for over one year, having decided to start it after she needed to generate income to provide for her household. As a single mother with three children, she found that working for others didn't give her enough income to meet the family's needs. Rosa will use the profits as savings. Her most difficult challenges are to raise her children and give them a good education. Rosa and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products such as caps, shoes, clothing, cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Picoy. Junto a su esposo Marcos de 36 años y su única hija Yulisa de 13 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio Carmen ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva papa y arveja, productos que luego lleva a vender a la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Para ello también dedica su tiempo libres a trabajar en terrenos aledaños, donde le pagan S/. 15 nuevos soles diarios por quitar la maleza que crece de entre sus cultivos. Así está segura que podrá juntar más dinero con lo que pueda adquirir varios terrenos de cultivo junto al río, teniendo al alcance el regadillo que necesitan su siembra para desarrollar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Ahora comenzará a producir flores en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos para el mes de noviembre donde la demanda de flores crece por motivo de las festividades nacionales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Exaltación Santa Cruz”, donde es el noveno crédito con MFP y está contenta de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero para sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Carmen, comprará con el dinero solicitado semilla de flor de gladiolo, además de varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con mucho éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Carmen, 42 years old, is a humble, hardworking mother. She lives in her own home in the village of Picoy with her husband Marcos, 36, and their only daughter, Yulisa, who is 13 years old. Marcos and Yuliza are the inspiration for all her hard work. Through great effort and sacrifice, Carmen has been able to work her lands and make them very fertile. She grows potatoes and peas, which she then carries to the city of Tarma to sell at wholesale. Her harvests have provided enough income to support her family, which is why she wants to put everything she has into growing her business. She also works weeding the crops in neighboring fields in her spare time, for which she earns 15 soles a day. She is confident that she'll be able to earn enough money to acquire fields along the river, which will be easy to irrigate and improve her harvest. What she likes most about her job is taking care of her crops. She's been farming for four years and thinks the hardest part is taking her product to the wholesale market in Tarma, since the sacks are very heavy and tire her out. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and earn more income. She plans to start growing flowers on her land in anticipation of November, when demand for flowers goes up because of the national holidays. She is a member of the Exaltación Santa Cruz village bank, and this is her ninth loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she will have financial support in meeting her goals. She is committed once again to making her payments on time, as she did for previous loans. She is also happy to be part of a village bank because all the other members are very responsible, supportive people. Carmen will use the requested loan to buy gladiolus seeds, as well as several bags of organic fertilizers to make her next plantings very successful.

loans.use: purchase flower seeds such as gladiolus as well as bags of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Adalia

texts.en:
Adalia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children. 

Adalia raises pigs and sells piglets. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy animal feed for the hogs.
Adalia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Adalia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the hogs

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria Del Carmen se dedica a un kiosco ubicado en las afueras del hospital. Dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 1 año, inicio con fondos propios y poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio de tal manera que pudiera vender cierta variedad de productos.  Ella afirma que su objetivo al establecer este negocio fue buscando una fuente alternativa para brindarle manutención a sus hijos, sin embargo este negocio les ha servido muchísimo para salir adelante, ya que sus hijos pueden tener la oportunidad de estudiar. Actualmente está solicitando este crédito para la compra de jugos, refrescos, galletas, pan, golosinas y gaseosas.
texts.en: Doña Maria del Carmen runs a stand located just outside the hospital.  She started her business a year ago with her own money and little by little has been able to re-invest in her business and offer a variety of products.  She claims her goal was to find an alternative means of income for her children and it has certainly helped them get ahead, since her children are getting an education.  She is requesting a loan to buy juices, softdrinks, cookies, bread, sweets and sodas.

loans.use: To buy juices, softdrinks, cookies, bread, sweets and sodas.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a farmer who tills land in Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has 4 children. Jose has been growing rice for 20 years. He earns about 5,000 PHP per month from farming. Jose works hard to support his family.

Jose requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to have a stable business and better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli is 63 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Noli has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Noli requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials needed for tailoring like textiles and thread.

Noli has been in this business for 45 years. In the future, Noli would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Milly has run a business selling clothes. She is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

Milly is requesting a 2,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase clothes to resell. With the help of her loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Султон проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 59 лет. Он женат. У него 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Двое его сыновей находятся в Российской Федерации. Сам Султон занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает мужскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки школьной формы и обуви.
texts.en: Sulton lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 59 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Two of their sons are in the Russian Federation.  Sulton is involved in retail sales.  He leases a retail outlet at the market, where he sells men's clothing and shoes.  He has been involved in this business for twenty years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of school uniforms and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies such as juices, sodas, cookies, detergents, and sweets for her business.

loans.name: Maréme

texts.fr: Commercante dans une ville située a quelques kilometres de la capitale du Sénégal, elle s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Achetant ses marchandises en Gambie et en Mauritanie, ce ptêt lui permettra de faire les voyages beaucoup plus facile et d'acheter des produits comme des portables, des produits divers telque du savons des parfums.Cela a pour but de renforcer son stock de marchandises et de répondre a l'attente des clients quotidiennement. Ce prêt aussi va l'aider a améliorer son fond de roulement en lui permettant d'anticiper sur les événements auquel les clients sollicitent ses produits.
texts.en: A saleswoman in a town located at some kilometers from the capital of Senegal, she has been working in sales for more than five years. As she buys her merchandise in Gambia and in Mauritania, this loan will allow her to make much easier journeys and buy products like cell phones, various products such as soaps and perfumes. The goal of this is to bolster her stock of merchandise and respond daily to the needs of her customers. This loan will also help her improve her working capital by allowing her to anticipate events for which customers request her products.

loans.use: permettre de faire du commerce

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is single and 36 years old. For the past six years he has made a living as a dairy farmer.  

Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He wants to become more financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chhun Eng

texts.en:
Chhun Eng and her husband, Sokun, are silk weavers. They have been married since 1990, and they have three children -- one son and two daughters.  One child is a weaver; another one is in school; and another one is still young. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City in Cambodia.

Chhun Eng is requesting another loan of $300 to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk materials.

Photo: Chhun Eng is not pictured with her loom because under her the area is flooded. She needs to move her looms to her mother’s house, the same location where she lives, because that location is not affected by the flood.

loans.use: to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk materials.

loans.name: Calle 1 De Enero (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle 1 de Enero se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que desde hace algunos años decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido  de mucho, ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar sus negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nora, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  12 y 9 años, la mayor estudia en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un taller de ebanistería.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para generar sus propios ingresos hace dos años atrás instalo un pequeño negocio en su casa, en el cual vende materiales de ferretería, en especial los utilizados en la elaboración de muebles, ella entrega sus productos a algunos talleres de ebanistería de la localidad, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, además también allí mismo vende bidones de agua y ciertas golosinas. 

Ester crédito es para comprar bisagras, clavos, pinturas, bidones de agua y otros materiales de ferretería que  vende en su local. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que le brinda la institución.
  
Su sueño es tener un gran centro ferretero.
texts.en:
The “Calle 1 de Enero” communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton (Portoviejo) known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are well known both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

This is a group of people who decided years ago to join together and form this communal bank which has been very useful for them since they’ve been able to improve their businesses thanks to the loans.  They carry out a variety of activities like general commerce and services, among others.

We met Nora, 43, here.  She’s married and has two daughters who are 12 and 9 years old.  The oldest is in secondary school and the youngest in elementary school.  Her husband works in a cabinet shop.

She’s a great housewife who set up a small home-based hardware store years ago to earn her own income.  She sells hardware supplies especially those used in furniture manufacturing.  She sells merchandise to some local cabinet making shops in her area.  She works Monday through Saturday from 8am until 6pm.  She also sells large jugs of bottled water and certain snacks.

This loan is to buy hinges, nails, paint, jugs of bottled water and other hardware supplies that she sells in her store.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the benefits the institution provides.  Her dream is to have a large hardware supply center.

loans.use: to buy hinges, nails, paint, water jugs and other hardware supplies.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 37 years old and married with four children. To earn a living, he sells fish and runs a grocery. He has been in the business for five years. Previously, he used to sell clothes. 

Boniface has been able to improve his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because of his previous loan. He hopes to fully establish his business in five years. He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to expand his business premises.

loans.use: to expand the business premises.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a businesswoman who has operated a cybercafe for the last two years. Her monthly income is KES 3,000. She is 26 years old and supports her parents. 

Josephine was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member during a marketing campaign in the town of Narok. She is a good client, and she has applied for a loan to buy more computers to expand her cybercafe.

She hopes to generate profits to reinvest in her business. She can do more with additional resources.

loans.use: to buy more computers to expand her cybercafe.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es: Ramón De Jesús se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, este negocio lo ha tenido desde hace más de 4 años. El negocio lo aprendió por cuenta propia ya que necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia. El empieza su trabajo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, todos los días tiene la responsabilidad de ayudarle a su esposa con los ingresos. El financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, focos, repuestos entre otros. Sueña con lograr comprar dos tricitaxi.
texts.en: Ramón De Jesús provides taxi services, a business he’s had for over four years.  He learned the business on his own because he needed to support his family.  He starts work at 7am and goes until 9pm.  Every day he has the responsibility of helping his wife with income.  The loan will be used to buy tires, headlamps and spare parts, among others.  He dreams with being able to buy two three-wheeled taxis.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlamps and spare parts, among others.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 35 years old, married, and has three children. He had worked as a laborer for two years but he decided to involve himself in corn production. He has been in this field for three years. He grows corn to sell. 

Victor is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use in farming. He hopes to earn consistent profits from his business.
 
He also wants to improve his farming practices to upgrade his income for the college education of his children, who are currently in their elementary level of education.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 30 years old, married to Pietrina, and is blessed with two children. He has been running a private school for the past three years and has a monthly income of KES 10,000.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Benson will use the loan to renovate the school classrooms and buy chairs. With the anticipated profit from the business he plans to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to expand the school to accommodate a larger number of students.

loans.use: to renovate school classrooms and to buy chairs

loans.name: Sei

texts.en: Mrs. Sei is 33 years old and a mother of 2 school-aged kids. She lives in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. As shown, Sei is selling petrol and soft drinks like sugar cane juice, types of cola, and pure drinking water in front of her house, which is located along the National Road 26A. Most of her customers are travelers who pass her house back and forth everyday. She really enjoys operating her business, from which she is able to generate income of $4.00 per day. Besides this business, Sei wants to be involved in a business selling small stones to make additional income. However, she can’t start it without any capital from lenders. Thus, she is taking her fifth loan from HKL and first loan from Kiva to purchase small stones for sale. She hopes that she’ll be able to attain a higher standard of living as her business grows and that she will be able to provide her two children great opportunities for further education with her generated income.

loans.use: to purchase small stones for sale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 60 years old and still has one child who is in school.

Lourdes has a fruit and vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her stall.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to build a restaurant in the market.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Daradji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Daradji a été crée le 08 mai 2010. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent pratiquement les mêmes activités (embouche et petit commerce) Ndiagna Debout à droite de la photo est la  responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement  en légumes et acheter un mouton à emboucher. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Daradji was formed on May 8, 2010. It is made up of 10 women from the same region. They are in practically the same businesses (animal fattening and shopkeeping).

Ndiagna, standing on the right in the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 45 years old. She is married and mother to six children. She fattens sheep.

With her loan she is going to increase her stock of vegetables and buy a sheep to fatten. Her profits will allow her to support her husband in taking care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Ms. Akossiwa N. is a 36-year-old mother of three children living in a polygamous family. She has had to work hard to give her children a better life and to earn the respect of her husband and his other wives. She says that in order to do so, she has much work to do in developing her cloth-selling business. She needs enough capital to regularly renew her stock. This is why she is requesting a loan of $1200, which will allow her to renew her stock of traditional cloth in order to corner the market and satisfy her clients. In the past, she has always proven herself to be a trustworthy woman.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 36 ans et mère de trois (03) enfants dans une famille polygame, Madame N. Akossiwa a pour défi de travailler dur pour éviter la traîne à ses enfants et se faire respecter par son mari et ses coépouses. Ainsi, le commerce de pagne à des exigences nous a-t-elle confié. Il faut disposer de fonds de commerce conséquent afin de renouveler régulièrement le stock. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement de $1200, un montant qui lui permettra de renouveler son stock de pagnes pour conquérir le terrain et fidéliser les clients. Elle a toujours fait preuve d’une bonne conduite par le passé.

loans.use: To renew her stock of traditional cloth

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong and her husband are both 50 years old. They have 4 children between the ages of 21 and 15. Mrs. Huong has a cardiac disease and her second child is mentally retarded so both of them must spend about $20 for medical treatment per month. The family has a little land for cultivation: 4000 m2 to plant rice and cashew nut trees. The cashew nut trees are only two years old, so they don’t produce nuts yet. Thanh, her husband, works as a daily laborer, but the work is not stable. Her first child, Thanh, works as a day laborer at HCM city, but he only earns enough money for himself. Selling fish is very important for them to incease their income by $0.5/person/month. The average income is low at $8/person/month. Mrs. Huong has already repaid a loan of $50 and now she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her rice planting and fish business.

loans.use: selling fish

loans.name: Iram

texts.es:
Iram is married, and he has 6 girls ranging from 5 to 19 years of age. Iram lost his job about 5 years ago, and it became very difficult for him to find another job. This brought a lot of financial difficulties to his family so he decided to start his own business. He put up a food stand in his carport where he sells hamburgers and hot dogs. Since he started his business, he has learned that he really enjoys selling, and his entrepreneurial spirit have helped him in making his business a success.

His daughters help him as well when they have free time. With the help of his family, he has been able to move ahead. At this time, Iram is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which he wil use to buy cooking ingredients. He hopes to increase his food production to satisfy customer demand. He commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Become a part of the success of this business by helping Iram improve his business and his family's living conditions. They greatly appreciate your support and trust!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Iram es casado y tiene seis hijas de entre 5 y 19 años de edad. Hace cinco años Iram quedó desempleado y le fue muy difícil conseguir otro trabajo, esto dio inicio a muchos problemas económicos en la familia por lo que decidió abrir su propio negocio, en la cochera de su casa instaló un puesto para vender hamburguesas y hot dogs, una vez que inició su negocio descubrió su gusto por las ventas y su espíritu emprendedor que le han sido de gran ayuda para el desarrollo y crecimiento de su negocio.

En sus ratos libres, sus hijas colaboran con él en su negocio, juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante, ahora Iram está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, con lo que espera incrementar su producción para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en este negocio y en la vida de Iram y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente el apoyo y confianza que les brindas.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en: A 26-year-old woman, married with three children woman, Mrs Chhean O. works selling a variety of vegetables in an open air market, where she generally makes about $3 each day. Her husband is self-employed as a recycler, earning around $2 each day. This loan is to be used to purchase a motorcycle to help transporting her husband’s recyclable items further, faster, easier and more effectively.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to help transporting her husband’s recyclable items further faster, easier and more effectively.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mr. San T., aged 38, works growing and selling mushrooms at his home.  He makes about $12 per day in revenue.  His wife runs a stand at the market selling fish, making about $2 per day in profit.  They have five children, two of whom assist him in growing mushrooms, and three who are students.  Mr. San T. would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase additional seedlings to expand his inventory of mushrooms to meet customer demand.  This will lead to increased income to support his family and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase mushroom seedlings to expand his business.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: H. Farogat has sold women's clothes for 2 years. Her business stand is located in bazar of Spitamen,Tadjklistan. She sells her goods at a high rate, and she has many regualar clients. She will use the loan to diversify the kinds of clothes that she sells, and she hopes to do good business during the holiday season.

loans.use: purchase of winter clothes.

loans.name: Ccatun Sacha Group

texts.es:
The communal bank Ccatun Sacha, which in quechua means "big tree", started a year and 10 months ago. Currently there are 25 members who have been together for 7 cycles. The founding members were Flor D. Maria, Irma, Aurea, DanieL., Norma, and Marleny.

The members tell us that at the beginning, the communal bank went through many difficulties, which they have overcome little by little. At the same time, they say that in the communal bank they learned to be generous, share among members, and to be responsible, punctual, and to save.

The members have different businesses such as food sales, general store, vegetables, cosmetics, fruit, juices, sweets, making breads and selling at fairs.

Each member has a different story to tell, as is the case of Irma, who joined the communal bank through a neighbors' invitation. Irma started with savings of US$ 10. Back then she sold fruit at the fairs and helped selling vegetables at the local market. Right now, with the loan she got from her communal bank, she started a new business selling food at a bus stop.

On her part, Tomasa mentions that thanks to the savings she saved at the communal bank, she built her house. She used to sell tara gum and cochinilL. (an insect used to make pigments)

The members need different sums in loan, some loans are for 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, adding up to 10,200 soles in loans at the communal bank. They will invest the loans buying milk, sugar, rice, potatoes, broad beans, wheat, maize, barley, papaya, banana, orange, pineapple, avocado, yucca, cookies, chocolate bars, flour, and buying a display cabinet.

Their savings will be used in their children's graduations, education, having their own capital, and to get married. The bank's members' dreams are to build their home, start a new business selling glass, have their own locale, for their children to be professional, and traveling abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal “Ccatun Sacha”, palabra quechua que significa “árbol granD.”, se inició hace 1 año y 10 meses. Actualmente son 25 socias y ya tienen 7 ciclos juntas. Las socias fundadoras fueron Flor D. Maria, Irma, Aurea, DanieL., Norma y Marleny.

Las socias cuentan que al inicio el Banco Comunal tuvo muchas dificultades, que han sido superadas poco a poco. Pero al mismo tiempo dicen que en el Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser generosas y a compartir entre socias, a ser responsables, puntuales y a ahorrar.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta D. comida, abarrotes, verduras, cosméticos, fruta, jugos, golosinas, elaboración D. panes y feriantes.<> Cada socia tiene una historia diferente que contar, como es el caso D. Irma, quien ingresó al Banco Comunal por invitación D. una vecina. Irma inició con un ahorro D. 10 dólares y en ese entonces elL. vendía frutas en las ferias y ayudaba a vender verduras en el mercado local. Actualmente con el préstamo que sacó D. su Banco Comunal implementó otro negocio D. venta D. comida en un paradero D. transporte público.

Por otro lado Tomasa menciona que gracias a los ahorros que reunió en su Banco Comunal construyó su casa, en ese entonces elL. vendía tara y cochinilL..

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 10200 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. leche, azúcar, arroz, papa, choclo, haba, trigo, maíz, cebada, papaya, plátano, naranja, piña, palta, yuca, galletas, chocolates, harina y para L. compra D. un exhibidor.

Los ahorros los utilizarán para L. graduación D. sus hijos, los estudios superiores D. sus hijos, tener un capital propio y para casarse. Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, iniciar un nuevo negocio D. vidriería, tener un local propio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y viajar al extranjero.

loans.use: buying milk, sugar, rice, potatoes, broad beans, wheat, maize, barley, papaya, banana, orange, pineapple, avocado, yucca, cookies, chocolate bars, flour, and buying a display cabinet.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Ms. Rena is 47-year-old local resident of Saatli town. For more than 10 years, she has been breeding cattle in her yard. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products.

Rena wants to develop this business by increasing the number of cows. She has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy more calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda and her husband are farmers and their crops are the only income with which they support themselves. With this work they have been able to face life's hardships. They are really dedicated to their work growing fruit and it gives them much satisfaction. For this reason they work hard to ensure that their fields aren't neglected. Since they need to business to survive, they need our support to pay for the production and to buy manure, seeds and fertilizer through a loan. They are asking us to meet their need so that we can be an important source for their economic growth.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Nilda y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y es el único ingreso económico con el que subsisten y con el cual han podido hacer frente a las grandes adversidades de la vida, el cultivo de frutas es algo que les apasiona y les da muchas satisfacciones es por ello que tratan en lo posible de no descuidar sus campos de cultivo.Siendo está su actividad indispensable para sobrevivir requiere le apoyemos para su debido mantenimiento de producción y para la compra de abonos, semillas y fertilizantes a través de un préstamo Pide por favor atendamos a su requerimiento y podamos ser un ente importante para su crecimiento económico.

loans.use: Purchase manure, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un S., age 60 is a widow with four children. She works as a housewife, and looks after the children and cooks food for the family members. Her daughter, Ms. Son Chanmarina (pictured here), age 30, works as a hair dresser in Phnom Penh. She earns about $10 per day. Two daughters help Ms. Son Chanmarina in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Un S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase hair dressing tools for her daughter. With the remainder of the loan, she plans to buy a grinding mill. She will hire local people to run this machine and earn more money to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase hair dressing tools and a grinding mill

loans.name: You

texts.en: Mrs. You V. is a palm sugar maker and makes about $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Nut Ty, is a farmer and makes about $2 per day. They live with their four children in Bang Kong Khmom Village, Pursat Province. They request a loan of $500 to purchase equipments for palm sugar making in order to purchase palm sugar so they can then stock and sell . This loan will expand their business and improve their income to support their family sufficiently.

loans.use: To purchase equipments for palm sugar making in order to purchase palm sugar for stocking and selling.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
A. Mahsuda is 41 years old. She is married. She is the loving mother of three children. Her husband is entrepreneur. 

Mahsuda has been running her own business for 14 years. She sells children's clothes in a store located in one of the intensively inhabited parts of the city. She started out with only a few products, but her business is currently more stable.  Mahsuda is very nice and polite and has many clients. The business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for the family.

She is requesting 3000 Somoni ($875 USD) to increase her stock of summer clothes for kids. Mahsuda is planning to repay the loan completely in 5 months. She promises to be accurate when repaying the loan and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To buy new children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio is 24 years old, he is single and he attends school in the evenings at the University. He is currently taking his third year of his Accounting degree.

Julio started as a very young man as a vendor alongside his father. Later he purchased a motorcycle and started to work for his own accord 4 years ago.

Every day he starts his day at 4:00 a.m. to start making his rounds. He conducts his sales and collects his dues from house to house, travelling many kilometres every day.

He requires this credit for the purchase of merchandise given the grate demand that he sees for his products, including blankets, eiderdowns, blenders, bed sheets, towels, and meat grinders, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero estudia a la noche en la Facultad, esta cursando actualmente el tercer año de la carrera de Contabilidad.

Julio empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre como vendedor, luego adquirió para su moto y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia hace 4 años.

Todos los días se levanta a las 04:00 AM. para empezar sus recorridas, el vende y a la vez realiza las cobranzas casa por casa, recorriendo varios kilómetros diarios.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías por la gran demanda que posee de sus productos como colchas, edredones, licuadoras, sábanas, toallas, molinadores de carne, entre otros.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise: blankets, eiderdowns, and blenders.

loans.name: Egidia

texts.es:
Mrs. Egidia is 30 years old and is married to Alfredo Cuyua with whom she has one child. They own a butcher shop which they have run for many years.

Their business is located right in the center of Luque and they offer meats and cold cuts to merchants and individuals who purchase wholesale, then sell them in their smaller retails shops.

The loan they are requesting is to purchase a greater quantity of meat to meet the huge demand they are facing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Egidia tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Alfredo Cuyua, tienen 1 hijo, y son propietarios de una carnicería que ya tiene varios años funcionando.

El negocio está ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Luque, donde provee de carnes y embutidos a comerciantes y a particulares que compran sus carnes al por mayor para luego venderlos en sus despensas o negocios.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra en mayor cantidad de carne, ya que de esa forma ella podrá cumplir con la gran demanda de pedidos que tiene.

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovan P., 42, and her husband, Mr. Savuth Chem, 44, live in a Phnom Penh suburb. They were married in 1985 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives in the family home, and their son is a truck driver. He purchases and hauls dirt to sell to villagers for leveling their house foundations.

Mrs. Sovan has been farming since she was young. She grows rice in the village. Besides farming, she sells dessert in Phnom Penh. Her husband is an army soldier, but now he is sick and staying at home.

Now Sovan is requesting a loan of US$1200 to expand her son's business of purchasing and hauling dirt to sell for leveling house foundations.

loans.use: To expand her son's business of purchasing and hauling dirt to sell for leveling house foundations.

loans.name: Salvadora Natividad

texts.es: La microempresaria Salvadora Natividad R. S.  es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos menores de edad, cabe señalar que los servicios básicos, alimentación, vestimenta y educación son pagados con el único ingreso  de su negocio. La microempresaria tiene 19 años  de experiencia en la transformación del oro y la plata en aretes, anillos, pulseras y cadenas. Sus clientes son padres de familia de esta ciudad de Bluefields que la prefieren porque tiene precios accesibles. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita la Sra. R. para comprar: 40   gramos de oro a $ 10.00 dólares el gramo, 10 gramo de plata a $ 7.00 dólares el gramo, 5 unidades de piedra para decorar los anillos a $ 10.00 dólares cada piedra y 1 galón de gasolina a $ 5.00 dólares, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes
texts.en:
Small businesswoman Salvadora Natividad R. S. is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is 45 years old, single mother of three children, and she shares that the basic services, food, clothing, and education are paid for only with the income from her business. She has 19 years of experience in transforming gold and silver into earrings, rings, bracelets and chains. Her customers are parents in Bluefields who prefer her because she has accessible prices. This is her second loan, and she plans on buying: 40 grams of gold at $10/gram, 10 grams of silver at $7/gram, 5 units of stone to decorate the rings at $10/each stone and 1 gallon of gasoline at $5. With this investment she will be able to meet her customer’s demands.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gold, silver, stones and gasoline

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Ban N., 48, is married and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has worked together with her husband on their farmland, growing rice and vegetables. They earn a combined US$6 each day and are aided by one child who works selling groceries from her home. Ban N. is asking for a loan of US$700 to add to their grocery inventory for her children. (Ban N.'s daughter is pictured)

loans.use: To add to their grocery inventory.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N., a hardworking, honest, and self-motivated mother of 4, is 56 years old. Three of her children are government servants in the ministry of health, and the youngest is in her final year pursuing a bachelor's degree in law at a Ugandan university.

Being a qualified and enrolled nurse, she operates Bagatya drug shop along Tororo Road, opposite Iganga hospital. Christine added the loan onto her savings and is purchasing more medicine for her shop. Previously, she has been using her salary as a nurse to finance her business. It is the income from her 15 years of her drug shop business that has enabled her to see her 4 children through university.

With her business located opposite the main hospital in the district, Christine intends to inject the profits back into her business because she aspires to own a wholesale/retail pharmacy that will be legally licensed to sell a wide range of drugs in the same location, so as to attract the awesome number of clients from the hospital. Besides, with the increased income from the business, she will be in a position to complete her storied residential house.

loans.use: Purchasing more medicine for her shop

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel O. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs like crayfish, melon, beans, etc. 

Mabel needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 

She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mirian Janet

texts.es:
La señora Mirian Janet H.  H. tiene 37 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco H., provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, tiene  01 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Mirian se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, inicio su negocio por iniciativa de su familia empezó vendiendo algunos productos y con las ganancias que obtuvo logro formar un capital de trabajo, con el tiempo ha logrado conseguir clientela y aumentar sus ventas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de productos de belleza y mejoras en su domicilio.
Mirian sueña con lograr que su hija sea una profesional y viajar con ella a conocer el cuzco.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirian Janet H. H. is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco H., in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied up to the 3rd year of middle school and has 1 dependent daughter. Mirian sells beauty products for a living. She started her business out of her family’s initiative. She began by selling some products, and with the profits that she was able to earn, she managed to accumulate business capital. Over time, she has been able to form a client-base and increase her earnings. She runs her business from home.

She invested the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from her local microfinance institute—“Las Palmeras”—in purchasing beauty products.

She will invest this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, in purchasing beauty products and in home improvement.

Mirian dreams of helping her daughter become a professional and traveling with her to the Cuzco region.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and beauty products

loans.name: Margaret Kyeyune Group

texts.en: Margaret K. is the leader of the loan group, Wojje Azeewo, which is based in Nazigo. She is married and has children that attend school.  She also cares for two other relatives and pays their school fees. With her husband, she farms bananas, maize, beans, cassava, and sweet potatoes to sell.  They have been able to buy a pick up truck to transport their produce to the market.  They also rent out the truck to others.  Additionally, Margaret and her husband own a motorcycle business.  Margaret is requesting a loan to buy more quality seeds for the farm and repair her motorcycle.

loans.use: to buying more quality seeds for her farm and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Medicia

texts.en: Medicia, 50, a single parent, has a child to take care and look after. Her husband left them while her son was still one-year old. In spite of this, Medicia is still a very optimistic woman.   For her, life doesn't end there, she must continue to earn a living for her son's sake. When she heard about HSPFI offering financial assistance to micro entrepreneurs, she joined and availed a loan amounting to PHP5000. She used proceeds of her loan to start her small variety store to to support their needs. For now, she is in need amounting to PHP14000 to purchase additional grocery items to be more competitive in the market. The more stocks she would have the more income she would get and part of it will be used send her son to school.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her small variety store

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en: Parvana A. is 40 years old, married and has three children. Parvana has been running a grocery store for the past ten years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and also detergents. The goods she has for sale are of very good quality with a wide selection. Parvana is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to buy groceries from her again. Parvana is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Parvana reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: To purchase more food inventory.

loans.name: Ruth Mirim

texts.en:
Ruth is the Secretary of the “Juntos de la Mano” (“Holding Hands”) Village Bank; she is pictured below with the group's official Book of Records, which she is in charge of. She is 31 years old and is separated with two children, who are 11 and 15 years old.

Ruth buys and sells livestock like pigs and cows. She buys the animals from farmers, slaughters them, and sells the meat to market vendors. She has been in this line of work for many years; her mother also buys and sells livestock. Ruth works six to seven days per week, depending on the volume of business, which varies from day to day. She travels to nearby farms to pick up the animals on a rental truck, then takes the cows to the slaughterhouse and slaughters the pigs herself at home.

Ruth is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy more livestock. She still isn’t quite sure whether she will buy pigs or a cow; pigs cost 300-1200 soles, depending on their weight, and cows cost 1200-2200 soles. She plans to survey the animals available before she makes her decision. Ruth has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Her goal for the future is to open a butcher shop in Cusco to exclusively sell pork.

loans.use: Buy a cow or pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is the president of the Sumac Soncco (“Loving Heart” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 42 years old and married with three children who are 23, 15 and 11 years old. Rosa sells backpacks from a stand at the Paraiso Commercial Center in the city of Cusco. She has been in this business for eight years. She usually works alone, though her children sometimes help her when they are not in school.

Rosa is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more backpacks from local providers in Cusco. Her goal for the future is to start sewing and selling her own backpacks. She has been an Arariwa client for one year now, and is starting her first loan cycle as group president. As president, she will call meetings to order, enforce the group’s internal regulations (imposing fines on members who arrive late, designating certain members to cook a meal for each meeting, etc.) and generally ensure that the group is working together smoothly.

Rosa has pledged to repay this loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy backpacks

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Thuỷ Nguyễn Thị (41081758) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two infant-aged children. She owns and operates a general store in the local community, primarily selling children's products such as toys & games. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Thuỷ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Thuỷ is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 2nd loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
"I invested so much in our fishing business. I am a fisherman and my wife and children depend on me to buy the things we need for the house. I am the father and I want to send all my children to school," says Virgilio J., a 33 year-old father of four children.

He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 20,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fishing materials and to repair the fishing boat. He is also interested to venture into other lines of business.

CEVI provides financial services to rural communities. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and to repair the fishing boat.

loans.name: Nukrabi

texts.ru: Нукраби Мирзоева проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Нукраби более 3 лет занимается животноводством. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы закупить крупно рогатый скот, для откармливания и продажи.
texts.en:
Nukrabi M. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband is working in Russia. Nukrabi has been involved in animal husbandry for over 3 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy cattle to feed and resell.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Abdulhair

texts.ru: Саидов Абдулхайр проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Сам Абдулхайр более 8 лет работал на "типографии". В данный момент более 6 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа крупно рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en:
Abdulhair S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 51 years old, married and has 5 children. His oldest son works in Russia. Abdulhair worked in printing for over 8 years. At the moment, he has been involved in animal husbandry, i.e. feeding and selling livestock, for over 6 years. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase cattle and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and feed

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose is 38 years old and married with three children. She has a salon where she styles hair and sells hair extensions and drinks. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more hairdressing materials, hair extensions and drinks. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hairdressing materials

loans.name: Istatoy

texts.en: N. Istatoy is 33 years old. She is married and is the mother of two children. Istatoy's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an ecologist didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the family. This was the reason that Istatoy decided to start her own business eight years ago, selling national dresses for women. Little by little she has made her business grow and, by offering her clients installment payments, her orders are getting bigger. Now Istatoy’s business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so that her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni that will enable her to buy new garments for her business. The power to help her business grow is in your hands. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more national dresses to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Sonia, ella es natural de Urubamba, vive en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de Urubamba, ubicado a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco en carro provincial.

Nuestra socia tiene 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos  ella, se dedica aparte del cuidado de su hogar y sus hijos al comercio minorista, ella tienen en su misma casa un espacio destinado a la venta de chicha y leña, ella compra leña al por mayor y lo vende al por menor, la chicha es una bebida a base de maíz amarillo, por lo que tiene muchas proteínas y es económica de elaborarse y de obtener, el esposo de nuestra socia tiene un vehículo motorizado, el cuál les sirve para prestar servicio de transporte dentro del mismo Urubamba, la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en sus diferentes negocios un poco por aquí y otro por allá.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is Ms. Sonia. She is a native of Urubamba and lives in the heart of the sacred valley of Urubamba, located an hour and 20 minutes by provincial truck from the city of Cusco.

Our member is 30 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is engaged in the maintenance of her home and children and in a retail business. She has in her own home a space for the sale of chichi, an alcoholic drink made from maize which has a lot of protein and is economical to produce and to obtain. She also sells firewood, which she buys wholesale and sells retail. Her husband has a motor vehicle that provides transportation services within Urubamba. She needs the loan to invest in her different businesses, a little here, a little there.

This member appreciates the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her fees in the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: running her businesses

loans.name: Ramy

texts.en: Ramy is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007 he decided to begin a new career and opened his own business, an electronic repair shop. Today, Ramy is applying for a loan of in the amount of 1,200 to buy more equipment for his business.

loans.use: To buy equipment.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en: Desideria A. is from the village of Sta. Filomena. She is 52 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Desideria owns and operates a business providing multi-cab passenger services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Desideria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Desideria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in a new business such as selling ground meat known as "logganisa". This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in another business such as selling longganisa

loans.name: Tchapo B.

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert en 2003 dans le quartier de Nukafu à Lomé une boutique de vente de trousseaux pour enfants ; en effet, elle vend des chaussures, des biberons, des chemisettes pour enfants et bébés. Elle a épousé un cadre commercial qui l’oriente et la conseille dans la gestion de cette boutique, rare dans le coin. Elle réalise de bonnes affaires ces temps-ci et prévoit vendre plus pour les fêtes de fin d’années. Pour disposer d’un stock à la mode, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des chaussures de qualité, des chemisettes et robes pour enfants ainsi que des biberons à la mode. Elle est mère de 02 enfants et pense que ce prêt apportera un changement positif dans l’évolution de son commerce
texts.en:
In 2003, this lady opened a store selling children's clothing in the Nukafu area of Lomé; in fact, she sells shoes, baby bottles, and light shirts for children and babies. She is married to a business executive who guides and counsels her in the management of her store, which is unusual in this area. She generates a good income these days and foresees selling even more for the festivals at the end of the year. To establish a stock of fashionable items, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy high quality shoes, shirts, and dresses for children, as well as baby bottles currently in fashion. She is the mother of two children and believes that this loan will bring positive change to the development of her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell clothing for babies

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: SRA. HILDA SE DEDICA A LA ATENCION DE SU LIBRERÍA QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA CHASQUIPAMPA ACTIVIDAD CON LA QUE AYUDA A SU HOGAR PARA MEJORAR SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA Y PAGA LOS ESTUDIOS DE SUS DOS HIJITOS, EL ESPOSO LA COLABORA CON LOS GASTOS YA QUE SE DEDICA AL FLETE DE SU AMPLIFICACION, TAMBIEN SE PUEDE INDICAR QUE LA PAREJA ESTA SURGIENDO POCO A POCO DESDE QE ENPESARON A TRABAJAR CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION. EL CREDITO INVERTIRA EL EL PAGO DE MANO DE OBRA EN LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda manages a bookstore in the district of Chasquipampa. This business helps to improve her living conditions and pay for the education expenses of her two young children. Her husband contributes toward their expenses through his job as a delivery driver. The couple has started working with our Institution and is gradually emerging on the path to success. Hilda is requesting a loan so that she can pay for the construction labor of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina S. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol. She is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials. Lina is 35 years old and is widowed. She has 5 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and resturant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more brewing ingredients

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia C. is from the village of Marapong. She is 55 years old. Sonia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Sonia sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Sonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Sonia's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe J. O. has a business selling clothes for men and women, selling lotions, as well as selling canned food products, such as tuna.  She started her business of selling clothes two years ago.

Guadalupe is 67 years old.  She is married, and has three kids that are already grown up.  Although she was born in Chinautla, Guatemala, she now lives in her house in Villa Lobos.

This is Guadalupe's third loan with FAPE on Kiva, and is happy to be able to continuing growing.  She hopes that Christmas time sales will help her grow even more.  She hopes to use this extra income to support and help her family.

loans.use: toys, clothes, and canned food to sell

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam L. D. M. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango el cual esta ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo, el cual es empleado en una fábrica, y sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. ropa para niños y adultos, así mismo comercializa perfumes para hombre y mujer.  Ella comercializa sus productos D. forma ambulante, y así mismo venD. en su casa. Ana solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, así mismo poder comprar ropa D. mayor calidad, que sea variada para tratar D. llamar la atención D. más personas, y además comprar diferentes tallas y colores. El mayor deseo D. Ana es el D. poder obtener el dinero necesario para mejorar la estabilidad económica D. su familia, y D. esta manera poder brindarle todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana Miriam L. D. M. is 37 years old, she lives in the county of Ilopango which located in the department of San Salvador. Her family group is maD. up of her husband who is employed at a factory, and her two young children. She owns a store that offers clothing for children and adults as well as perfumes for men and women. She sells her products on the street and she also sells at her house. Ana requests a loan through which she will be able to buy greater quantities of clothing as well as better quality clothing and a greater variety of it so that she can catch the attention of more people. She also wants to buy different sizes and colors. Ana's greatest wish is to make the money necessary to improve her family's financial stability and in that way be able to offer her children everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Lucia es soltera, tiene 29 años y vive con su mama, Contadora de profesión y trabaja en una institución, Lucia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche.
Los sueños de Lucia son comprar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucía is a member of the Communal Bank "Ccatarisum" which means "Let's rise" in quechua. e Lucía is single, she is 29 years old and lives with her mother, an accountant by trade, who works in an institution. Lucía owns a general store where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meat... She performs this activity with the help of her mother. Lucía needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and milk. Lucía's dreams are to buy her own home and increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and milk

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mr. Phal H., 43 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Yun Oeun, 45 years old (pictured together), live along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers, three attend school, and the other one is still young.
