Phal has been driving a motor taxi for ten years, while his wife has been growing rice for twenty-eight years. His wife hopes to supplement that with another pig-raising business, so Phal is applying for his first loan of $500 in order to help his wife purchase pigs to raise and build a pigpen.

loans.use: To help his wife purchase piglets to raise and build a pigpen

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda B. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three adult children. Gilda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: With God All Things Are Possible Group

texts.en: Mamie J. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “With God All Things Are Possible”. In the photo, Mamie is the one holding the sign. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children who are 14 and 16 years old. She, herself, was only able to attend school through high school. For ten years, Mamie has been selling dry goods at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She sells good quality products in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. Mamie plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods. Her goal is to grow her business and to improve the living conditions of her family. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods

loans.name: Eneyda De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Doña Eneyda se dedica a la crianza de cerdos la cual ella compra cerdas hembras y cerdos machos para luego estos se cubran y al termino de 6 meses estos dan crías y ella vende estas crías con lo cual se ayuda para los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente ella cuenta con la cantidad de 3 cerdas hembras las cuales tienen un promedio de 10-12 crías cada cerda con este negocio ella ha logrado mejorar la construcción de su vivienda lo que le ha permitido dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
Este crédito es para la compra de 3 cerdas mas y un cerdo macho con lo cual le permitirá generar más ingresos y así darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos
texts.en:
Doña Eneyda raises pigs. She buys male and female pigs and breeds them. After six months they produce piglets which she sells and uses the income to cover household expenses. Currently she has three sows which produce an average of 10-12 piglets per sow. With the profits she has managed to renovate her house and provide a safer home for her family. This loan will be used to buy three more sows and a male pig. This purchase will allow her to earn more money and thus provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Aremu

texts.en:
Aremu has four children and he is 40 years and married. His children attend school and this gives him joy as a father. He is a hard working man and he is determined to lift his business and family above poverty. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Aremu sells sarongs and poultry feeds at retail prices. With these combined businesses, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his immediate family. He has been in this business for eight years.

Aremu is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more poultry feeds and sarongs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and poultry feeds to sell

loans.name: Mumindjon

texts.en:
Mumindjon is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle. Mumindjon wishes to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder for them. For this reason, he is asking for a loan. He will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his loan request.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Anigéanne

texts.fr:
Anigéanne B. est une femme de 28 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAMBATO depuis le 18 mars 2008. C'est une femme très dynamique et engagée dans les différentes activités de son groupe. En deux ans seulement au sein du Banc Villageois elle a mobilisé un bon niveau d'épargne. Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers et ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter de l'huile de palme, du miel, du jus de citron et du poisson séché qu'elle revendra au niveau des marchés de sa localité. 
Son objectif est de participer au bien-être familiale en contribuant à l'amélioration de la santé et de la nourriture.
texts.en:
Anigéanne B. is a 28-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de BAMBATO since March 18, 2008.  She is a very energetic women committed to the various activities of her group.  In only two years with the Banc Villageois, she has gotten together a tidy savings.  Anigéanne has a small-scale business involving various goods.  This new loan will enable her to buy palm oil, honey, lemon juice, and dried fish that she will sell at her town's markets.  Her goal is to contribute to her family's well-being by helping to make improvements with regard to health care and food.   

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her ability to invest and advancing her business

loans.name: God's Purpose Group

texts.en:
Esther G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God's Purpose. She is 49 years old, married and has seven children who range from 18 to 34 years old. She was only able to attend school through fifth grade due to poverty. She cares for one sibling.

For 20 years, she has been selling pork and pig feet at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She says insufficient cash to purchase more goods (pork and pig feet) is a major challenge to her business.

She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more pig feet and pork. She describes herself as an easygoing woman.

She hopes to improve her business and to continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more pig feet and pork

loans.name: Mrs. Sim Phol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the nine people who make up a village bank loan located in Preaek Touch-II village in Kandal province. They all will use a small piece of the loan for different purposes which will improve their businesses in the future. 

Mrs. Sim P. is 36 years old and owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. So to improve this business, Mrs. Sim P. is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. She is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa F. is 38 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Epenesa has 2 years of experience in this business.  Epenesa needs a loan of WST$2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Epenesa is an active client and wishes to expand the business and assist her family financially.

This is Epenesa's 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Epenesa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, Gramoxone, wire, rack, wheelbarrow and spade

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, a married woman with one girl and one boy, both attending school, lives in her own house that is serviced with electricity but no piped water. Her husband works as a clearing and forwarding agent, and he contributes to his family's needs.

Catherine has been operating her hairdressing salon in a shop located in her neighboring community. With the Kshs 40,000 she is requesting to borrow, she wants to renovate her hairdressing salon and purchase cosmetics. Having decided to work with Yehu in order to get access to loans to expand her business, Catherine hopes to open a hairdressing college in future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and renovate her hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Edma Clarisa

texts.es: Edma tiene 87 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes solicitan, pues es una gran variedad de productos, ella tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio y en ser cliente de Fundación pues ha sido de mucha ayuda por lo que han sido para la inversión de su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, sabanas, ropa interior y toallas. A pesar de su edad siempre está con todas las ganas de salir adelante pues tiene todo el entusiasmo de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Edma is 87 and makes a living selling general merchandise. She is always aware of what her customers request and it's a great variety of things. She has a lot of experience in the business as well as being a Fundacion customer. Fundacion has been of great help investing in her business. The loan is to buy, hand-bags, shoes, sheets, underwear and towels. Despite her age she still has the will to get ahead and work with great enthusiasm.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 50 years of age and married to a farmer. She has 12 children who are between the age of 2 and 25 years. All her children are in school, apart from those who are not yet of school age. Jeanne sells meat, crops, and cow’s milk. As shown in the photo, she has a charcoal stove and a table on which she prepares and roasts skewered meat. She has done this business for 6 years, and with the loan she plans to increase her herd of cattle.  With the profits she hopes to pay her children’s school fees and buy more food for home consumption.

loans.use: To increase her herd of cattle.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: A. Pascaline est née en 1973 à Agonrin-Houegbo, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Mariée à HOUNKPEGAN Michel, un tailleur, Pascaline est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille s'est installée à PK10, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis une dizaine d'année. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pascaline n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. C'est cette activité que Pascaline exerce depuis sept ans et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Parallèlement à cette activité, Pascaline vend divers produits de mercerie dans son atelier à PK10. Pascaline achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de rehausser son chiffre d'affaire, Pascaline sollicite un troisième concours financier.
texts.en:
A. Pascaline was born in 1973 in Agonrin-Houegbo, in Atlantique county, Benin. She is married to HOUNKPEGAN Michel, a tailor, and is the mother of three children, of whom some are in school. The family settled in PK10, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, about ten years ago. The couple jointly ensure that their different family expenses are covered. Pascaline did not go to school but learned how to sew. This has been her work for seven year. It enables her to support herself and her children. Concurrently, Pascaline sells various sewing supplies in her workshop in PK10. She purchases her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous client of ALIDé having had two loans in the past that she repaid. With the goal of bolstering her business and increasing her sales, Pascaline is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various sewing supplies

loans.name: 030131-Dong Hai, Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en: Thao L. T. (125) is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa. She is married and has an infant child. To making a living, Thao owns and operates a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. Thao has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 700,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2007, Thao joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enabL. her to engage in business activities. Thao has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women which was used to purchase breeding livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thao plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Thao is the leader of an eight member group accessing a loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030131-Dong Hai, Hoang Thanh. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. T. Khieu (88) is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. N. T. Tha (43) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. L. T. Lenh (91) is a 63-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. L. T. Thuong (39) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. N. T. Tuyen (90) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business. 6. L. T. Dang (71) is a 54-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 7. L. T. Ke (84) is a 59-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thao L. T. (125) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa. Thao là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030131-Dong Hai, Hoang Thanh (030131-Dong Hai, Hoang Thanh). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thao thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thao kiếm được khoảng 700,000 VND. Vào 2007, Thao đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thao đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua con giống. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Khieu (88) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. T. Tha (43) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. L. T. Lenh (91) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. L. T. Thuong (39) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. N. T. Tuyen (90) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc. 6. L. T. Dang (71) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 7. L. T. Ke (84) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sara Petrona

texts.es: La señora Sara tiene 35 años, tiene tres hijos menores de edad, su actividad es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Inicio este negocio hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio pues ella ha logrado con mucho sacrificio salir adelante, pues su actividad económica es muy difícil de mantener. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima y ofrecer una gran variedad de productos. Ella sueña con establecer otro negocio en donde sus hijos más adelante puedan hacerse administrarlo como lo ha hecho ella.
texts.en: Ms. Sara is 35 years old, she has three young children, and her main activity is a retail store located in her home. She started this business 4 years ago, and she is always looking for a way to increase her revenue. It hasn't been easy to maintain this business and she has managed to succeed with a lot of sacrifice, since her economic activity is hard to maintain. This loan is to buy raw material to offer a greater variety of products. She dreams with establishing another business where her children can later take care of and manage as she has done.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 32-year-old carpenter.  He works together with five employees in his business.  He is a member of Neema group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other's loans.  Since he joined the group, he has become more focused in his business.  In five years, he hopes to open other outlets for his business.  He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Angela Alfeu

texts.pt:
Ângela Alfeu V. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 01, 06 e 11 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a Escola. Não conseguiu fazer o nível primário devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 1 irmão que vive com ela.

Nunca saiu de Maputo, tem um negócio próprio de venda de roupa diversa ha mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado, conta com ajuda do irmão e consegue em media um rendimento de cerca de 13.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar 1.500.00mt por mês através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga vendedoura que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mais peças de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria e satisfazer a sua clientela.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Ângela Alfeu V. was born in the city of Maputo, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and the mother of 3 children, ages 1, 6, and 11.  The eldest attends school.  She was unable to attend elementary school due to a lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports one brother who lives with her.  

She has never lived anywhere other than Maputo.  She has had her own business selling clothing for more than 10 years.  She does not have any employees, but her brother helps her out.  On average she earns around 13.500.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and she is able to save 1.500.00mt per month through Xitique ( a traditional method of rotational savings.)

She has never had loans in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who also has a business and is a client of the institution.  This is her first loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase more clothing to increase her inventory and satisfy her customers. 

She is confident that she will pay the loan off early and request another one to complete construction on her home.

loans.use: purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase trousers and shirts

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in a small city in Pakistan called Kasur which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and famous for its tanneries industry. She lives there in a 3 room brick house with her family in the area named Basti baraat shah. She moved here after her marriage.  She is a caring lady, carrying out her responsibilities of a housewife but she also supporting her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients.  

Her husband has a business of selling construction supplies. He makes contracts with different construction companies and provides them the supplies at a good profit. 

Rani has given birth to 5 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son works along with his father while her other children are getting their education from a local school. 

Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more construction supplies such as cement, sand and bricks and improve his business.  He has been doing this business for over 10 years and Rani is hopeful that by investing with this loan, his business will grow further and makes him more profits. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She has maintained a good credit record in previous loan years.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a construction supplies selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, resiD. en Concepción  Batres, departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 14, 12 y 8 años D. edad, se dedica a vender ropa y medicina, tiene 44 años D. edad, el negocio lo atienD. con sus hijos quienes le ayudan a salir a vender, este negocio fue iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad D. trabajar, no tiene un horario fijo y actualmente necesita D. un préstamo para comprar mercadería para salir a vender D. forma ambulante.
Con este préstamo quiere comprar medicamentos y prendas D. vestir, su propósito es darle continuidad al negocio invirtiéndole cada que hay oportunidad para mantenerse activa con un trabajo que genere ingresos para su hogar y sobre todo para cubra gastos necesarios que enfrenta el hogar.
Su objetivo con el préstamo es realizar una buena inversión, cancelar sus cuotas a tiempo, crecer con el negocio y mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Concepción Batres, located in the department of Usulután, with her husband and three children ages 14, 12 and 8.  She dedicates herself to selling clothing and medicine.  She is 44 years old.  She tends to her business with the help of her children, who help her travel around selling her products.  She started the business on her own initiative, given the need for her to find work.  She does not have a fixed schedule, and currently needs a loan to buy merchandise to sell door-to-door.

She would like to use the loan to buy medicines and clothing.  Her plan is to give her business continuity by investing in it every chance she has.  She wants to keep active in a line of work that generates income for the home and, most of all, to cover the household’s expenses.  

Her objectives with regard to this loan are to make a good investment, to make her payments on time, to grow the business and to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and clothing.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera C. is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years Sera has operated a food selling business out of her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in seasonality in her business. During the rainy season it becomes hard to sell in an open market, which lowers the number of her customers.

With a 40,000 KES loan Sera wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access its loans in hopes of improving her business. She wishes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua O. is married and has 7 dependants. She has no formal education. Efua sells food items like gari.  She also sells secondhand clothing at Elmina, which she has done for 30 years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to assist her husband with the financial responsibility of the home. Efua will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to buy land.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
TEOFILO O. R. TRABAJA COMO VIJILANTE DE SEGURIDAD, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS PERO ESTOS YA NO ESTAN A SU CARGO.
  EL HA TRABAJADO DIEZ PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL Y ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA, EL ACUDE NUEVAMENTE A CEPRODEL PARA HACER UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: PINTURA, ZINC, PERLINES Y CLAVOS PARA EL TECHO DE SU CASA YA QUE ESTE PARA INVIERNO EL AGUA SE PASA.
 EL DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL HA PODIDO MEJORAR SU CASITA Y AHORA SU FAMILIA CUENTA CON MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIVIENDA
texts.en:
Teófilo O. Ramírez works as security guard. He is a family man with three children but they are no longer dependent on him. He has received 10 previous loans with CEPRODEL for the improvement of his home. He is going to CEPRODEL once more to request a new loan to buy building materials such as paint, zinc, beams and nails for the roof of his house, because this winter water was leaking. 

He says that thanks to the CEPRODEL loans he has been able to improve his home and now his family is enjoying better living conditions.

loans.use: Buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He graduated from primary school. He will use this loan to develop his smithy shop and purchase iron bars for making windows and doors and also purchase an electric iron saw. The borrower has a great deal of experience in his business and has a good personality. He has an endless ambition to develop his shop and gain more clients.

loans.use: Purchasing iron bars and an electric iron saw

loans.name: Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Asili S., who is in his early fifties, is married with five children.  He has been operating a second hand clothes business since 2007.  He works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asili's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his capital and managed to buy a good stock of clothes, and has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase his stock.  His dream is to open a shop for selling food.

Asili will share this loan with his loan group, T., which has a total of eighteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Asili is 1st on the right in a brown t-shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Pierrette's Group

texts.en:
Pierrette and Alice are sisters, and together they live with Leontine in the Adogleta district of Cotonou, Benin's economic center. This is their fifth loan through ALIDE following successful repayments in the past.

Pierrette was born in 1955 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital. She has lived in her current neighborhood for 12 years, all the while running her stall from her home, where she sells traditional meals. This loan will allow Pierrette to purchase the raw ingredients necessary to make these meals to sell from her stall.

Her ambition is to evolve her business and increase her personal savings. She believes she has the qualities necessary to greatly increase her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 36 years old and married, with two children, 13 and 11 years old. She sells a variety of men's clothing. Barbara has been in this business for five years and her shop is open from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.  Her business is well-organized.

Barbara has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothing to sell. With the profit from the proceeds of this loan, Barbara will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and a widow with three children. Her oldest child is only 14 years old.

Arlene is engaged in farming. She grows corn and sells her harvest to the market. Arlene works hard to provide for her children. She wants them to be able to go to college and have bright futures.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.

She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat. In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing her fishing boat.

loans.name: Maria Ida

texts.es:
María es una madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad, tiene casa propia donD. vive con su esposo e hijos, la cual cuenta con todos los servicio básicos. Su casa está ubicada en el distrito D. Chepén  y aproximadamente a una hora D. la  provincia D. Chiclayo y a dos horas del departamento D. la Libertad.  Esta zona es rural y la actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

María  ha puesto  en su casa su negocio donD. venD. cerveza, gaseosas y agua mineral,  sus  vecinos cuando tienen algún evento importante la buscan para comprarle sus productos ya que es muy conocida en su distrito, el negocio con el que cuenta es el único medio D. ingreso que tiene para  mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa trata D. adquirir un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda con mas cerveza, gaseosas y agua mineral y así pueda satisfacer a sus clientes, y D. paso incrementa sus ganacias para su hogar.  María es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre y una madre responsable con el objetivo D. que como familia salga adelante apunta D. esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
María is a 58-year-old mother who has her own home which receives all basic services. She lives with her husband and children. Her house is located in the District of Chepén, which is located an hour away from Chiclayo Province and two hours away from the Department of La Libertad. This community is in a rural area where most of the residents have developed businesses in the agriculture, livestock, and tourism sectors.

María has a store in her home where she sells beer, sodas, and mineral water. Whenever her neighbors have some type of important event, they come to her to find the products they need. She is well-known in her district. Her business is the only source of income that she has to improve her family’s standard of living.

Upon a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, María requested a loan of 1000 PEN so that she could restock her store with more beer, sodas, and mineral water in order to satisfy her customers and increase her household income. María is recognized among her neighbors for being a cheerful woman and a responsible mother. Her goal for her family is to move forward through effort and work.

loans.use: to purchase beer, sodas, and mineral water.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and married with five school-aged children. She is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business raising crops and her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. 

Josephine joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in expanding her business by purchasing farm products from her neighbors to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm products from her neighbors to sell

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es:
El Sr. Damaso  tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, dos en edad escolar y dos ya mayores de edad, vive en la ciudad de Carapegua, compañía Espartillar.
Don Damaso  trabajó  como empleado de un Surtidor por mas de 7 años y con el transcurrir del tiempo fue adquiriendo capital  para  comprar mercaderías y así  iniciarse como vendedor ambulante.
Recorre por ciudades de Alto Paraná ofreciendo y colocando  productos de primera calidad, transportándose en su motocicleta, que gracias a este trabajo logró comprarse todo esto con el objetivo de brindarle a su familia la manutención necesaria y un hogar digno y confortable.
Con el crédito realizara la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Damaso is 49 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of his children are school age and two are already grown up.  He lives in the city of Carapegua, in Espartillar neighborhood.

Damaso worked as an employee in a gas station for more than seven years.  Over time, he acquired capital with which to buy merchandise and he started working as a traveling salesman.  He travels through the towns of Alto Paraná, selling top-quality products, transporting them on his motorcycle which he managed to buy thanks to this work.  He does everything with the aim of providing for his family and ensuring they have a decent and comfortable home.

Damaso will use his loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, belts and sheets) since he has many orders for these products.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, belts and sheets to expand his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 58 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio de Esther es la costura, su trabajo es muy solicitado en su barrio, ya que es la única que realiza esta actividad, ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y ahora tiene su propio taller, donde atiende con mucha paciencia a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es terminar los trabajos que le encargan. Lleva 44 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo, es tener que trabajar todo el día cuando tiene un pedido muy grande. Espera que en el futuro, su negocio sea más conocido y así pueda crecer más, para ello esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro y sin descanso. Este es el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, pero sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y apreciada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una maquina remalladora nueva, así de esta manera espera incrementar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Esther, age 58, is a woman who has always struggled in her life.  She lives in her own house, and what she wishes for the most is to work very hard in order to improve her quality of life.  Esther is a seamstress.  There is great demand for her work in her neighborhood.  This is because she is the only one there with this type of business.

She learned when she was very young together with her mother.  Now she has her own shop where she patiently waits on her customers.  What she likes the most about her business is finishing her orders.  She has been doing this business activity for 44 years.  She considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to work all day when she has a very large order. 

She hopes that in the future her business will become better known.  That way it will grow more.  In order to do this she is ready to work very hard without rest.

This is her 15th loan with MFP.  She knows that she needs to make her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so.  She does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is a very well-liked and valued member.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy a new overlock machine.  This is the way she hopes to increase her production and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy and overlock machine

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 40 years old. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hong's husband sells electrical goods. Hoang earns an income to support her family by selling clothes as a vendor. She has requested a loan to invest in their businesses by buying a larger range of electrical goods and clothes to sell. She hopes that this will enable them to better serve their current customers, attract new customers, and increase the turnover of their businesses. Hong hopes their businesses run smoothly and will help her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a married woman with 4 children. She lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur, with her family.

Rosana is a farmer. She has been growing and selling rice for 18 years. With her earning from farming, Rosana is able to feed her family and to send her children to school.

Rosana is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that, through her business, she will be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Paola Lizeth

texts.es: La señora  Paola es una cliente muy joven que recién esta empezando a formar su hogar, tiene muchos sueños, actualmente vive con su esposo en la casa de sus suegros quienes le dieron un pequeño capital para que trabaje o pongan un negocio,   el cual ella quiere aumentar cuenta con el apoyo de sus papas y sobre todo de su esposo quien trabaja en construcción, ella se dedica a la venta de muebles en la feria 16 de julio en el alto, solo los días jueves y domingos,  con el dinero del crédito comprara muebles y después poder venderlos obteniendo ganancias y así poder incrementar su capital de trabajo  ambos quieren casarse antes de tener hijos,  hacerse de un patrimonio, están consientes que será muy duro pero tienen ganas de salir adelante mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Paola is a young client who recently started her family and has many dreams. She currently lives with her husband at the home of her in-laws, who gave her a small amount of capital to use to find work or to start a business. Paola wants to earn more. She has the support of her parents and her husband, who works in construction.

Paola sells furniture at the July 16th fair in El Alto, but only on Thursdays and Sundays. With the money from this loan, she will buy furniture so that she can sell it for a profit. This will allow her to increase her operating capital. Paola wanted to get married before having children and acquiring some assets. She and her husband are aware that it will be very hard, but they have the will to succeed and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy furniture to sell.

loans.name: Katerine Alexandra

texts.es:
Katerine de 34 años vive en el municipio de Soledad con su hijo de 15 años, quien es el motor de su vida, para diariamente lograr mediante su trabajo, generar cada vez más ingresos y lograr su bienestar actual, potenciando su éxito futuro.
Katerine es la propietaria de un restaurante donde vende desayunos,  almuerzos y comidas, el cual inició hace 10 años, cuando empezó vendiendo en una empresa de transporte y la encargada del restaurante le dejó el negocio, cuando se fue a vivir a Venezuela, país fronterizo; sus principales clientes fueron los conductores de la línea de transporte y hoy ha logrado adicionar los empleados administrativos del servicio de transporte masivo de la ciudad “Transmetro” entre otros como los vecinos de sus negocios.  Su sueño es tener un local propio adicionado a su vivienda, lo cual es su gran propósito. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará un enfriador, una vitrina calentadora, para ofrecer un mejor servicio y especialmente lograr un espacio confortable y deseado para el descanso momentáneo,  por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Katerine is 34 and lives in the town of Soledad with her 15 year old son, who is the driving force of her life. Because of him, she is motivated every day to generate more income at work in order to insure his current well-being and future success. Katerine is the proprietor of a restaurant where she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. She started her business 10 years ago when she had begun selling for a transport business and the then restaurant owner left her the business when she went to live in the neighboring country of Venezuela. Her principal customers were the drivers for that transport line and today she has succeeded in adding the administrative employees of Transmetro, the city’s massive transportation service, to her clientele, as well as others from neighboring businesses. 

Katerine’s dream is to have her business establishment added to her home and this is a major goal. This loan is the first funding she has had from FMSD. With it she will purchase a cooler and a heating cabinet so she can provide better service to her customers and especially offer them a comfortable and desirable space to briefly relax.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and a heating cabinet.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor Jose Luis es casado, tiene 31 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales está estudiando, se dedica a la carpintería, a la elaboración de todo tipo de muebles, roperos, camas, estanterías, etc., inició este trabajo como trabajo y hasta ahora lleva 12 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un prestamos que le servirá para la compra de madera ya que su negocio tiene demanda y espera producir más, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a oficio domésticos. En el futuro espera tener su negocio grandes y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Luis is 31 years old and has 3 years of primary education. He is married and has 2 children, one of which is studying. He works as a carpenter, making all kinds of furniture: wardrobes, beds, shelves etc. He started doing this work as a job and now has 12 years experience in the business. 

He decided to ask for a loan to allow him to buy wood as what he produces is in demand and he expects to produce more. He can count on the support of his wife who is a domestic worker. In the future he hopes for a bigger business with larger prrofits.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Brayan

texts.en: Brayan is a hardworking business man aged 33. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last six years he has been selling mobile phone accessories to earn a living. He has grown his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next 5 years he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar, con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 32 a 40 años. Desde muy joven fue fotógrafo en las playas y como aparecieron nuevas tecnologías y todo el mundo tenía su propia cámara, dejó este negocio y hace 6 años emprendió una actividad de comercialización de ranchos, víveres, enlatados refrescos embutidos, en su vivienda observando que en este sector no contaba una tienda. Al principio sus ventas fueron muy bajas, pero fue persistente y ha logrado paulatinamente crecer y sostenerse. Su mercado está compuesto por una clientela de pensionados de una empresa portuaria, a quienes Hugo le acredita víveres y le pagan mensualmente, así mismo amas de casa que le compran de contado y diariamente. Su trato amable y los precios que ofrece hacen que sus clientes sostengan relaciones de fidelidad. En la actualidad está aplicando para su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con comprará mercancías al por mayor, para mejorar el surtido. Su meta es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un autoservicio. Hugo tiene un gran desafío y es que su local es muy pequeño y requiere ampliarlo para mejorar el servicio
texts.en:
Hugo lives in the Puerto Colombia municipality, which is very close to the sea, with his wife and three children ranging in age from 32 to 40.  Ever since he was very young he was a photographer at the beaches.  As new technologies appeared, everyone in the world had their own camera.  

He left this business and six years ago he started selling foodstuffs, snacks, canned goods, soft drinks, and sausages at his house.  He observed that his area did not have a store.  At first his sales were very low.  However, he was persistent, and he managed to gradually grow and support himself.

His market is comprised of customers who are pensioners from the Port Authority.  Hugo gives them credit for provisions, and they pay him monthly.  At the same time, housewives buy from him daily and pay cash.  His kind treatment and the prices he offers make his customers sustain a loyal relationship.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy wholesale merchandise to improve his stock.  His goal is to expand his business until it is converted into a self-serve.  Hugo has a big challenge.  His place is very small, and he needs to expand it in order to improve his service.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Nhing

texts.en: Nhing, 41 years old, is a sweet seller earning $6 per day. Her husband is a farmer and earns $1.50 per day. They have three children, all of whom are students. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $17 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to use when traveling to study. She doesn’t want to change her career selling sweets. She wants to support all of her children through university so that they can find a good job.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children traveling to study

loans.name: Citlali Group

texts.es: Las señoras Camila y Hortencia son nuevas integrantes del grupo van a comprar con el prestamo azucar, aceite, jabon, refrescos, papel higienico y dulces, la señora Camila tiene 75 años de edad, ella no tiene hijos, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para surtir su tienda va a comprar azúcar, aceite, chocolates, huevo, jabón, leche, arroz, refresco, maíz, frijol, dulces, flores gladiolas, nube, polar y clavel.  Ella inicio su negocio hace 30 años, la invito una vecina a poner la tienda y la pusieron juntas pero como la señora era sola ya no quiso seguir con el negocio , así que ella sola continuo con la tienda, su negocio es importante porque de ahí se ayuda para la comida y para pagar el teléfono y la luz, ella está orgullosa de tener su tienda de abarrotes y de trabajar en el campo en la siembra de maíz de temporal cada año lo siembra, su negocio es conocido porque ella atiende a sus clientes con bonito carácter, también le ayuda su hermana y su sobrina a atender a los clientes, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de algunas tiendas pero  cada uno ya tiene sus clientes, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para pagar los peones de la siembran, para la luz, el teléfono. Ella está planeando comprar unos cerditos y becerros para crianza y después venderlos, sus sueños y esperanzas son que Dios le siga ayudando a seguir en el trabajo. Ella está emocionada con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar lo que le falta en la tienda para estar bien surtida y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes. Los integrantes del grupo les dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por su ayuda y por la confianza que les tienen y que los sigan ayudando con sus préstamos.
texts.en:
Camila and Hortencia are new members of the group.  They will use their loan to buy sugar, oil, soap, soft drinks, toilet paper, and sweets.  

Camila is 75 years old and does not have children.  She has a grocery store.  She requested her loan to stock her store.  She will buy sugar, oil, chocolates, eggs, soap, milk, rice, soft drinks, corn, beans, and sweets.  She will also buy gladiolas, baby’s breath, chrysanthemums and carnations.

She started her business 30 years ago.  A neighbor invited her to establish the store, and they set it up together.  The woman was single, and she did not want to continue with the business.  That is how Camila continued on with the store by herself.  Her business is important because it helps with the food, and it helps pay for the telephone and electricity.  She is proud to have her grocery store and of working in the fields.

She grows seasonal corn, which she plants each year.  Her business is well-known because she tends to her customers in a good-natured way.  Her sister and her niece also help her tend to the customers.  Her business faces competition from some stores, but each one already has their customers.  She uses the income from her business to pay the field workers and to pay for electricity and the telephone.

She is planning to buy some pigs and calves to raise and later sell.  Her dreams and hopes are that God continues helping her to continue in her work.  She is thrilled with this loan that she is going to receive.  She will buy what is lacking in the store in order to be well stocked and to give her customers better service.

The members of the group thank Kiva and the Fundación Realidad for the help and the trust placed in them.  May they continue helping with the loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, chocolates, eggs, soap, milk, rice, soft drinks, corn, beans, sweets, gladiolas, baby’s breath, chrysanthemums and carnations.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 29 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in the Philippines. Aida has a retail shop selling canned goods, snacks, and  beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Aida is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells kenkey [fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves -- often accompanied by fried fish] in Eguafo. She is married and has five children. Adjoa has been selling kenkey for 15 years. She is responsible for caring for her children. She will use her loan to buy maize in bulk for the preparation of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize in bulk for the preparation of kenkey

loans.name: Gema Carolina

texts.es: Gema Carolina tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa. El objetivo del crédito abastecer de nuevos productos a sus clientes, ya que se acerca una muy buena temporada. Actualmente ya tiene varios encargos es por eso que está solicitando este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes, shorts y trajes para niños. Ella es una madre muy dedicada y abnegada tiene un hijo bajo su cargo al cual le proporciona lo necesario.
texts.en: Gema Carolina’s activity is selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to stock up her shop with new products to offer to her customers, as a very good selling season is about to begin. She currently has many requests already, and for this reason she is requesting a loan in order to invest it in the purchase of trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, shorts and suits for children. She is a very devoted and self-sacrificing mother: she has one child whom she provides with the basic necessities.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, shorts and suits for children.

loans.name: Riak

texts.en:
Riak is 30 year old a married woman with three children, one of them is in school. She has had a business of selling food-stuff in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Riak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and salt to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 41-year-old widowed man with two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. He owns a house which has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Samuel has operated a retail shop for the past 4 years. His potential clients are the local area villagers. His major challenge is lack of customers. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSH 20,000 he wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Brian Alberto

texts.es:
Brian es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar Brian no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia. 
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Brian puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, él cuenta con un pequeño puesto alquilado en un  mercado de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él vende prendas de vestir y ropa interior tanto para damas y caballeros, Brian puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Brian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: polos, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, entre otras prendas; de esta manera Brian tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello, él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de mercadería, tales como: polos, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior,etc.

loans.name: Oumouff's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Keur Thierno de ce banc villageois a été créé le 29 décembre 2010. Il compte 23 femmes. Les femmes habitent la même concession et leur principale activité est l'embouche.

La représentante de ce groupe, Gnagna Wedou, est une femme mariée de 44 ans avec 5 enfants dont un garçon. Elle fait de l'embouche. Elle achète du bétail qu'elle engraisse pendant 05 mois et les revend au marché hebdomadaire.Sur la photo elle est debout avec la main levée.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 10 têtes de moutons qui pèsent environ 20Kg.

Avec les bénéfices, le membre compte mieux s'occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants et augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity of this Banc Villageois, the Keur Thierno Group, was founded on December 29, 2010. There are 23 women in this group. They all live in the same concession and their main business is raising livestock.

The representative of this group is named Gnagna Wedou. She is a married woman who is 44 years of age and who has five children, one of whom is a boy. Her business is raising livestock. Gnagna Wedou purchases livestock, which she then fattens for five months before reselling them at the weekly market. She is shown in the photo standing and with her hand raised. With her loan, Gnagna Wedou intends to purchase ten heads of sheep weighing approximately 20 kg each. With the income she earns, Gnagna Wedou plans to pay for her children's education and increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Kipngetich

texts.en:
Kipngetich is 34 years old. He is married with 9 children.

Kipngetich has been a motorcycle driver for the last 10 years. 

He has requested a loan to purchase his own motorcycle in order to start carrying his customers to far distances.

With his anticipated profits, Kipngetich will be able to pay the school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have many businesses and to live a stable life.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle in order to start carrying his customers to far distances

loans.name: Mildren Yolany

texts.en:
My name is Mildren and I have a business that sells fruit in all areas of my city. My husband and I have been doing this for several years. We earn enough to support our family and to educate our children. We have three children that are studying and thankfully, this business allow us to pay for their schooling. Soon it will be the Christmas season. We need to buy apples, pears and grapes. This is what we sell most in this season.

Loan Use: Purchase of grapes, apples, watermelon, papayas, pears, pineapple, oranges, bananas, coconuts and other fruits

Mi Nombre es Mildren cuento con un negocio de venta de frutas, los que distribuyo en todas la ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad junto con mi esposo, actividad que nos genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de educacion de mis hijos, tenemos 3 hijos estudiando y gracias a este negocio podemos cubrir esos gastos, ahora que se aproxima la Navidad necesitamos comprar Manzana, peras y uvas ya que es lo que mas se vende en esta epoca.

loans.use: Compra d uvas, manzanas, sandias, papayas, peras, piña, naranjas, bananos,cocos y otros

loans.name: Afi Véronique

texts.en:
Ms. Afi Véronique S. is an illiterate woman with 4 children whose main business activity is the sale of gari [granulated cassava]. The work is difficult and exhausting, but it helps her meet the needs of her children. She has another project in mind for the near future: selling general food products. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of $1,200. No stranger to the rigors of business management, she is assuring repayment of this loan in 12 months. The loan will allow her to breathe new life into her business and improve her family’s financial and social situation.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Avec quatre (04) enfants, Madame S. Afi Véronique, femme illettrée, a pour activité principale, la vente du gari. Un travail difficile et épuisant qu’elle exerce pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle a d’autre projet pour un avenir proche : faire le commerce de l’alimentation générale. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $1200. N’étant pas étrangère à la rigueur dans la gestion de son activité commerciale, elle rassure rembourser ce crédit en douze (12) mois, crédit qui lui permettra de donner un nouveau souffle à son commerce et d’améliorer la situation économique et sociale de sa famille.

loans.use: Sale of gari [granulated cassava] and other food products

loans.name: Quan

texts.en: Mrs. Quan is 85 years old. Now, she lives with 2 family members; her niece and nephew. They are 19 and 17 years old. She doesn’t have any land for cultivation. The main income of the family is to trade betel and areca. She needs US $50 for this small business.

loans.use: to trade betels and arecas

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old, married with 10 children. Her works as a farm hand in the harvest of corn. She embroiders skirts and blouses, clothing that is generally used by the women of nearby communities. She wants to use the loan to buy cloth and thread for embroidering so she can make formal clothing and increase her income. She is part of the group "Liquidambar 13".

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA TIENE 49 AÑOS , CASADA , 10 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ, ELLA SE DEDICA A BORDAR FALDAS , BLUSAS Y FALDAS , ROPA QUE GENERALMENTE UTILIZAN LAS MUJERES DE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS. QUIERE CON EL PRESTAMO PODER COMPRAR TELA PARA CONFECCIONAR ELLA LAS PRENDAS DE VESTIR Y TAMBIEN MAS HILO DE BORDAR Y DE ESTA FORMA AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS..PERTENECE AL GRUPO LIQUIDAMBAR 13.

loans.use: To buy thread and cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase stock

loans.name: Juana Bonifacio

texts.en:
Juana, 53 years old, is a very successful and hard-working woman who believes in the value of persistence. Last year she started her business, a small grocery store where she sells basic foodstuffs to the people. Juana’s husband is a taxi driver and works in Santo Domingo, the capital. The couple has 6 grown up children.

Bi-weekly, Juana goes to the capital to purchase products to supply her business. Currently, she is short of some goods such as oats, chocolate, milk, rice and flour. She is requesting a loan to purchase those products so that she can ‘correctly’ satisfy her clientele’s needs.

loans.use: To spend in the acquisition of goods such as chocolate, milk, rice and flour to supply her grocery store. That way, the entrepreneur will be able to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Ade is a 31-year-old woman. She and her husband run a home industry which produce chips. They produce and sell them to the market or directly to the customer. She usually earns $7 per day and requests an IDR 500,000 loan expand her business and hire more workers to increase production. She  is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase production of chips

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Gregoria Sanbria is a 65-year-old widow, mother of 6 grown up children. One child still lives with her, and her grandchildren help her out in her business.

Mrs. S. opened her general store 12 years ago. With this business, she was able to raise and provide an education for her children, who now have their own small businesses.

In the future, Mrs. S. would like to broaden her business with the help of loans from Fundación Paraguaya, buying more equipment such as refrigerators and freezers. At this time, she is requesting this loan in order to buy milk, meat, sugar, noodles, and rice, among other things, since sales considerably increase this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Gregoria S. tiene 65 años, es viuda, tiene 6 hijos, todos mayores de edad, de los cuales uno de ellos vive con ella, además de sus nietos que la ayudan con el negocio.

La Sra. Gregoria hace ya doce años que formo su despensa con los cuales crío y educo a todos sus hijos quienes también ya poseen sus propias micro empresas.

Para más adelante, la Sra. Gregoria desea ampliar la infraestructura de su negocio comprando más elementos de trabajo como congeladores y heladeras con la ayuda de los créditos que le otorga la Fundación Paraguaya. En esta oportunidad, solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías como leche, carne, azúcar, fideos, arroz, entre otros ya que en esta época del año aumentan considerablemente las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, meat, milk, noodles, rice, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Fazilya

texts.en:
Fazilya Hasimova, a 41-year-old mother of six, has bred cows for more than two decades. She raises calves and sells them to the local butcher.

With a loan of $700, Fazilya will buy more cows to expand her business. Because meat is a staple of the Azerbaijan diet, she's certain that she'll be able to breed more cattle and repay her loan.

loans.use: To acquire new calves

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Louisa, and Ysabel have been members of the community bank “Lila” for six, eleven, and five years respectively. They appreciate the support the community bank gives them. Since joining they have learned business management skills, punctuality, and savings. In addition, they have learned about self-esteem and personal responsibility.

Maria is 36 years old, and is a single mother raising five children who are between the ages of twenty and six. Maria sells firewood as well as fruit. To get the fruit she travels eight hours by poor roads to the jungle region. She has been running this business for four years.

Louisa is 55 years old, is married, and has six children who are 38, 36, 34, 32, 30, and 28. Louisa sells food at the local market, and she has been selling there for over thirty years.

Ysabel is 49 years old, is a widow, and has seven children, three of whom still live with her. Ysabel makes and sells a typical bread called “chapla” which is similar to pita bread. She sells her bread from a regional bus stop. Ysabel has had this business for twenty-eight years.

Maria, Louisa, and Ysabel need loans of 1600, 800, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying things such as wood, plates, napkins, and flour.

Maria, Louisa, and Ysabel dream of being able to buy a car, see their children get an education, and have a better life.

loans.use: To buy wood, plates, napkins, and flour.

loans.name: Santi

texts.en:
Mrs Santi T. lives with her husband, Bhim Bahadur T. and two children in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in businesses like grocery shops, utensil shops and so on. Her husband is a taxi driver, while both her daughter and son are studying in primary school.

Mrs T. opened a grocery shop a year ago, where she sells different types of items. Due to a lack of funds she can’t buy goods for her shop, so she is asking for her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($175) to buy goods like rice, dal and noodles. She spends her income to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Mukasa Jane, Kavule Effort Group

texts.en: Jane M., the leader of this group, is a married woman with six children and another four relatives that she helps care for with her husband. She has a retail shop in Mukono just next to Stanbic Bank. She has been running the shop with her husband for ten years. Unlike other ordinary retail shops--that sell sugar, salt and edibles--her shop is for clothes, shoes, gomesi (ladies traditional wear), bags and jewelry. To get all these items on their shelves, they go to China and Japan for them in turns. Her dream is to import a container of their shop items and they are working towards that. They thank Kiva for the loans.

loans.use: Jane will import more clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry with her part of this group loan.

loans.name: Lung

texts.en: Lung K. H. is 53 years of age. She is a construction worker, a job females rarely take in Cambodia. She works alongside her husband, who is paid slightly more tH. she is for the same work. Together, however, their income rounds out to $10 per day. The couple has two children. Lung K. H. seeks a loan in order to rent a plot of land on which she can begin growing yams as an additional source of income.

loans.use: To rent land.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 39 years old. She has two small children at home and is married to Cesar Rolando Sánchez. They live in their own home which they received from Conavi, a public institution which builds affordable houses for low income people.

Faciela and Rolando are very enterprising people. They began creating handmade bags made from cardboard. Later, after much hard work they were able to purchase a machine for sewing synthetic leather. They used this to make covers for hot and cold water thermos bottles which are widely used in our country. Each thermos cover is decorated with colorful designs.

They need this loan to purchase an additional machine for sewing synthetic leather, and to purchase raw material as they now have many orders from businesses. With this loan they will be able to fill the order more quickly. In the future they hope to construct a display room for their merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Graciela tiene 39 años tiene 2 hijas menores de edad esta casada con señor Cesar Rolando Sánchez, ellos viven en casa propia que adquirieron de la Conavi, una institución pública que se dedica a la elaboración de casas económicas para gente de escasos recursos.

Graciela y Rolando son dos personas muy emprendedoras, ellas empezaron fabricando bolsitas de papel madera hechas totalmente a mano y luego de mucho esfuerzo compraron una maquina de coser cuerina (cuero sintético) y empezaron a forrar termos de agua fría y calientes que se utilizan bastante en nuestro país. Estos forros que llevan cada termo son decorativos y se hacen en distintos colores y diseños.

Ellos necesitan este préstamo para comprar una más maquina de bordar cuerina y materia prima ya que tiene muchos pedidos de empresas y de este modo podrán abastecer sus pedidos con mayor rapidez. En el futuro desea construir un salón y exhibir sus mercaderías.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine, thermos bottles, synthetic leather, thread, etc.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Señor Rogelio is married to Señora Ernesta Rolon. This couple has 4 children, two grown up and two who are still minors. They all work. Rogelio drives a cab, and Ernesta makes clothes, and the children work attending the small store.

Rogelio began to work as a taxi driver in 1993, thanks to his and his wife's joint savings. With the passing of time, they began to run a store in order to be able to improve their income. Since their children are single, it isn't inconvenient for them to manage the three activities. They want to increase the available capital for the three activities, because in critical moments they could go away. It is for this reason that they don't want to stop anything in the businesses.

As this is a very enterprising family, they want to improve their income and to consolidate their activities. The requested loan is destined for the purchase of fabric so his wife can meet the large number of orders for uniforms that she has recieved this month.

Señor Rogelio says that he is very happy with the loans that have been granted to him, that have served to reinvent and give moral and economic protection to his sons.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Rogelio se casó con la señora Ernesta Rolon, esta pareja tiene 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos son menores aún. Todos trabajan, el señor Rogelio es taxista, la señora Ernesta en servicio de confección de ropas y los hijos se dedican en atender la pequeña despensa.

El señor Rogelio empezó a trabajar como taxista desde el año 1.993, gracias al ahorro juntado por él y su esposa. Con el tiempo lograron montar una despensa para poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Como sus hijos son solteros no tienen inconveniente para atender las tres actividades. Están queriendo aumentar el capital en las tres actividades, por que en los momentos críticos es una de ellas la que sobre sale, es por esta razón que no quieren descuidar ninguno de los negocio.

Como es una familia muy emprendedora buscan mejorar sus ingresos e ir consolidando sus actividades. El crédito solicitado estará destinado en la compras de telas para que su esposa pueda satisfacer la gran demanda de pedidos de uniformes que ha recibido este mes.

El señor Rogelio manifiesta que esta muy contento por los créditos que se le han otorgado ya que le sirve para reinvertir y darles protección moral y económica a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make women's clothing

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
