Doris P. is 31 years old. She has four children, who are all currently in school. She trades in maize in the local market of Obuasi, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Her major difficulty is obtaining enough funds to support the business. She is requesting this loan to enable her to buy maize in bulk in order to grow her business and scale up her sales. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education and give them better future career opportunities. She belongs to the community group called Corn Buyers Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory by buying maize in bulk.

loans.name: Josephine's Fine Foods Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years old, and she is single. She has been a food seller since July 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Josephine is now looking for a loan to buy more food items for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Chausiku, who has a business dealing with firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim C., 30, is married and resides with four of her six children and husband in the province of Kampong Cham, in Cambodia. Since 2000, she has worked growing many kinds of vegetables and making rice cakes. She makes the rice cakes with sweet rice, coconut, banana and other ingredients, which are then packed with banana leaves and roasted. On average, she makes about US$3 per day, while her husband, Kim Mou, is a builder. He builds houses and earns US$5 per day. Three children are students and one works selling rubber. Kim C. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow more vegetables.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.en:
S. Guliston is 43 years old. She works purchasing and reselling cows with her husband. She has 6 children, two of whom are already students. She would like to request a loan of 800 Somoni ($250 USD) for the term of 10 months in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. 
In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase the family income further. They plan to use the increased income to fund their children’s education. You could become an important part in the Guliston family's life; S. deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand the business.

loans.name: Qasham

texts.en:
Qasham N. is 40 years old and is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of stuff like: tea, washing powder, razors, shampoo, sugar and many others in his grocery store, which he built five years ago. 

Today, Qasham is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. 

One of his dreams is that his children progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more inventory for grocery store

loans.name: Adalid

texts.es:
Adalid trabaja de transportista, tiene una movilidad de servicio publico en la ciudad de La Paz, la cual  es su principal fuente de ingreso.

El es soltero vive en la av.  Max Fernandez de la zona de alto LLojeta en la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la adquisición de un motor para su vehiculo el cual con el constante trabajo ya no presta servicio a cabalidad.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Adalid works in transportation: his main source of income comes from using his vehicle as public transportation in the city of La Paz. He is single, and lives in the Llojeta neighbourhood of La Paz. He will use the loan money to buy a motor for his vehicle, which in addition to running constantly is not being adequately serviced. This is his first loan with Impro; our evaluation qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, with his wife and their two children. He has owned a photography studio for eight years. Ibrahim requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new camera for his studio. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients can be anybody. Ibrahim decided on doing his business because he always liked taking pictures. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Ibrahim will use the loan to purchase a new camera for his studio

loans.name: Indira

texts.en:
Mrs. Indira P. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Chetrapati, Kathmandu. She opened her grocery store 3 years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. She mainly sells bags of rice in her grocery store. She also sells maize and different varieties of snacks. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy different types of grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. Indira P. lives in single family with her husband and three children. She has two daughters and one son. Her older daughter is studying in grade 9 and younger son is studying in pre-primary school. Her son is now studying in grade 9.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en: Mavzuna M. is 38 years old. She lives in Khujand and trades woman's wear, which she imports from Kyrgyzstan, at the week-end bazaar. She has good taste and a good assortment so repeat customers come to buy her goods. Mavzuna is a school teacher by professional background. She teaches the history of Tajikistan but a school teacher's salary is too low to live on so Mavzuna decided 2 years ago to start a woman's wear business. Mavzuna is applying to  KIVA in order to request a business support loan of 3700 STJ for 6 months to import new seasonal inventory. She thanks KIVA and wishes all the best in future.

loans.use: to import new seasonal inventory

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 1 Group

texts.en:
This group of five micro entrepreneurs is applying for its sixth loan through Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. Their business activities go from a grocery store, to selling shoes and undergarments, even a car repair shop.

Ivelisse T., the group coordinator, owns a small convenience/grocery store in Hato Mayor. She normally sells traditional items for daily lunch and dinner, like rice, beans, cooking oil, fruits and vegetables, and some spices. This loan will help her keep her inventory in good shape in order to meet her growing clients' demands. Ivelisse hopes to own a house someday, maybe one where she has a larger space for her grocery store.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory for convenience store.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty, a mother of 5 children and a widow, owns a tailor shop as well as a farming shop. She has been operating her tailor shop for 8 years.  Her expenses include providing schooling fees for two of her children and paying wages to her employees. She plans to use the loan to pay her employees for her tailor shop. She dreams that one day she will have a thriving businesses and will be able to live comfortably.

loans.use: Tailoring shop payroll

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Bình Nguyễn Thị (229970214) is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has five adult children. To making a living, Bình owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising water buffalo for sale. Bình has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 8000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, Bình joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bình has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Bình is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the tenth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Bình plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
"I am a food vendor. I have been selling food since my husband left me. I have a previous work experience as a retailer of ready-to wear products. My income is what we use to buy our needs," says Restituta B., a mother of only one child from Maribojoc, Bohol.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for her food business. The loan will help improve her business even more by allowing her to sell more foods.

CEVI provides financial services to the poor in the form of loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Vaydullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Каримов Вайдулло- мужчина 54-х лет, женат, имеет троих детей.У Вайдулло высшее техническое образование,он работает оператором в АО"телеком".Он очень любит свою работу,но чтобы прокормить семью ему нужен дополнительный источник дохода.Так как с детства он помогал родителям разводить скот и имеет опыт в этом бизнесе ,он решил заняться откормом и купле-продажей скота.Постепенно накопив капитал он расширил свой товарооборот.Узнав про нашу организацию он рашил получить займ и купить молодого бычка для откорма.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Vaydullo K. is a 54 year old man, he is married and has three children. Vaydullo has a higher technical education, he works as an operator in AO Telecom. He loves his job very much, but he needs additional source of income to feed the family. When he was younger he helped his parents breed the cattle and has experience in this business. He decided to start feeding cattle and selling it. Gradually he has saved some capital and expanded his turnaround. He found out about our organization and decided to get a loan and buy a young calf for feeding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy T. is a rice farmer who lives in Churomseam Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She also raises pigs to sell, while her husband has a rice mill to provide milling services in the village. The young couple does not yet have any children and works hard to generate revenues for their own family.

Thuy T. planted her rice crop a month ago but her crop is not so good due to the lack of fertilizer. Therefore, she has decided to ask a loan to buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield and to use the rest of the loan to purchase a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield and a piglet to raise

loans.name: Achan Rose‘S Group

texts.en:
Rose is a leader of four members of a group.  She is 32 years old and married with three children between 8 and 13 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with three people. Rose takes care of her sister. There is no electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala.  Rose stays in Naguru selling smoked fish at Nakawa Market in one of the Kampala suburbs. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Rose also sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people excluding children. She works six days a week. Rose sells mainly on retail only. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises and home.  She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Rose has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her 10th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more fish.  Rose is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise and home.

.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Kasokoso Central 1 West Nadego Regina Group

texts.en: Regina N. is a hard-working business woman who has stayed in her business for over twenty years. She is a tailor who makes traditional clothing such as gomes and bitegi. She is using the loan to purchase material and other supplies for making clothes. She is forty-three years old and married, and she has six children, all of whom are in school. She is an experienced tailor who is trying to capture the market from most of the corners by making what is best for customers. Her future plan is to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase material and other supplies for making clothes.

loans.name: Reyna De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Reyna de 32 años de edad, casada y con un  hijo de 4 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo labora como electricista y es muy dedicado a la familia, ella se desempeña como docente y da clases en tres colegios diferentes lleva cinco años, lo cual ha adquirido experiencia. Con este crédito lo quiere para infraestructura en la construcción de un muro para poder tener una mayor seguridad para su familia. a si como  a condicionar su casa y poder apoyar a su hijo para que sea un hombre de bien. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad con estos préstamos ya que construir esta caro y no lo lograría si no fuera por el préstamo.
texts.en:
Reyna, a 32-year-old married woman with a 4-year-old son, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua, the capital city. Reyna's husband works as an electrician and is very dedicated to his family, and she has worked as a teacher in three different schools for the last five years, which has given her experience. With this loan, Reyna wants to build a wall that will provide more security to her family, improve her home, and support her son so that he can become a good man. Reyna is thankful for the opportunity the loan provides -- building is expensive and she wouldn't be able to build the wall otherwise.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
I. Bashorat is 48 years old. She’s married with two children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 20 years she is purchasing the young cattle and calves in the local market, fattens and sells them. Bashorat is a very hard-working woman and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home. Bashorat wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. Her husband (pictured) actively helps her with operations. Thanks to this activity she is supporting her children with education. Bashorat wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves. With this purpose she is requesting a loan of $ 800 USD to buy calves in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Prosperity Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Prosperity Enterprise is a group of five borrowers led by Annie W., who is 28 years old and married with three children ages 1-10 years old. Her eldest child's education level is second grade. Annie is a 9th grade drop-out because of lack of support; she couldn’t go further in education but rather, she had to get married and started having children. She lives in the Brewer Ville community. It is north of Monrovia, Liberia, and it is an isolated and poor community that got destroyed by the civil war.

Annie's business is selling food ingredients, like beans, rice, oil, wheat, etc. She buys wholesale and sells at retail to the residents of Brewer Ville, Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for more than two years. She started with a very small amount but now runs a little shop. Annie sells in a neat place and also does delivery to homes as a method of getting more customers.

Getting beans and wheat is very difficult on the Liberian market because farms have been destroyed by the civil crisis. Annie needs this loan to purchase bags of beans and tins of palm oil. She dreams of improving her business so as to complete her dream by educating her children for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans and tins of palm oil for resale

loans.name: María Eusebia

texts.es: María Eusebia F. D. M. resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador  junto a su esposo y su hija. María y su esposo luchan día a día para lograr el sustento diario, ambos trabajan en la elaboración D. tejas hechas D. barro, las cuales son fabricadas D. manera artesanal por esta pareja, en la casa D. María por ser una zona no urbanizada ella tienen a su disposición terreno, el cual sabe aprovechar al máximo con el cultivo D. maíz que después oferta. María ahora solicita D. un crédito para comprar leña, tierra y mejorar su horno, donD. cocina las tejas, D. esta manera logrará tener un producción en tejas más eficiente y D. mayor calidad.

loans.use: comprar leña, tierra y mejorar su horno

loans.name: Benedita Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora   Benedita Consuelo R. S. es socia del Banco Comunal Mejía  ubicado en Portoviejo provincia de Manabí, ésta es una de las regiones más hermosas del Ecuador por sus playas y gastronomía.

Benedita Consuelo está casada desde hace 37 años tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedicada  a los quehaceres del  hogar y le ayuda al esposo en el negocio que tienen de frutas y verduras sobre todo de la costa como sandias, melones, pepinos, tomates.

El esposo de  Benedita  se abastece de  los productos en  Manabí y los lunes y martes  viaja en su camioneta a  vender   su mercadería en el cantón turístico salinas que esta a una  distancia de 4 horas de su terruño,  a su regreso trae sal en grano para vender  en otros cantones como Chone,  Olmedo, Santa Ana, hasta llegar a su localidad.

Con el préstamo solicitado van a comprar más frutas y verduras para abastecer a otras localidades de su cantón y de las comunidades aledañas.
texts.en:
Benedita Consuelo R. S. is a member of the Mejía communal bank which is located in Portoviejo, Manabí province. This is one of Ecuador's most beautiful regions due to its beaches and gastronomy. Benedita Consuelo has been married for 37 years and has 3 children. She is a housewife but helps her husband to sell his fruits and vegetables (watermelon, melon, cucumber, tomatoes), especially along the coast. Benedita's husband stocks up on product in Manabí and on Mondays and Tuesdays travels in his van to sell his merchandise in the tourist town of Salinas which is 4 hours away from their home. On the return trip he brings back coarse grain salt to sell in other towns along the way back home like Chone, Olmedo, and Santa Ana . With the requested funds they will buy more fruit and vegetables to supply other towns in their area as well as surrounding townships.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables like melon, watermelon, cucumber, tomato, etc.

loans.name: Jaguru

texts.en:
Jaguru J. is currently in the business of selling various items at the shop and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar, salt, etc. to sell.

Jaguru is 36 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has 5 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina V. is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Asau. She is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Lina owns & operates a business venture in the arts sector, operating a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clay handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Lina has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. Lina is now requesting a new loan of 1450 WST which will be used to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Lina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. She has been in business for 3 years. Oksana usually purchases toys wholesale and then sells them in the central town market at retail price which helps her earn good profits. Oksana is well-known at the market because the merchandise she sells is always of good quality. She is very cheerful, confident and strong-willed. 

Oksana has 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas. Her profit is about 3,000 Grivnyas a month. This time Oksana is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase more inventory for further sales this holiday season. She is hoping to use the profits generated to open another vending location and provide more jobs for people. Oksana loves her job and is hoping to grow both professionally and economically.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sandra Janeth

texts.es: Sandra Janeth P. S., tiene 25 años de edad, y reside en el departamento de Morazán, vive junto a su extensa familia, la cual esta conformada por su madre, dos hermanos, una cuñada y su padrastro. Sandra es una persona soltera, la cual trabaja para poder sostener sus necesidades básicas y así mismo para brindar su ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Ella trabaja junto a su madre y su hermana elaborando platillos típicos salvadoreños, así mismo vende refrescos naturales de frutas. Cada día Sandra ayuda a su madre a elaborar la comida y las bebidas, las cuales son comercializadas enfrente de su casa de habitación, estas se venden por las tarde, y cuentan con bendición de poseer mucha clientela. Sandra solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los ingrediente necesarios para la comida que elaboran. Ella es una persona muy positiva la cual desea poder seguir adelante con su negocio y de esta manera poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su familia tanto con su trabajo como con el dinero que obtiene en el negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra Janeth P. S. is 25 years old and she lives in the department of Morazán. She lives with her extended family, which is composed of her mother, two brothers, a sister-in-law, and her step-father. Sandra is a single woman, and she works to provide the basic necesities and to help with the household expenses. She works with her mother and her sister making typical Salvadoran food. She also sells natural fruit drinks. Each day Sandra helps her mother make the food and the drinks, which they sell in front of their house in the afternoons, and they are blesed to have many customers. Sandra is requesting a loan with which she can buy all of the ingredients necessary for the food they make. She is a very positive person and she hopes to continue with her business so that she can provide the help necessary to her family, through both her work and the money she earns with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making food

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” desde hace 3 años, vive el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y  venta de ganado.

Elizabeth nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para comprar ganado.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar un toro.

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio  y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y la promotora, además de la puntualidad
texts.en:
Elizabeth has been a member of the "Alto Alianza" Communal Bank for the past 3 years. She lives in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is 22 years old, is in a live-in relationship and has 1 child. She completed her secondary school studies and now works in the purchase and sale of livestock. Elizabeth says that with the first loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 300 new soles, she was able to increase her working capital to buy livestock. She is now requesting a loan for 800 new soles with which she will be able to buy a bull. Her dream for the future is to grow her business so as to get ahead with her family. What she likes most about her communal bank are meetings with the members and their promoter and also the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull.

loans.name: Bernard Kiiru

texts.en:
Bernard is a Nairobi-based businessman who runs a barber shop in Nairobi. He has been in this business for eight years and says that since joining Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save consistently.

Bernard is requesting a fourth loan of Kes 60,000 to upgrade and lift the standard of his kinyozi (barber shop). Bernard hopes to have the best kinyozi in the area. He describes himself as persistent.

loans.use: To upgrade his barber shop

loans.name: Higinio Juvenal

texts.es:
Higinio M. de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Tiene tres hijas. 

Higinio trabajaba en una empresa de cerrajería cuando lo despidieron decidió tener su propio negocio y puso un taller de cerrajería en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Ahora el trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 16h00, en ocasiones tiene que contratar a una persona para que le ayude. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es el dolor de su pierna que fue causada por un disparo.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hierro y soldadura para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener ya empleados fijos en su taller.
texts.en:
Higinio M. is 52 years old and lives in the periurban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and receives electricity and water as its only basic services. He has three daughters.

Higinio previously worked at a locksmith company. When he got laid off, he decided to start his own business and opened a locksmith shop at the front of his house. He now works from 7am until 4pm. Sometimes he will hire an assistant to help with the work. One of the difficulties he faces is the pain in his leg that was caused by a gunshot.

With this loan, he will buy iron and welding equipment for his business. In the future, he hopes to hire full-time employees for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron & welding equipment

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Maria Auxiliadora R. P., tiene 61 años de edad vive con su esposo en El barrio San jose de los Ríos, ella es casada y su esposo labora como chofer, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, casados, totalmente independientes y se dedican al comercio y la agricultura.

Ella trabaja en la siembra de la piña desde hace 32 años  y uno de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado en sus tierras ha sido la afectación de los gases que el volcan  a emanado en los últimos meses, ella comenzo trabajando en la agricultura gracias a que heredo unas tierras las cuales con su esfuerzo las a trabajao todos estos años, las piroridades qeu tiene para su produccion esta la diversificacion de la produccion con loa sembra de otras frutas y realizar trabajos de consevacion de los suelos, ella solicita un prestmao para la compra de materiales vegettivos y fertilizantes que den un mantenimiento productivo a ala cosecha y las tierras esot garantizara la buena venta y les brindara mejores ocndiciones como familia para emprenderse a nuevas fuentes de ingresos tales ocmo la apertura de una pulperia en su casa debidoa  que en la zona no existe ninguna cerca y desea aprovechar ese mercado meta.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora R. P., 61, lives with her husband in San Jose de los Ríos neighborhood. She is married and her husband works as a driver; they have three adult children, who are married and totally independent, who are merchants and farmers. She has been a pineapple grower for 32 years. One of the main obstacles she has faced is that her farmlands have been adversely affected by the gasses spewing from the volcano the last few months. She started to farm when she inherited some farmlands; she has worked them all these years with much effort. Her priorities for her crops are that the crops be diversified with other kinds of fruit and soil conservation. She is asking for funding to buy farming supplies and fertilizers that will provide care for the crops and soil so that a profitable sale will be insured which, in turn, will provide better living conditions for the family that will even lead to new commercial activities like opening a grocery store in her house because there isn’t any nearby and she wants to take advantage of this target market opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Elsa I. is from the village of Palattao. She is 53 years old. Elsa is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Elsa I.'.

Elsa is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables, fish and meat in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lepe

texts.en:
M. is 48 years old and is married with three children. She lives with her family in Lagos State where she sells cement wholesale and retail.

M. is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more bags of cement directly from the company at a reduced cost. This will enable her to meet her customers’ high demands while her own profit will also increase. She has been in this business for over two years and is doing fine.
 
M. is member in LAPO micro-finance with a good repayment record. She says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 29 years old and married with four children between 1½  and 10 years old. Three of the children are attending school. Joel is practicing mixed farming in western Kenya near Litein town. He has been in this business for six years with only one employee. He sells his milk and tea to Kenya Tea Development Agency and the local market, respectively. He relies solely on this business to provide for his family.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs. 35,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes that the income he will get from the sale of milk will enable him to pay fees and provide enough milk for his family. He says that the main challenge he is facing right now is lack of enough market for his milk. In the future, he hopes to acquire a hybrid cow, which can produce more than 30 liters a day.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maravillas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama maravillas por que las clientas se identifican con el señor de las Maravillas, está ubicado en el estado de puebla, en México, el grupo está conformado por 10 mujeres.
La presidenta del grupo se llama María de Lourdes Nieves A. L. y tiene 45 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, se dedica a la venta de peluches y es soltera, sin embargo, el negocio es su único sustento. Sus clientas opinan que la Srita Lulu es una mujer trabajadora e independiente que ha forjado su negocio en base a esfuerzo, su meta en la vida es poder contar con un patrimonio propio. Solicita el préstamo para comprar material para elaborar peluches  y así surtir sus pedidos.
La Señora Cecilia F. González tiene 39 años es casada tiene tres hijos de diecisiete, dieciséis y diez años su esposo se dedica a la hojalatería y ella estudio solo hasta la secundaria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos desde hace 11 años, el sazón de sus guisos es reconocido en la zona, solicita el préstamo para comprar un comal más grande y refresco a gran volumen que le permita dar un buen precio, sus clientes la conocen como una mujer que atiende a sus clientes con esmero y amabilidad, el éxito para ella significa darles una mejor educación a sus hijos para que en el futuro sean independientes económicamente.
Las otras integrantes del grupo que aparecen en la foto son:
Cecilia F. González
María Lidia Delfina P. A.
María Soledad C. C.
María Lourdes Nieves A. L.
Ofelia Juana P. Rodríguez
María del Carmen Lourdes A. G.
Irma A. L.
Gabriela A. L.
María Rosa Ignacia González M.
texts.en:
This group is called "the marvels" because the members identify with the gentleman from las Maravillas (the Marvels). The group is located in the state of Puebla, in Mexico, and is composed of 10 women. The president of the group is María de Lourdes Nieves A. L.. She is 45 years old and completed her education in middle school. She sells stuffed animals and is single. Nevertheless, her business is her only means of support. Her customers say that la Señorita Lulu is a hard-working, independent woman who has created her business from her effort and dedication. Her goal in life is financial security. She requests this loan to buy material for making stuffed animals and to fill the orders that she has. La Señora Cecilia F. González is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are seventeen, sixteen, and ten years old. Her husband is an auto body worker, and she completed her education in middle school. She has made and sold various snacks for 11 years. The flavor of her dishes is well-known in the area. She requests this loan to buy a larger hotplate for cooking tortillas and to buy soft drinks in larger quantities in order to sell at a good price. Her customers know her as a woman that attends to them with care and warmth. She defines success as giving a better education to her children so that they will be economically independent. The other members of the group who appear in the photo are: Cecilia F. González María Lidia Delfina P. A. María Soledad C. C. María Lourdes Nieves A. L. Ofelia Juana P. Rodríguez María del Carmen Lourdes A. G. Irma A. L. Gabriela A. L. María Rosa Ignacia González M.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase material to make stuffed animals, purchase a larger hotplate and soft drinks

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz H. is a 55-year-old pharmacist who has been selling medicine in the local drug store in Sabirabad for the last 24 years. She is married and has three children. Gulnaz would like to increase her monthly turnover and purchase more expensive drugs as they are in high demand. She says many people cannot find medicine in Sabirabad and have to go to another city to buy expensive and necessary medicine. Her loan request is 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase more expensive drugs

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en: Mrs. S., 32, is a humble villager living in Kompong Tom Province. She earns a daily income by working as a casual laborer. S.'s husband also earns an income by providing music with a traditional instrument for wedding parties. This couple currently live with three children who are young and attend school. S. and her husband always plant a rice crop which is an annual business that they done with great success. The coming rainfall season is good for growing crops but S. does not have money to buy supplies to use on her field. Thus, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seeds to begin planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seeds for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for his son’s wedding expenses

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine was born in 1979 and is married with three children: her first one is 12 years old, the next is 10 years old, and her last one is 7 years old; all of them are in school. Francine’s husband works as a driver and they both work hard so that they can afford all the basic needs of their family, mainly school fees.

Francine owns a small business selling various products such as cosmetics products, cooking oil, juice, and so on.

Francine is requesting a loan From Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more attractive products. This attraction will be a valuable thing for her because she will earn more profits.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lester Ignacio

texts.es: El señor Lester Ignacio tiene 24 años de edad, tiene en su casa de habitación un negocio de servicios ópticos, los cuales también vende a domicilio, también realiza exámenes visuales, todo con lo que se relacione con la venta de lentes completos. Sus ventas, en su mayoría son por encargos, es decir que las personas le pagan un 50% al encargar un producto y el otro 50% cuando se entrega el producto. El inicio en este negocio desde hace 3 años y medio, cabe señalarse su esposa es optometrista por lo que fue él el que estableció el negocio primeramente y ahora es don Lester quien se encarga de administrarlo. El está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de comprar materias primas para elaboración de lentes. Algo que él hace es mantener la oferta de su producto a un precio  que sea accesible a las personas. Su sueño es establecer otra sucursal en otro departamento y por supuesto llegar a obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Lester Ignacio is 24 years old and runs an optometry business from his home. There he sells [products], performs eye exams, and does everything related to the sale of eyeglasses. Most of his sales come from pre-orders. He receives a 50% deposit from his customers at the time of ordering, and the other 50% when he delivers the products. He started this business three years and half years ago. His wife is an optometrist. [Lester] started the business and now he manages it. He is asking for this loan in order to buy eyeglass making supplies. One of the things he does is to keep the cost of his products affordable to his customers. One day he would like to open another branch in another location and, of course, increase his revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Vidal pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 39 años.  Mario nació en la ciudad de Sicuani a tres horas de la ciudad del Cusco.  Actualmente, Vidal vive en la ciudad del Cusco vive solo pues es soltero y todavía no se caso. 
 
Vidal trabaja como sub gerente de la empresa constructora “RAF”.  Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a administrar el negocio    y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Vidal y su hermana Katia tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en brindar servicios de internet. Vidal requiere el préstamo para comprar accesorios de computadoras. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Vidal is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is 39 years old and was born in the city of Sicuani, which is three hours away from the city of Cusco. Vidal now lives in Cusco and is a bachelor since he has never married.

Vidal works as an assistant manager for the RAF construction company. He has had this job for four years and has done very well as a result of the effort he puts into his work. Vidal and his sister Katia have a family business providing Internet services. He is requesting a loan to buy computer accessories.

Vidal is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Alexandrine

texts.fr: Née en 1981 à Agbalilamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Alexandrine s'est mariée à ASSALIA Aloussessi, un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Alexandrine réside à Lokokoukoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji depuis son enfance. Alexandrine vend des produits de beauté et des mèches dans son domicile. Alexandrine achete ses produits de beauté à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN et les mèches au NIGERIA le pays voisin. Alexandrine veut augmenter son capital et élever le niveau de son activité ; raison pour laquelle Alexandrine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un second prêt. Alexandrine a bien remboursé son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Agbalilamè in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. A. Alexandrine was married to Mr. ASSALIA Aloussessi, a merchant. The couple have three children who are all in school. Alexandrine has been living in Lokokoukoumè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, since her childhood. She sells beauty products and hair extensions out of her home. She purchases the beauty products at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and the hair extensions from Nigeria, a neighboring country. Alexandrine wants to increase her capital and to elevate her level of business. For these reasons, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. She has indeed repaid her first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Kulbara

texts.en:
Kulbara K.  lives in the northwest of Kyrgyzstan. She is married and has four children. She graduated from the Kyrgyz National University and works as a teacher of mathematics in the local school. She is known as a person who sets her whole heart on her pupils' education. Taking into account her striving to make children progressive, she is titled as an Honoured Education Worker.  

As it is known, in rural areas, the salaries of teachers are low and do not cover all the expenses of a household. That’s why these people need to find an additional means of subsistence for their families. Kulbara, like many others in such a situation, began her own business in cattle breeding and land cultivating. Starting from buying one cow, she managed to enlarge the number of livestock to 10 sheep, one milk cow, one calf and one horse. Also, Kulbara has a beautiful small-scale garden with apples, pears and raspberries, which gives her some earnings for supporting her children. For her family use, she dries these fruits and makes provisions for the winter. 
 
Now, Kulbara wants to take a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) to buy five bull-calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenues from this investment, she plans to build a house for her family. In the future, Kulbara plans to develop her farm by means of livestock breeding.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan, de 20 años, es un ejemplar hijo, que lucha ante las adversidades sin miedo, ya que ayuda a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. Su fuerza y vitalidad le permite dedicarse a varias actividades; en las mañanas trabaja como peón en una fabrica de su localidad y por las tardes se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes, pero la actividad que más le agrada a Jonathan es la agricultura, donde siembra arveja y papa en el terreno de sus padres, hace ya 5 años. Las ganancias obtenidas en la venta de las arvejas le permitieron abastecer su tienda con mas productos, ahora Jonathan esta juntando capital para poder abrir una tienda de abarrotes en el pueblo de Huasahuasi. En estos meses sembrará papa y con las ganancias que obtenga, completará el capital que le falta. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido por todo el apoyo que le brinda su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y abono para la papa que cultivará.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 20 years old and is an exemplary son who fights fearlessly through adversity since he helps his parents with the household expenses. His effort and vitality allow him to work in several areas – he works at a factory in the area in the morning and works at his grocery store in the afternoon.

However, the work that Jonathan likes most is farming and he has been growing peas and potatoes on his parents’ land for the past five years. His earnings from pea sales allow him to stock his store with more items and he is now saving money to be able to open a grocery store in the town of Huasahuasi. In the months to come, he will grow potatoes and with the money earned, he will have enough to do so.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is very appreciative of all of the support provided by his communal bank. With the loan requested, he will purchase seeds and manure for the potatoes that he will grow.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia T. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Amparo, Brgy. Mabini, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  tailoring and livestock businesses. Her husband Jerry, who is 44 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 9 to 22 years old.

 Letecia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Letecia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to buy raw materials for her tailoring business so that she could continue to save up for the future of her children's education and expansion of her business. 

Letecia T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sammy Kiplagat

texts.en:
Sammy Kiplagat C. is 33 years old, married to Lilian Rotich, who is a farmer and provides a source of additional income for the family. They have three school going children aged 8, 6, and 4 respectively. Sammy sells potatoes and has been in this business for 2 years and earns a monthly profit of Ksh.15,000.

Sammy learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area, and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs. 30,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy 10 bags of potatoes. The anticipated profits will be used to expand the potatoes business.

In future, Sammy wishes to have a pick-up truck to use for transportation. His deeper desire is to see his children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. processes palm oil for sale at Abura. She is married and has 10 dependants. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruit to process into oil for sale. She hopes to reinvest her profit.

In the photo, Ama is in the process of making palm oil.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruit to process into oil for sale.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is 46 years old and does embroidery work to earn money for her family. She started this business to financially support her husband who is a painter and paints on houses and buildings on contract basis. He makes contracts with house and building owners and provides them with his painting services.  

She has 5 sons and a daughter. He three elder sons also do embroidery work. They learned this art from their mother and operate a shop in the market. Her 2 younger sons are studying while her daughter stays at home. She is illiterate and didn’t get an education. She  also spends her time managing the household chores. 
 
Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her embroidery business. With the loan she will buy an embroidery machine which will help her finish her work in less time and make more money.  She has been doing this business for past 6 years and she is confident that a loan investment will give a big boost to her business.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She has maintained a good credit behavior in previous loan years.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for her business

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Here is Osman K., a small scale businessman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Osman sells palm oil, salt, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), sugar, etc. With a loan of SLL 3,000,000, he will buy sugar, palm oil, salt, onions, margi, etc in large quantity to add to his business stock. 

Osman was born in Makeni. The forty-year-old is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children; three in secondary school and one in primary school. Osman has been a businessman for twenty-one years now.

loans.use: To buys sugar, palm oil, salt, onions, margi, etc in large quantity to add to his business stock

loans.name: Sacaba Group

texts.es: La representante del grupo es la Sra. Roxana es la líder del grupo vive en la zona de villa obrajes vive en la casa de sus padres es joven independiente  tiene una tienda de barrio también realiza el preparado de tucumanas, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mercadería para surtir su  tienda, comprara refrescos, galletas y dulces, etc.  es grupo de personas jóvenes con actividad económica independiente , el préstamo lo invertirán para incrementar su capital con la compra de mercadería, están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Roxana is the representative and the leader of this group. She lives with her parents in Villa Obrajes, a neighborhood of La Paz. She is an independent young woman and runs a corner shop in her neighborhood, where she also bakes tucumanas, a tipical pastry. She will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock in her store, like sodas, biscuits, candies, etc. This is a group of young people with independent business activities and the loan will be invested to increase the operating capital and to buy merchandise; they are grateful to the institution for the support granted through this loan.

loans.use: Purchase of stock merchandise

loans.name: Nason

texts.en: Nason is a 24-year-old married man, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a family desire to build a permanent house. For five years he has been operating a retail shop and this has enabled him to raise money to support the family. Nason needs the loan facility to purchase salt, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: Buying salt, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Genesis 3 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group, Genesis 3, and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Carmen is excited to be seeking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She operates a 'colmado' (food stall), and she will invest in her business by buying  rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, canned goods, etc.. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business. Her most difficult challenge is managing to have a comfortable life. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, canned products

loans.name: Germán René

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor  Germán René V. A., el cual tiene 33 años de laborar como Operador de Equipo en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es casado y solo depende su esposa.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de hacer cancelaciones de varias deudas que posee y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para realizar dichos pagos, considera que de esta forma estará dándole un hogar digno a su familia ya que quiere que ellos crezcan saludablemente.
texts.en:
Mr. Germán René V. A. has worked as an Equipment Operator for a firm in the town of Granada, Granada department for 33 years.  He’s married and only his wife depends on him.

He needs to pay off several debts he has and visits CEPRODEL’s offices to accomplish this.  He feels this is a way to provide his family with a decent home in which they can grow comfortably.

loans.use: To pay off debts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more motor spare parts for increased stock

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba W. is a vendor of maize, beans, and charcoal. She buys her wares at a market called Teshiman and offers them for sale at Korfofordo near Jukwa, Cape Coast. She is a widow taking care of four children. This loan will go a long way to help to purchase goods in larger quantities as the cost of transportation keeps increasing. Araba plans to increase her savings so as to provide a meaningful education for her children with the new profits expected from the loan. In the picture, she is standing by the bags of charcoal she sells.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and charcoal in larger quantities as the cost of transportation keeps increasing

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.en:
Pierrette was born in 1974 in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She now lives in the Sémé-Podji district with her husband Gilbert and their three children. All of their children are schooled.

For the past 10 years, Pierrette has sold clothing and clothing scraps from her stall in the Tokpa market, Benin's largest market situated in the heart of Cotonou. This is her second loan with ALIDE following successful repayment of her first. It will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from the Missebo market, which specializes in clothing. Her aim is to grow her credit eligibility.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing and scraps

loans.name: Fuh

texts.en:
Fuh I., age 44, plans to buy medicinal plants. He knows this business will succeed because he is located at a good business site, the city of Bamenda. He plans to use the profits generated to sponsor his children in school and to cater to the basic needs of his family. 

He and his wife, Ndum Mispa, have six children. His wife joined GHAPE in 2010 because she found that she could not take care of the family singlehandedly (a situation exacerbated by problems with her in-laws) and the children lacked basic care. These problems are saddening to Fuh I., but he is grateful to be alive and is driven to give his children the love and education they need. He states that "he feels better each time he provides something small to his children." 

He needs investment capital that can constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs, and his inability to obtain such capital is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerrment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase medicinal plants in order to start a new business

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
El comité "San Pablo" surgió a través del contacto que tuvo la tesorera con la Fundación Paraguaya. 
Está integrado por 10 señoras emprendedoras, todas ellas son de la misma zona, vecinas, con el crédito que solicitan pretenden aumentar sus negocios y crear nuevas fuentes de ingresos para mejorar sus calidad de vida.
La señora Bernarda R. fue la primera en comunicarse con la asesora de comité, interesada en formar su propio grupo; ella está trabajando como empleada doméstica y tiene por objetivo destinar el crédito para la cría y venta de pollos, es un negocio que quiere emprender, además de llevar a cabo el plan de trabajo grupal para el mejor entendimiento y desempeño del grupo.
Todas son mujeres que necesitan un apoyo económico, por eso confían en Kiva, en sus inversionistas, en que las ayudarán a salir adelante como lo han hecho con otros grupos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Pablo" came about through a contact the Paraguaya Foundation's treasurer had.

It is comprised of 10 women entrepreneurs who live in the same area and are neighbors.  With the loan they have requested they plan to increase their businesses and create new sources of income to improve their lifestyles.

Mrs. Bernarda R. was the first one to get in touch with the group's guidance couselor because she was interested in setting up her own group.  She works in house cleaning and wants to use the loan to raise and sell chickens.  It is a business she wants to get started in, and she also wants to set up a group plan to improve understanding and duties within the group.

All are women who need economic help and, therefore, they trust Kiva and the lenders to help them get ahead just like other groups.

loans.use: To buy chickens, medicine and balanced feed

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Noeun K. is 32 years old and her husband, Mr. Veasna Chhorm, is 32 years old. They live along National Road Number Six, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two are in school and the other one is still young. 

Mrs. Noeun K. and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, Mr. Veasna Chhorm also drives a motor taxi when he is not at the farm. 

Noeun K. is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm. 

In the photo, Mrs. Noeun K. is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es: Elvia tiene dos hijos en las edades D. 30 a 35 años y vive en el barrio San Salvador, donD. se desempeña como comerciante. Negocio que indicó en el año 1975 inició su experiencia D. emprendimiento vendiendo mercancía que traía desD. D. Maicao, municipio fronterizo con Venezuela, para comercializarla entre empleados D. almacenes , comisariatos;  ella distribuida entre su clientela blusas, suéteres y sabanas principalmente, luego adicionó perfumes, electrodomésticos menores y aumentó sus ganancias, las cuales invirtió en prendas D. oro, pero en este último negocio no le fue muy bien , así que decidió conseguir en la ciudad D. Medellín, productos D. buena calidad que confeccionan en esa ciudad, y se inclinó por los juanes y la ropa deportiva con la que sacó adelante su inversión;  así mismo fue a Bucaramanga, donD. fabrican muy buenos productos en cuero e inició comprando  calzado y bolsos en cuero y adicionó  ropa infantil; ella todo el tiempo se ha movido en este mercado porque como madre cabeza D. familia, decidió trabajar fuertemente para lograr el bienestar D. sus hijos; hoy como producto D. su trabajo  tiene su casa propia y dos apartamentos arrendados, que le generan otros ingresos y sus hijos son profesionales . Los proveedores la conocen como un cliente muy responsable y por esta misma apreciación ha ganado muchos clientes  fijos y rentables, que le refieren nuevos clientes. Su sueño es seguir creciendo para disfrutar la tercera edad y no tener dependencia económica, en esta etapa. Este es su crédito # 15 con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  el comprará perfumes, sabanas, electrodomésticos modernos, para continuar fortaleciendo su capital D. trabajo y aumentar su rentabilidad que es no menor del 14%.
texts.en:
Elvia has two children aged 30 and 35, and lives in San Salvador neighborhood where she works as a trader.  She started her business in 1975 and at first she sold merchandise that she transported from Maicao (a town on the border with Venezuela) to sell to people working in stores and co-ops.  She mainly sold her customers blouses, sweaters and sheets and then added perfumes and small electrical appliances.  She increased her profits and invested them in gold jewelry.  However, the jewelry business did not do very well so she decided to buy good-quality products from the city of Medellín that are maD. in that city.  She mainly bought jeans and sports clothes and moved forward in her investment.  She also traveled to Bucaramanga where they make very good leather products and started buying leather footwear and bags.  She then added children's clothing.  Elvia has always moved in this market because, as a mother and head of household, she decided to work hard in order to support her children.  Today, as a result of her work, she owns her own home, as well as two rental apartments which make her additional income, and her children are professionals.

Elvia's suppliers know her to be a very responsible customer and, for this same reason, she has gained many regular and profitable customers herself who refer new customers to her.  Her dream is to continue growing in her business so that she can enjoy her old age and not be financially dependent during that stage of her life.

This is Elvia's 15th loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy perfumes, sheets and modern electrical appliances so that she can continue strengthening her working capital and increase her profitability which is not less than 14%.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, sheets and modern electrical appliances

loans.name: Thida

texts.en: Thida (who we see here with her little daughter) is 31 years old and makes a living as a garment factory worker. Her husband, Ry, 29, makes a living producing rice wine and raising pigs at home. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to help her husband’s livestock business by buying additional pigs and feed for them to eat. The couple has been married since 2006 and has three young children, two sons and one daughter. They live along National Road No. 2, approximately 20 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to raise and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Manos Amigas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Sra. Amada, ella es una señora muy activa y trabajadora, es casada, vive en su casa con su marido y su hija, trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente.
Este comité es un grupo que se formo hace varios años, pero como todo comité habian conflictos y algunos problemas entre ellas, pero supieron sacar adelante el comité con integrantes nuevas y antiguas como es la señora Amada y supierón salir siempre adelante. La señora Amada es la  tesorera del grupo y siempre supo llevar muy bien su cargo y es muy responsable en cuanto a los ahorros de las integrantes.
Este es un grupo muy unido, son muy activas, todas ellas tienen su microempresa y algunas sus propios trabajos en donde invierten el préstamo.
Con el crédito podran comprar los materiales necesarios para poder realizar sus trabajo tales como agujas , hilos, etc.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Amada who is a very active and hard-working lady.  She is married and lives in her home with her husband and daughter.  They work and support each other. 

This committee is a group which was formed several years ago but, as is the case with all committees, there were conflicts and some problems between the members.  However, they knew how to make progress with both new members and old ones, such as Amada, and they always knew how to get ahead.  Amada is the group's treasurer and she has always carried out her post well.  She is very responsible with the savings of her fellow committee members.

This is a very united group.  The members are very active and they all have their own micro-businesses and work in which they will invest their loans.  

The group's members will use their loan to buy the materials they need to carry out their work such as needles, threads, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making handicrafts (threads, needles and other items)

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Este cliente es un pequeño agricultor con experiencia de treinta añosy  se dedica a la siembra de frijoles, maíz y trigo, es padre de tres hijos dos en edades escolares, acompañado. Con CEPRODEL ha tenido siete créditos y el actual lo está solicitando para la compra de insumos agrícolas los cuales son utilizados para la cosecha de maíz frijoles y trigo y así lograr sus metas de tener una buena cosecha para su propio desarrollo.
texts.en: This borrower is a farmer with a thirty years’ experience who engages in sowing beans, maize and wheat. He has three children, two of which go to school, and he lives in a common-law marriage. This is the eighth loan he has requested from CEPRODEL, and he will use it to buy agricultural supplies he needs to harvest maize, beans and wheat and thus achieve his goals of having a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies to harvest maize, beans and wheat.

loans.name: Rugando Farmers And Traders Association Group  A

texts.en:
Grace, a 31-year-old happy-go-lucky, self-assured and strong-willed mother of four, is a timber sales businesswoman operating from Kihihi in Western Uganda. She has been in this business for the past six years and she says what keeps her going is the ready market for timber in most parts of western Uganda. 

Most of her clients are carpenters. Most of these carpenters purchase timber to make wooden chairs, side boards, doors and desks, which they sell.

On the side, Grace also has a tea farming business that she says brings in extra income for her.
 
Grace says she is requesting this Kiva loan to purchase more timber to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to resell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita, 39, is married and has nine children. Three are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Florita has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets for her business.

Florita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Florita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es: El señor Juan dedicado al servicio de transporte y también se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos junto a su esposa, de esta manera también  aprovechan el carro que tienen en este momento para entregar los artefactos que piden los clientes, llevando a su domicilio y cobrando cada mes una parte de del precio total acordado , ambos uniendo fuerzas y con mucho empeño realizan este negocio para sobrellevar la vida en este momento que todos los víveres incrementaron en un 50% , dar una buena educación a su pequeño hijo y llevar una vida modesta, siempre pensando en que algún día no muy lejano abrirán una comercial donde los precios no serán tan elevados como en las demás ese es el deseo del Señor Juan.
texts.en: Juan works providing transportation services, as well as selling electrical appliances with his wife.  This way, they take advantage of the car they currently have in order to deliver the appliances requested by customers.  They bring the appliances to their customers’ homes and each month, they collect a part of the established full price.  They join efforts and now that all supplies increased 50%, they put a lot of work into this business in order to get by so that they can provide their young son with a good education and live a modest life.  Someday in the not-too-distant future, Juan’s desire is to open a store where the prices will not be as high as other stores.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances.

loans.name: Hermitaña

texts.es:
Hermitaña nació en la ciudad de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 25 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella se dedica a la venta de mazamorra morada y arroz con leche de forma ambulatoria ósea en la calle, ella ofrece sus productos a los transeúntes. Ella también trabaja en la municipalidad de Urubamba en el área de limpieza de parques y jardines. El crédito que requiere Hermitaña es para comprar insumos como por ejemplo bolsas de arroz, bolsas de azúcar y sobres de mazamorra morada. 

El Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Hermitaña was born in the city of Yanahuara in the province of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru) and is 25 years old. She has a common-law partner with which she has two children. Currently, she lives in the same city where she was born and where she has her business. She sells purple mazamorra (traditional maize-based pudding) and rice pudding in the street. She offers her food to passersby. She also works in the municipality of Urubamba cleaning parks and gardens. The loan that Hermitaña requires is to buy supplies such as sacks of rice and sugar as well as envelopes of purple mazamorra. 

The “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” Communal Bank meets every 30th in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristic, commercial zone and for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi as well as because it is one of the seven wonders of the Machu Picchu world.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of rice and sugar as well as envelopes of purple mazamorra.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot, de 26 años, está casada hace 7 años con Yuber, ambos tiene 2 hijos a los que educan con  mucho amor, ya que Nelsy y Luciana; son su mayor tesoro. Ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. El apoyo de su esposo Yuber, es vital para ella. Pues con las ganancias que obtiene en la comercialización de frutas al por mayor en el norte del país, puede alimentar y educar a sus hijos, y eso le ofrece una economía estable. Mientras que ella se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo; donde hace 6 años viene sembrando papa y arveja que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad. Con las ganancias que obtiene, puede darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
