Como también está ahorrando, para poner un negocio de frutas a gran escala, donde pueda abastecer a todos los comercializadores de todo el Perú. Margot, está segura que con la experiencia ganada por su esposo lo logrará. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Miraflores de casacoto” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura, de que tomo una buena decisión; ya que con el apoyo de todos ustedes logrará su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Margot de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero que solicita, en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Margo is 26, and has been married to Yuber for several years. They have 2 children who they are raising with a lot of love; as Nelsy and Luciana are their greatest treasure. They live in their own house in the settlement of Casacoto.  The support of her husband Yuber is vital for her.  

With their earnings from selling fruit at wholesale in the north of the country, they can feed and bring up their children, and also stabilize their family finances.  While she looks after their land, where they have been growing potatoes and peas for 6 years, he sells their produce after each harvest, in the central market of the city.  With the profits they get, they can give their children a better life.  

They are also saving to set up a business to sell fruit on a large scale, supplying retailers all over Peru.  Margot is sure that with the experience her husband has gained, they will succeed.

She belongs to the "Miraflores de Casacoto"  communal bank, and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is sure that she is making a good decision, since with all the support from the group, she will achieve her goal.  In addition, she promises to make her payments on time. When she receives the loan, Margot will use the money to buy sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on her potato crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Floresca Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Barrio Lindo Floresca  esta entrando a su segunda secuencia conformado por 8 integrantes que viven en la zona Vella Vista cuentan con negocio y actividad propios .                                                                                         La Presidenta es la Sra. Ernestina tiene  45 años de edad fue elegida como presidenta del grupo por su responsabilidad y amabilidad, siempre colabora con sus compañeras, su actividad es la venta de comida  en su mismo domicilio hace 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad, esta casada con el sr. Vicente  el cual es electricista y tienen 2  que se encuentran estudiando, la Sra. Ernestina solicito el crédito para la compra insumos e ingredientes como arroz, fideo, aceite por mayor para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos. El deseo de la Sra. Ernestina es el de tener un restaurante con el tiempo y poder ver a su hijos profesionales.                                                                                              Los señores están muy agradecidos con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo para poder crecer en su negocios y actividades
texts.en:
The 'Barrio Lindo Floresca' community bank are beginning their second loan cycle.  The group has eight members who live in Vella Vista district.  They all have their own businesses and activities.  The group's president is Ernestina who is 45 years old.  She was elected president of the group because of her responsibility and kindness.  She always helps her fellow bank members.

Ernestina's business is selling food from her home.  She has been in this business for two years.  Ernestina is married to Vicente, who is an electrician, and they have two children who are in school.  Ernestina requested this loan to buy supplies and ingredients such as rice, noodles and oil wholesale.  She will use these to make her delicious dishes.  Ernestina's wish is to eventually own a restaurant and see her children become professionals.  The members of this group are grateful to our institution for having placed our trust in them and given them the support they need to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, noodles and oil wholesale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha  de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito Las Lomas que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 5 años Martha se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos comestibles para abastecer su tienda, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Martha es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles otras oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha, 41, lives with her husband and children in her own house that does not have basic utilities and is located in Las Lomas District belonging to Piura Department.  This zone is characterized by farming and raising livestock.

Martha has been selling basic need items (rice, milk, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc.) for the last five years; she also sells beverages.  Her store is located in her house for security and comfort.  With profits she earns from the sale of her products she tries to cover all of her expenses and improve her standard of living.

To set up her business she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more groceries to stock her store.  Her only goal is that the business grows and to have a wider variety of items available for her customers.  Martha is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who strives to provide other opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Pumsen

texts.en:
Pumsen (in the photo) lives along National Road Five, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1985 and has three children- one son and two daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home and other two are garment workers. Her husband, Sorphorn, is a motorbike repairman. 

Pumsen sells rice and food in front of the garment factory. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to a assist in her husband’s motorbike repairing business by purchasing more motorbike spare parts to better respond to his customer’s needs.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s motorbike repair business by purchasing more motorbike spare parts to better respond his customer’s needs

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana (Cuenca), esta parroquia es de clima frió, lugar que tiene una gran belleza natural y desde su centro se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se  dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña María tiene 41 años, está separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 21, 19 y 16 años de edad, su primer hijo sufre de una discapacidad y pasa a su cuidado y sus dos hijos siguientes trabajan. La casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y como pasa en casa cría cerdos, cuyes y gallinas, siembra hortalizas para la venta. Ella tambien se dedica a cuidar de sus sobrinos que son pequeños.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en el alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es  tener más pollos para la venta. 

En la foto está la socia con uno de sus sobrinos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “10 de Agosto” communal bank.  She lives in Santa Ana Parish (Cuenca).  This parish is cold climate.  It has a natural beauty and from its center one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents raise livestock and farm; many work at various jobs in the city.

María is 41 years old and separated from her husband but has three children who are 21, 19 and 16 years of age.  He oldest child has a disability and is in her care; the next two children both work.  She owns the house they live in.

María is a housewife and since she spends her time at home she raises pigs, guinea pigs and chickens and plants vegetables to sell.  She also cares for her little nephews.

She’s been in the communal bank for four years and will use her new loan to buy chicks and animal feed.  Her goal is to have more chickens to sell.  

She appears in the photo with one of her nephews.

loans.use: to buy chicks and animal feed.

loans.name: Jaribu A Group

texts.en:
Nashon is the facilitator of the Jaribu A group. Nashon and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Nashon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Nashon joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Nashon had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Nashon was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Nashon will invest in a cow and then build a house.

In 2012, the members of Jaribu A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 41 years old woman, married and the mother of three sons and one daughter. 

She sells food products in her shop and has been in business for the last 10 years. 

Amina is very friendly, affable, and that helps make her successful.  Her sales are very high. 

Amina's monthly income is 220 AZN.  She applied for 1600 AZN loan to purchase more food products and she hopes to increase her profits. 

This will be her third loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more food products.

loans.name: Betty

texts.fr:
Betty est mariée et mère de 5 enfants.

Elle est âgée de 69 ans, elle membre du banc villageois depuis le 01/09/2008 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité sope Serigne Babacar.

Madame Betty fait du petit commerce dans la vente de fruits dont elle dispose une bonne expérience.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 250000 francs Cfa elle va acheter des paniers d'oranges et de mandarines et des pastèques qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier.

Grâce à ses bénéfices Betty va subvenir aux besoins familiaux tels que la scolarité des enfants et leur alimentation.
texts.en:
Betty is married and has five children. She is 69 years old and has been a member of her local credit association since 1/09/2008; she is part of the Serigne Babacar solidarity group. Madame Betty sells fruit for a living and is successful in her work. With a loan of 250,000 Francs (CFA) she will purchase baskets of oranges and mandarines and watermelons which she will sell at retail in her local quarter. 
Thanks to the profits that she will generate, Betty will be able to see to her family's needs, such as her children's schooling and food.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Ngosasia Shg Group

texts.en:
Isaac is the facilitator of the Ngosasia group. Isaac and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Isaac takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Isaac had a good maize yield harvesting 6½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Isaac was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Isaac and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Isaac will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ngosasia group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jamalat

texts.en:
Jamalat, who is a 37 year old young woman, is a mother for two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, which is the only source of income for the family. Jamalat wants to make some repairs to her house, such as: painting, changing windows and doors, etc. As her children are growing up, she wants to add another room to her house so she can offer better living conditions to her family. 

Jamalat has an amount of money which is not enough to pay for the housing improvements, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will enable Jamalat to pay for repairing her house and adding another room to her house. The loan will allow her to live with her family in better housing conditions. Jamalat is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed, instead, in the picture.

loans.use: to make some repairs to her house and to pay the expenses of adding a new room to her house.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married with 2 children. Teresita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Teresita is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for 4 years and every month she earns 10,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

In 2004, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Eudochia

texts.en: Eudochia grows vegetables on her hillside land plot in the southern province of Cimislia. The mainstay of her farm lies in growing seedlings in a greenhouse and selling them at the local market. Together with her family of five she also grows potatoes and an assortment of vegetables in the open field, selling mostly to residents of her village  In the last year flooding and other harsh weather conditions severely diminished her harvest and Eudochia will need a loan to purchase seed potatoes, vegetable seeds and supplies for the next planting.

loans.use: Seeds and supplies

loans.name: Akouvi Happy Vinolia

texts.en:
Akouvi Vinolia S. was born in Lomé on March 15, 1972. She is married and is the guardian of her niece. Her husband, a pastor in a Protestant church, earns very little, which causes her to contribute more towards family expenses. As a seamstress by training, she opened a shop in the city of Tsévié since her husband was assigned there.

To have more income for meeting the needs of the family, she is requesting a loan of $950 to acquire a freezer. She can then sell ice cubes, juice, yoghurt, etc. And so, she will be able to help in some manner to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 15 mars 1972 à Lomé, Madame S. Akouvi Vinolia est mariée et a à sa charge sa nièce. Son mari, un Pasteur d’une église Protestante gagne très peu ce qui fait qu’elle investit plus dans les dépenses de la famille. Couturière de formation, elle a ouvert un atelier à Tsévié depuis l’affectation de son mari dans cette ville.

Afin d’avoir plus de revenus pour satisfaire les besoins de la famille, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui doit lui permettre d’acheter un congélateur pour commercialiser du glaçon, du jus, du yaourt etc. Ainsi, d’une certaine manière, pourra-t-elle contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de la famille.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for her shop to sell juice

loans.name: Qahara

texts.en:
Qahara lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family and she is single. Her father died during the war in Kabul. She is the youngest of her family and she has a younger brother who is a singer.

She took her 2nd loan cycle and bought her brother what he needed for singing. He wants to be one of the most popular singers, so his sister wants to take anther loan to open a shop and find more clients for his singing. He is very happy because he has a chance to be a good singer.

loans.use: Rent a shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand bead and clothing business

loans.name: Salimahon

texts.en:
S. Salimahon has been engaged in this business for over 5 years.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband is her business partner and helps her with the transportation of her goods.  They go together on the purchasing trip to Israravshan, Khujand once a week.

Her business place is located in the big market - Atushbazaar, Khujand.  The turnover of her goods is good.  Today, she has many constant clients.  She has a wide assortment of goods and her goods are of high quality.  Many customers order their individual styles of underwear from her.  Salimahon does all she can to meet their needs.  She is very satisfied with her business.  

In the future, she would like to increase her stock of goods and she is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase the next batch of underwear.

loans.use: Increase stock of goods to expand her business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo S., age 58, sells vegetables in the market to earn about $3 per day. Her husband works as a driver in a private company, earning about $3 per day. They have six children, four who work at a food manufacturing company earning $120 collectively, one who is a mechanic, and one who is a student.

Mrs. S. would like to request a second loan from Kiva borrowers. In August 2007 she took out a loan of $200 to buy tools so that her son could become a mechanic. She has had no trouble making her payments on the first loan. She would now like to borrow an additional $200 to expand her own business by purchasing fruits and grocery products for her inventory to turn her vegetable stand into a grocery stall. The remainder of the loan will be used to finance a motorbike to use for business transportation. She will be able to more quickly pick up and transport her vegetables more to the marketplace, allowing her to arrive earlier with fresher produce to meet customer demand.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business by adding additional grocery products, vegetables, and butchery items to fulfill customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and grocery products to turn her vegetable stall into a grocery store

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es:
Jorge Enrique didn't have many opportunities to find work in his town. "Because there aren't many places to work in the town and I had to work" said Jorge Enrique, explaining why he started working in a general store, organizing, cleaning and placing orders for new inventory. Three years ago, the owner of the store decided to lease the business to Jorge, something that pleased him enormously because with the opportunity to manage the store came the chance to earn more money.

The business has seen good times and bad; for now, there's not enough stock to sell and customers are asking for new things. For this reason, Jorge is asking for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, so that he can buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge Enrique no tenía muchas posibilidades de encontrar un buen trabajo en su pueblo. “Por que en el pueblo no hay fuentes de empleo y tenia la necesidad de trabajar” comentó Jorge Enrique, es por eso que comenzó a trabajar en una tienda de abarrotes, como la persona que organiza, limpia y hace los pedidos de los materiales que faltan. Sin embargo hace 3 años el dueño de la tienda decidió rentarle el negocio a Jorge, lo cual le gustó mucho puesto que con esta posibilidad de administrarlo él, tendría mayor ganancia.

Sin embargo el negocio a tenido sus temporadas buenas y malas, y en este momento está con poco material para vender y los clientes están pidiendo cosas nuevas. Es por eso que Jorge está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Jorge podrá comprar más mercancía

loans.use: Stock up for Christmas.

loans.name: Maria  Victoria

texts.es:
Maria Victoria has been selling vegetables for 3 years. She began the business with a little bit of capital from her life savings.

In the beginning she didn’t have enough money selling her products due to bad weather but with a positive outlook she decided to ask Ceprodel for a loan which would allow her to better the conditions of her business by establishing a locale even though the locale was not improved but at least she had a small roof and was not out in the bad weather.

In addition, the loans enabled her to buy merchandise at wholesale and one of her goals it to better the conditions of her locale since the walls are actually plastic and in the winter she suffers from the bad weather of the season.

Being a single mother her little business enables her to support her son and his studies in school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Victoria se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 3 años. El negocio lo inicia con un pequeño capital producto de los ahorros de toda su vida.

En un inicio por no tener el dinero suficiente vende sus productos a la intemperie pero con la mente positiva decide solicitar financiamiento a CEPRODEL lo que le permite el mejorar sus condiciones por lo que se establece en un local aunque le faltan mejoras por lo menos tiene un pequeño techo y ya no esta a la intemperie.

Además, los financiamientos le permiten la compra de mercadería al contado y una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su local ya que actualmente las paredes son de plástico y en las temporadas de invierno sufre las inclemencias de la época.

Siendo madre soltera su pequeña venta le permite el sustento de su hijo y el que estudie.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Safija

texts.en: Safija is a 60-year-old woman from Živinice. She has a husband who is retired. His monthly pension is about US$ 300. They are doing agricultural work and Safija sews. In that way she can earn about US$ 375 monthly. This is her second  loan through MCO WWI, this time in the amount of  US$ 925. She intends to buy a sewing machine. She thinks that she will be able to improve her services and increase her monthly income.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Her gift of persuasion and ability in sales are what has made doña Consuelo successful in her business selling beauty supplies and natural products. She got her start in this business two years ago thanks to the invitation of a friend when she was experiencing a very difficult time economically. Consuelo offers her merchandise to family members, neighbors, friends and travels through her town for several hours a day trying to obtain as many orders as possible. With her earnings she has been able to cover her family’s expenditures and, above all, education for her 10 year old daughter Roxana. Consuelo is the only one who looks out for their security and well-being since Roxana’s father abandoned them. Consuelo is very happy about what she has achieved. She has many plans and work-related projects. The only problem is that she does not have enough working capital to turn her dreams into reality. For this reason, she appeals to your good heart and intentions and requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Su don de persuasión y agilidad de venta son los que llevan a doña Consuelo a tener éxito en sus negocios de venta de productos de belleza y productos naturales Tiens, incursionó en este negocio hace 2 años gracias a la invitación que su amiga le hizo cuando pasaba por momentos económicos muy críticos.Consuelo ofrece su mercadería a sus familiares, vecinos, amigos y recorre durante horas su ciudad con el fin de obtener mayor cantidad de pedidos posibles, y con las ganancias que obtiene ha cubre sus gastos familiares y sobre todo la educación de su pequeña niña Roxana de 10 años de edad, puesto que es la única persona que vela por la seguridad y el bienestar de su hogar desde que el padre de su niña las abandonó.Ella se siente muy contenta con lo que está logrando, tiene muchos planes y proyectos con su negocio, pero tiene un problema, no cuenta con suficiente capital para hacer realidad sus deseos, es por ese motivo que apela a tu buen corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase in working capital to offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Jan Agha

texts.en:
Jan Agha lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children. He was in Iran for about eight years; when he came back one year ago he opened a retail shop. Through this business he is helping his family, but he wants to help more, so he has decided to expand his business.

He requests an individual loan to expand his stock to attract more clients, to make a better income to help his family. He and his family are happy that he has the opportunity to further his business.

loans.use: To expand his stock.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia I. lives in a big city of Pakistan, Lahore. She was married eleven years ago and has three kids: two girls and one boy. Her elder daughter is seven years old and attends a local school and her son attends kindergarten, whereas her younger daughter is not of school going-age yet .

Razia is borrowing for the first time from a microfinance institution: Asasah, Pakistan. Her husband has had a construction supplies business for the last twelve years. They will use the loan to improve their business further and will buy construction supplies to increase their inventory.

loans.use: Buy construction supplies in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Fri

texts.en:
Born in 1966, J. is married to Michael Teneng with five children, two below the age of 15. Due to poverty and untimely death of her father and brothers she was unable to continue her education. Her mother was unable to help her and her younger sister single handedly. She could not raise enough money to educate the children, take care of their hospitals bills and pay for basic house needs like salts and magi. J. is a hardworking and energetic young woman who decided to start a business buying and selling wood.  Until now, she had been making healthy profits in the business, which has helped her take care of her children. Motivated by the need for business capital and need to be with people made her to become a member of GHAPE in 2005, where she was trained in business and marketing techniques, So far she has successfully obtained and repaid loans two times from GHAPE..
	She requests a loan to continue in her business of poultry and pig raising, farming and wood selling. She is quite convinced that her business is going to be successful because she has experience and a lot of customers in it.
	J. plans to pay the loan in 24 months. The first installment shall be repaid on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement

loans.use: To buy chicken, pigs, feed, wood and labor.

loans.name: Al Hayat Group

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 20 years old, is a married woman from a small village in the Bekaa Valley who owns a small clothes shop. The other members of her group are Asmahan, 43 years old, married, who has a grocery shop, and Aida, 38 years old, single, who wants to start a new business.

These women are requesting loans of USD 400 each (totA. of USD 1,200). They need this amount for working capitA. to improve their businesses. They named their group A. Hayat, which means life in Arabic, because of their love for life. This is the first time that the A. Hayat group is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a veil on the picture (second fromthe left) is the A. Majmoua credit officer who monitorsthe A. Hayat group.

loans.use: For working capital to improve their individual businesses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel is 43, married and lives in his own home with his wife and three of their children. Two of the children have their own jobs working for different companies. Daniel grew up in the Encarnacion region and still lives in the same place where he was born. He has worked in the poorer area of Encarnacion for 15 years, where he has two stands selling merchandise and natural products. Daniel already has a strong client base that makes purchases every week and provides him with sufficient income to cover the costs of running his home and family obligations. He also sells his products from home, where his wife waits on the customers. This allows them to have another source of income for the family and allows his wife to earn income and still be able to care for the family.

Daniel is requesting this loan to purchase additional merchandise for his stands. He is requesting G/ 2,000,000 [local currency: guarani].

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Daniel tiene 43 años, es casado, vive en su casa propia con su cónyuge y tres de sus hijos de los cuales dos están trabajando por cuenta propia ya que son empleados en diferentes empresas. El cliente se crió en la zona de Encarnación y vive en el mismo lugar desde que nació. El cliente trabaja en la zona baja (un barrio de pocos recursos) de Encarnación desde hace 15 años, allí posee dos puestos de ventas de mercaderias y de productos naturales, el señor tiene ya formada una clientela que semanalmente le compran y le genera un buen ingreso como para que pueda cubrir los gastos del hogar y sus obligaciones. El señor tambien realiza ventas de sus productos en su domicilio en donde la que se encarga de atender es su señora, eso hace que se pueda tener otra fuente de ingreso en el flujo familiar y que ademas su señora pueda ayudar a generar ingresos sin descuidar la casa.

El Señor Daniel solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para surtir sus puestos. El monto que solicita es de G. 2.000.000

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: lotions, soaps, makeup, scissors, penknives, nail clippers, decorative boxes, candy, first aid items, medicinal herbs, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge G. tiene 43 años de edad y su esposa la Sra. Gladys de 39 años de edad tienen 4 hijos todos en edad escolar. Don Jorge y su esposa viven en su casa propia en compañía de sus hijos.

El señor Jorge desde muy pequeño empezó a trabajar como ayudante en una carpintería de donde aprendió la profesión de carpintero, gracias a ese interés por aprender se hizo un profesional.

Hoy en día Don Jorge ya no es empleado por que ya tiene su propia carpintería la que pudo montar en el año 1989 mediante el esfuerzo de haber trabajado siendo muy joven y también por que pudo ahorrar para comprar sus herramientas.

Empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya en el año 2006, dichos préstamo fue de gran utilidad por que mediante ese apoyo pudo tomar compromisos con empresas. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de maderas y otras materias primas.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge G. is 43 years old and his wife, Gladys, is 39 years old. They have four school-aged children. Jorge and his wife live in their own home together with their children.

Jorge started working at a young age as a carpenter’s assistant, where he learned the trade. Thanks to his interest in learning, he became a professional carpenter.

Today, Jorge is no longer someone else’s employee but instead has his own carpentry business. He started it in 1989, through a great deal of effort and because he has worked since he was a youngster. He was also able to save money with which to buy tools.

He started working with Fundación Paraguaya in 2006. Said loans were very useful to him given that, with their help, he was able to take orders from companies. The loan he is seeking is for the purchase of wood and other raw materials.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase new fashionable clothing for her small business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This is Ahmad S., who is 51 years old. He is married and has nine children. The family has lived for a long time in Shewa district of the Ningarhar province, which is an agricultural area. Five of his children are studying in a public school, and besides their schooling, they help their father with farming part-time.

Ahmad is an educated man and he is a teacher in the public school of Shewa. He has decided to buy some animals for breeding because he has grassland where he lives in the village. Ahmad also hopes to sell milk and yoghurt. With this plan in mind, he has applied for a 50000AF (US$1050) individual loan for 24 months.

Ahmad hopes that he is able to expand his business so that he can buy more stock to start a stock selling business in future. He thanks the lenders of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Iborat

texts.en:
Y. Iborat is 37 years old. She lives with her spouse, and works every day starting very early in the morning, so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her 2 children successfully finish school and enter University. Iborat sells clothes and toys for kids. Her business is located near her house. 
Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own efforts, she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of 1400 Somoni ($425 USD), which she will repay in 12 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing and toys. You can be an important part of the growth of Iborat’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
“I must bring out my best in the business, for I know that it is the best way to support my family’s daily necessities and even during emergency cases,” says Mary Ann T.. She believes that patience and seriousness in business are needed to fulfill her goals in life.

Mary Ann is 29 years old and married to Arnold, a security guard in Santiago City. They have a three-year-old daughter named Athea and are planning to have two more kids in the coming years. They live in their own simple house in Yeban Norte, a village covered by the municipality of Benito Soliven, Isabela.

She came up with the hog raising business because she wanted to help her husband generate extra income to support their family. At the moment, Mary Ann would like to borrow the amount of PHP 4,000.00 which she can use to maintain her hog raising business. She will use the money to purchase feed for her hogs and vaccines for the piglets. She is serious about her business since this is their alternative source of income.

Since they are just starting, Mary Ann is hoping that her business will prosper for them to have a better life. She is also planning to venture into a vegetable and food vending business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase feed

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 38 años de edad, de su relación conyugal tuvo dos hijos que son la razón de su esfuerzo. Labrar la tierra es parte de su rutina desde su niñez, sus padres eran agricultores, y cuando se comprometió con su pareja, se dedicó aún más a esta labor, hace como cinco años atrás, adicional a sus otros cultivos, comenzó a sembrar flores, y está muy contenta con su trabajo y con la producción de sus sembríos. El mes de octubre que pasó vendió sus flores a un buen precio, debido a las fechas que conmemoran el día de los muertos, cada fardo de 12 docenas cuesta entre 70 a 80 soles, pero cuando baja llega a costar 20 soles. Debido a este factor, Delia trata de sembrar en fechas indicadas para cosechar en esto meses donde se cotiza mejor, pero también dependerá de la lluvia, del riego y más aún del abonado. Asimismo no deja de sembrar verduras como zanahoria y espinaca, de ese modo alterna los ingresos económicos para su hogar. Delia viene de trabajar cinco créditos con MFP sin problema, asimismo se compromete a pagar este sexto préstamo puntualmente. Con el dinero solicitado comprará abonos para volver a sembrar flores, porque sin abono la tierra no producirá, porque comenta que la siembra de flor empobrece la tierra.
texts.en:
Delia is 38 years old, and marriage has given her two sons who are the reason for all her efforts. Working the earth has been part of her daily routine since childhood. Her parents were farmers and when she got engaged to her husband, she devoted even more time to this work. About five years ago, in addition to other crops, Delia began to plant flowers, and she is very happy with her work and what the fields she sows produce. Last October she sold flowers at a good price because of All Souls' Day. Twelve dozen flowers sold for between 70 and 80 soles, but at other times of the year the price drops to only 20 soles. Due to this factor, Delia tries to plant at the proper time to harvest in those months when the price is better, but much also depends on rainfall, irrigation and fertilizer. She also continues to plant vegetables like carrots and spinach to provide an alternate source of income for their home. Delia has taken out five loans with MFP without a problem, and has promised to repay her sixth loan on time. With the money she has requested, she will purchase fertilizer for the flowers. Without fertilizer the earth does not produce, Delia says, because planting flowers exhausts the soil.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for flowers

loans.name: George

texts.en: George K. sells frozen fish at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast. George has received junior high education.  He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a petty trader. George has been selling frozen fish for about 3 years. He is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses . His loan will be used as additional capital to enable to him increase the sale of frozen fish to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in his oil palm plantation.

loans.use: additional capital to increase the sale of frozen fish

loans.name: Kenja

texts.ru: Кенча мужчина в возрасте 44 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Сам Кенча мастер по кладке дорожных плиток и мрамора.Жена работает в МЧС специалистом.У Кенчи большой дом , который требует ремонта,но у Кенчи не хватка финансов.Сосед друг Кенчи давнишний клиент в Микроинвесте посоветовал взять потребительский кредит.Для чего и обратился Кенча.
texts.en:
Kenja T. is forty-four years old, married and has three children. Kenja is a master tiler. His wife works at the Ministry of Emergency Management. Kenja needs this loan to finance a renovation of his big house. Kenja turned to Microinvest for help on recommendation of his neighbor, an old Microinvest client.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovation

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
U. Rano sells eggs in the local bazaar. Since she has hard competition, she has had to lower the existing price but she also sells in large-scale quantities. Rano first applied to MicroInvest in 2004, when she decided to open the egg-selling business. Today she knows the nuances of and is skilled in the business. She works directly with the supplier so every time she has fresh and good eggs. Rano has repeat customers and she is a very communicative woman.

Rano applies to Kiva for the business-development loan of 2000 STJ for eight months to expand her business. She thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba, Juana es de la comunidad de Huascahura que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juana es casada, tiene 49 años y 7 hijos, Juana se dedica a la venta de carne, los animales los compra de los pueblos y luego los beneficia, sus ventas los realiza de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Juana vende pollos bebe en las ferias de la región.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de oveja y chancho.
Juana sueña con construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of Banco Comunal Urubamba. Juana is from the community of Huascahura which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Juana is married. She is 49 years old and has seven children. She sells meat. She buys the animals from the towns and later profits from them. She makes sales by going house to house in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Juana sells baby chickens at the markets in the region.

Juana needs a loan of $325 (1000 PEN), money that will be invested to buy sheep and pigs.

Juana dreams of building a house and providing a good education for her children.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and pig

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr: Papa Momar F. est un homme Sénégalais qui vend des ustensiles de cuisine depuis plus de 10 ans, donc il est bien expérimenté dans le domaine.  Il a eu à contracter un premier prêt de 200,000 CFA ($400) qu’il a bien remboursé.  Maintenant il sollicite un deuxième crédit chez l’IMCEC et Kiva pour renforcer son commerce.  Monsieur F. habite à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale située 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale de Sénégal.
texts.en:
Papa Momar F. is a Senegalese man who has been selling kitchen utensils for over ten years, so he is very experienced in this domain. He had to take out an initial loan of 200,000 francs CFA that he has repaid. Now he’s requesting a second loan with IMCEC and Kiva in order to bolster his business. He lives in Diourbel, a rural town located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José trabaja como chofer asalariado en el transporte publico en la Ciudad de La Paz, la esposa es comerciante. Asó obtienen  los ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad.

José también por las noches esta estudiando en un instituto de  mecánica automotriz.
 
Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de la Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una computadora que le ayudara a realizar sus trabajos en la carrera que está estudiando, para buscar mejores oportunidades en lo posterior.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación socio-económica realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
José is a wage-earning public transportation driver in the city of La Paz. His wife is a merchant. Their income is used to care for their two children, ages 4 and 2. José also attends night school to become an auto mechanic. He lives in his parents house located in the Pasankeri area of La Paz. He plans to use money he is requesting for the purchase of a computer, which will help him with the career he is pursuing at school and to look for better opportunities later on. This is his first loan with Kiva partner Impro, and his socio-economic evaluation deems him qualified for the credit he is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer to help him continue his studies to be an auto mechanic

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana A. is married and has four dependents. She completed school through junior high and sells plastic rubbers, which she has done for two years. Her husband is a trader. Joana uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses.

Joana will use this loan to purchase rubbers to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joana plans to reinvest in her business and pay her water and light bills.

loans.use: To purchase rubbers to resell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine E. is 55 years old and is married with six children. He sells cosmetics in his shop in Asaba, Delta State. Justine is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cosmetics to sell. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Daniela

texts.fr: Daniela O. est une jeune femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse de chaussures au grand marché de Lomé. Daniela détient ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise en achetant de nouveaux produits pour la revente. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Daniela O. is a 39-year-old married mother of three. She works as a shoe retailer at the main market in Lomé. Daniela has been in this business for 5 years. She hopes to expand the size of her business with this loan by purchasing new products for resale. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette femme a eu une formation en couture et exerce ce métier depuis 2006, actuellement elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes de ses clients, ayant des apprentis, la seule machine dont elle dispose ne lui permet plus de satisfaire de façon convenable ses clients, elle souhaiterait acheter une deuxième machine pour livrer dans les délais convenables les commandes des clients, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite  un crédit pour acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre.
texts.en:
This woman had a training course in clothes making and this has been her business since 2006. Currently, she receives a lot of orders from her customers. She has apprentices, but the only machine she has at her disposal does not allow her to satisfy more orders in a manner suitable to her clients. She would like to buy a second sewing machine in order to deliver to customers within a suitable time frame. It is for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Kasokoso Central 2 West Naigaga Jalia Group

texts.en:
Jalia  N. is twenty-five years old. She is married and has three children. One of her children is in school, so she cares for two dependents who are also in school. 

She has been selling new and used clothes for five years. She is using the loan to purchase clothes, both new clothes and used clothes, to sell. She is adding more stock to what she has for sale. She is an encouraging business lady whose future hope is to construct a house.

loans.use: To buy new and used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marta Estela

texts.es: Marta Estela S. Z. de 38 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, Departamento de San Salvador, como toda mujer trabajadora la cual se esfuerza por brindarles una mejor vida a sus tres pequeños hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar,  trabaja diariamente en su propio negocio en el cual se dedica a coser y confeccionar ropa para todo tipo de personas. Así mismo Marta Estela vende artículos para confección y costura, tales como hilo botones y agujas entre otros productos más. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más productos para la confección de prendas de vestir, ya que cuenta con clientes frecuentes los cuales están muy satisfechos con el trabajo que ella realiza para ellos, ya que se esfuerza por dar lo mejor y de esta manera beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Marta Estela S. Z. is 38 years old and resides in Ilopango in the department of San Salvador. Like all working women she is trying to provide a better life for her three small children who are in school.

She works every day at her own business where she sews and makes clothes for all types of people. Marta Estela also sells sewing items such as buttons, needle and thread, and other products.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more products for making clothing. She counts on regular clients who are very satisfied with her work. She strives to give it her best effort in order to improve the situation of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing raw material for making clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fertilizer and soil amendments

loans.name: Mardonkul

texts.ru: Мардонкул Зарифов проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Мардонкул имеет магазин, где более 10 лет занимается торговлей техники т.е. телевизора, DVD и т.д. Ему также помогает его сын. Кредит просит для занупа нового ассортимента.

loans.use: Закуп нового ассортимента

loans.name: Julia Angélica

texts.es: Julia Angélica N. reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y su hijo. Julia tiene 44 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, actualmente posee una venta de frutas y verduras donde también surte de un pequeño inventario de ropa, el crédito que solicita es para surtir su negocio del cual obtiene buenas ganancias.

loans.use: surtir su negocio

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fuerza está integrado por María Isabel A., Julieta Magdalena H. y Viki de los Ángeles  S. L.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora A. de 44 años. Ella desde la edad de 19 años ha trabajado en la costura y actualmente su taller se ha especializado en trajes de danza para lo cual requiere del préstamo para comprar materiales como lentejuelas, cintas, telas, hilos, bordados, piedras….etc.

Mientras la señora H. de 47 de los cuales ha de dicado quince años a la costura y S. de 40 años tiene una pequeña venta.
texts.en:
María Isabel A., Julieta Magdalena H. and Viki de los Ángeles S. L. comprise the Fuerza Group. Mrs. A., 44, is the coordinator of the group. She has worked as a seamstress since she was 19. Her shop currently specializes in dance attire. She needs the loan to buy materials like sequins, ribbons, fabric, needles, embroidery, and jewels, etc. Señora H., 47, has worked as a seamstress for 15 years. Señora S., 40, has a small sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, needles, and ribbons, etc.

loans.name: Margort

texts.es:
La socia MARGORT pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, ella esta embarazada va tener su primer hijo. Ella es profesora del nivel secundaria del colegio “San Juan Bautista de Coya”, Coya se encuentra en la ciudad de pisaq a 1 hora de la ciudad imperial del Cusco.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su pequeño negocio de venta de material de arreglo de interiores como yeso, cemento, etc. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar la venta de materiales de decoración de interiores.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margort is a member of the communal bank "Minibank," and is a native of the city of Cusco. Margort is 31 years-old, married, and is pregnant with her first child. She is a high school level teacher at "San Juan Bautista de Coya" school. Coya is located in Pisaq, about one hour away from the imperial city, Cusco. Besides taking care of the household, Margort has a small business selling material for interior repairs, such as plaster, cement, etc. This member needs this loan to increase her sales of interior decoration materials. Margort is grateful for the opportunity offered through the institution and at the same time promises to make the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to increase sales of construction materials.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia C. is from the village of Cabanglasan, Bukidnon. Anastacia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anastacia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as soft drinks, beer, bread, and daily use products like soap in the local community. Anastacia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anastacia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anastacia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy food and pay her weekly payments to HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Balyewunya Group 2, Mukono

texts.en: S. Stella is 44 years old and married with 4 children aged 18 – 8 years. She is a property manager selling plots of land, houses, and those for rent. At the same time, she is also a farmer with plantations as well as having cows and goats at her homestead. She has been in business for 10 years and she is able to pay school fees for her children plus taking care of their general welfare. She needs a loan to be able to buy a plot of land where she will keep her animals.

loans.use: Buying a plot of land for animal-raising

loans.name: Surenhorloo

texts.en: Surenhorloo is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife is a hairdresser for a private company. He lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and operates a taxi service in his town. He began his business in 2007 after working and living in Korea for two years. Since then, his working capital has grown and he plans to open a hair salon for his wife. Within a short period of operating his business, he has gained a good professional reputation among the people of his town as a safe, reliable driver. Surenhorloo would eventually like to buy a larger, more comfortable car so that he can transport more people across longer distances, which would increase his profits. He is requesting a 1,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase replacement parts for his taxi so that he can keep getting his customers where they need to go and furniture for his home.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts for his taxi

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Como todo padre responsable, el señor Wilfredo L. trabaja en su propio negocio de venta de leña con el fin de brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos los que dependen de él. Ha iniciado la venta de leña en el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega y son sus sueños mejorar este pequeño negocio para así estar satisfecho y que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida y se sientan satisfechos.
Para llevar a cabo esto, solicitó un crédito para la compra de la leña por lo que el crédito será utilizado a lo inmediato para dicha compra y así comercializarla y generar ingresos para su propio desarrollo en su localidad.
texts.en:
Like all responsible fathers, Wilfredo L. works to bring better living conditions to his dependent children. His business is selling firewood, a business which he set up in the Somotillo municipality in Chinandega. His dream is to improve his small business in order to be satisfied. He wants his children to have better living conditions and for them to feel satisfied. In order to do this, he asked for a loan to buy the firewood. The loan will be used immediately to make said purchase. That way he will sell it and generate income for his own growth in his location.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Maryanne

texts.en: Maryanne is a 33 year old married woman with two sons and a daughter. She owns a boutique where she sells clothes. She employs one person. She has been running her business for three years and wants to purchase more stock with the KES 80,000 loan. Previously, she was employed in a tailoring shop. She hopes to expand her business and to own personal properties someday. Maryanne describes herself as hardworking and friendly.

loans.use: To increase inventory of clothes.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela, de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora. Vive en una casa de adobe (propia), junto a sus 3 hijos: Jerson de 18, Yosida de 12 y Lady de 6 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene en su chacra le han ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia, ya que desde que su esposo falleció, hace 7 años, ella es el único sustento de su familia y tiene que velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, es por eso que trabaja en todo lo que puede, ya que también está en el negocio de la crianza de cuyes y cerdos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cuidar sus papas y alverjas, pues sabe que esos productos se venden a mejor precio, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros del poblado donde tiene sus chacras. Para el futuro, espera mejorar su producción y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras.

Este es el primer préstamo de Marianela con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea entrar en mora y perjudicar a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que pone en las reuniones. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará pesticidas y herbicidas, para cuidar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marianela is 37 years old and is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in an adobe house (her own), together with her 3 children: Jerson, 18, Yosida, 12, and Lady, 6, who are the motives for all her hard work. The arduous working days she has on her farm have helped her improve the economic situation of her family since her husband died 7 years ago. She is the only person who sustains her family and has to watch over the well-being of her children. It is for this reason that she works at everything she can, including her business of breeding guinea pigs and pigs. What Marianela likes most about her work is caring for her potatoes and peas, as she knows that the products can be sold at a good price. She has done this activity for 17 years and considers that the most difficult thing is having to climb the steep slopes of the town where she has her farm. In the future, she hopes to improve her production and sew crops throughout all of her land. This is Marianela's first loan with MFP and she is disposed to make all her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to be in debt and damage her communal bank, where she is much loved for the energy and happiness she brings to the meetings. With the 700 nuevos soles she is seeking she will buy pesticides and herbicides to look after her seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides

loans.name: William Antonio

texts.es: Willian Antonio de 32 años de edad  habita junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Tania Prado y su hijo William de 2 añitos, es Ingeniero Agronomo de profesion y brinda sus servicios profesionales en la Alcaldia de Nueva Guinea. Adicionalmente se dedica a la actividad ganadera desde hace seis años,  posee su pequeña parcela con un manejo técnificada de sistema silvo pastoril, pasto mejorado, con un inventario ganadero propio, de buena selección, tiene infraestructura para el ordeño de su ganado parido.  Esta solicitando su primer credito y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva, para compra de ternero desarrollo, su mayor sueño es tener su propia empresa agropecuaria y trabajar de manera independiente, así poder crear mejores condiciones para el futuro de su familia, él tiene espiritu de superación, es un joven con mucho liderazgo en el Municipio.
texts.en:
William Antonio is 32 years old and lives with his family, which consists of his wife Tania Prado and their two year old son William. He is an agricultural engineer by profession and provides his professional services to the City of Nueva Guinea. In addition, he has been raising cattle for six years. William Antonio owns a small plot of land that contains a technical forestry management system, improved pastures, and his own herd of well-bred cattle. He also has the infrastructure for nursing the newborn calves.

William Antonio is requesting his first loan and hopes to be a beneficiary of Kiva funds so that he can buy a calf to raise. His greatest wish is to have his own agricultural business and work independently so that he can create better conditions for the future of his family. He has the spirit to succeed and has great leadership within the city.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Titus C.osondo

texts.fr: Monsieur Osondo tient un local a l’entrée  du marche de Ouakam ou il expose ses chaussures. Il évolue  dans le domaine de la cordonnerie  depuis 14 ans et il a beaucoup de passion et d’expérience  pour la confection de chaussures. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif.  Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs. Une partie du financement sera  destine a  développer  une nouvelle activité  de restaurant par l’achat de matériels  à cuisiner et l’autre partie sera orientée  vers la confection  de chaussures. Le prêt lui permettra ainsi de diversifier son activité de commerce et en plus d’accroitre ses profits
texts.en:
Mr. Osondo has premises at the entrance to the market in Ouakam where he displays his shoes. He has been a developing a cobbler's business for the past 14 years and he has a lot of passion for and experience in making shoes. What interests him most is the profitability of this business. He is applying for a loan of 500,000 francs. Part of this loan will be used to buy equipment to develop a new activity in restauration, and the rest will be used for making shoes. The loan will thus allow him to diversify his business and also to increase his profits.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of funds

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en:
Bolanle sew dresses and also sells women undergarments.  She goes to Lagos Island to buy clothing material as soon as her stock goes down. With this business she makes a living and takes care of other family needs. She has been in this business for over ten years. 

She is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more clothing materials at a reduced cost and also reduce the risk of been on the road more often. In the photo what she is holding is one of her pieces of finished work.

Bolanle is 45 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a plumber who sometimes helps her at the shop. She says thanks to Kiva- LAPO microfinance for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to sew and sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 28-year-old single lady with a 2-year-old child. She has been selling clothes for five years in an open-air market to earn a living.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mercy has been able to save her money with a group of friends who are also members of Faulu Kenya. She plans to add to her stock of children’s clothes and women’s clothes. For this reason, she has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 from Faulu Kenya.

Mercy hopes to expand her business into a wholesale operation in the future.

loans.use: To buy more children's and women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne E., 47, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Eduardo, a machine operator, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been into direct selling of food supplements while managing her own jewelry business for quite some time now.

Yvonne has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her jewelry business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities and designs of jewelries needed to replenish her current product stock.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more stocks (food supplements) and various designs of jewelries to replenish her current product stock

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nuevo Renacer” esta representado por la señora Gaby y conformada por 13 miembros en su integridad mujeres, mismas que han demostrado ser muy responsables y trabajadoras. La señora Gaby es casada tiene 2 hijos, son niños en edad escolar, la señora se dedica a la venta de dulces y empanadas en una cancha deportiva concurrida del barrio, las expectativas de Gaby es tener un kiosco en el barrio para tener ventas más continuas y así obtener mas ingresos, ella vive en alquiler por el momento y los planes que tiene con su esposo  es mejorar su negocio y ahorrar para tener una casa propia, también desea poder darles una educación mas adecuada a sus hijos para que lleguen a obtener una profesión a futuro, ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de un puesto fijo y para incrementar sus mercadería. El resto de las socias del grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta de ropa, venta de comida, zapatos, hamacas, empanadas y asaditos. El grupo en general tiene  experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias de su barrio donde venden sus productos. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante alta, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios y productos, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital de operaciones, con la compra de mercadería, insumos y herramientas de trabajo. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es de seguir trabajando para crecer u mejorar sus ingresos para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, el presente por ejemplo es su tercer ciclo en los cuales han demostrado responsabilidad, unidad y ganas de trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Renacer" ("New Dawn") group is represented by Gaby and made up of 13 women who are responsible and hard-working. Gaby is married and has two children, who are of school age. She sells sweets and empanadas in a sports field popular in the neighborhood. Gaby would like to have a kiosk in the neighborhood so she can sell more regularly and thereby increase her income. At the moment, she is renter, and she and her husband plan to improve their business and save up for their own house. She also wants to give her children a better education so that they can have a profession in the future. She is asking for a loan to invest in the construction of a stand and to increase her merchandise. The other members of the group are involved in a variety of activities, including selling clothing, food, hammocks, savory pastries, and grilled food. The group as a whole is experienced in the activities in which it is involved, and for this reason, it is well-known at the neighborhood markets where it sells its products. Within this competitive environment, the group already has regular customers who are familiar with its work and ask for its services and products. The group is enthusiastic about what it does. This credit will be used as working capital for buying merchandise, raw materials, and work tools. The group expects to keep working in order to grow and to increase its profits so its members can give their families a better quality of life. Their bank is already familiar with this group--it is not their first loan, but their third funding cycle. They have previously demonstrated that they are responsible, united, and hard-working enough to look to the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Hourt

texts.en:
Mrs. Hourt S. is one of many Cambodian people who earn a living by planting crops. She is 41 years old and is the mother of five children, all of whom are single and work, and they live together in the farming home. Hourt S. has a life partner in her husband who works on the farm with her.

The coming rainfall season allows for farming but Hourt S. does not have money to buy any supplies to use on her field. Thus, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds to plant

loans.name: Sahiba

texts.en:
Sahiba A. is a 49-year-old entrepreneur who owns a beauty salon. She likes her job and started her business as soon as she had enough savings to open her own salon. Sahiba used to work in a general salon as a hair stylist but now she is independent and her monthly income is about 400 AZN. 

Sahiba's beauty salon is very popular because she is very quality specialist. She has about 15-20 clients a day, for hair cuts, hair coloring and styling. Brides are especially good for income as their styling is quite expensive. 

Sahiba is married and has three children. She has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase new tools and make renovations in her beauty salon.

loans.use: purchase new tools and renovations at her salon

loans.name: René

texts.fr: N. René est né le 10 Mars 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. René est marié à HOUNSINOU Clotilde, une coiffeuse. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  René s’est installé depuis huit ans evirons, au quartier Dandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il habite avec sa femme et ses enfants. René subvient principalement aux besoins de sa famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. René a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et appris ensuite la coiffure. René exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Dans le but d’équiper son salon de coiffure de matériels nécessaire au bon fonctionnement de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, René sollicite pour une première fois, de crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
René N. was born on March 10, 1980, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He's married to Clotilde HOUNSINOU, a hairdresser. The couple has two children, who both attend school. Approximately eight years ago, René moved in to the Dandji neighborhood in Sèmè-Podji, where he lives with his wife and children. René is the family's main bread earner, thanks to the income drawn from his business. He dropped out of middle school, and was then trained as a hairdresser. He's been running this business for three years. With the goal of outfitting his salon with the equipment he needs to do his job properly, as well as to better meet customer demand, René is for the first time seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clippers and haircare products

loans.name: Nancy Karina

texts.es: Nancy, tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y una casa propia. Ella y su esposo se han dedicado a la venta y servicio de materiales electricos, el negocio esta situado en otro municipio retirado de su vivienda, tienen una amplia experiencia en el negocio ya que tienen 10 años de laborar en ella. Nancy atiende el negocio con su calido trato y logra el retorno de sus clientes. Por ello esta en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito ya que su negocio tiene mucha demanda y necesita comprar material para darles un mejor servicio y poder tneer mas ganacias. El sueño de Nancyes darle una mejor vivida y educación a sus hijos, y sabe que lo puede conseguir luchando cada día y trabajando.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old, has two children, and lives in her own home. She and her husband sell and service electrical equipment. Their business is located in another town away from their home. Nancy and her husband have ten years of experience running their business. She is in charge of the day-to-day management and warmly welcoming her customers, which encourages them to return.

Nancy is requesting a loan because her business is in great demand. She needs to buy materials so that she can provide the best service and generate the most revenue. Her dream is to provide her children with an education and a better life. She knows that she has to continue struggling and working each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of electrical supplies

loans.name: Martha Fabiola

texts.es:
Martha de 28 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (en una zona urbana, con una ecología en construcción). Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de dulces en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Su esposo vende pollos y tienen dos hijos, pero debido a los pocos ingresos que tenían, ella decidió invertir sus ahorros y comprar dulces para vender a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo, a podido tener una pequeña dulcería en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo dulces y galletas, en el futuro quiere obtén mas cliente y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Martha is 28 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (in an urban zone under construction). She has a small candy store in the front part of her home. She and her husband have two children. Her husband also sells chickens, but because of the low income they had, she decided to invest her savings to buy candy to sell to her acquaintances. Little by little, with some effort, she has been able to establish a small candy store in the front part of her home. She works from 7:30 AM to 8:00 PM. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy candy and cookies so that she can offer a greater variety in her business. In the future she wants to have more customers and wants her children to complete their education with enthusiasm.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cookies and candy

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady S.  est une femme mariée de 55 ans qui habite  à Cambérene. Elle gère un magasin ou elle exerce la vente d’habits depuis plus de 3 ans déjà. Auparavant c’est son mari qui lui envoyait des habits qu’elle vendait sur le marché. Et c’est par la suite qu’elle a acquit ce magasin. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Cambérene  depuis mai 2005.Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son stock pour répondre a la demande de la clientèle en cette période  de préparation des fêtes. Ce financement lui permettra de développer  son activité, de maximiser ses bénéfices et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady S. is a 55 year-old married woman who lives in Cambérene. She manages a shop where she has been selling clothing for more than 3 years. Previously, her husband sent her the clothing that she sold in the market. Subsequently, she got this store. She has been a member of the Cambérene credit union since May 2005. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 frs with the goal of increasing her stock to respond to customer demand during preparations for the holidays. This financing will enable her to expand her business, maximize her profit and better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yin T. is a single mother of two children. One of her children is already married and lives independently, while the remaining one stays at home and works sewing clothes in industry. 

Yin T. has been cultivating crops to earn a living. As the farming season approaches, Yin T. lacks money to plant a rice crop and is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es:
Gertrudes es casada y tiene 5 hijos que estudian, Gertrudes viaja a la comunidad de Alpachaca de donde compra quesos y luego lo vende en el mercado de Ayacucho. Además Gertrudes tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su pueblo de Satica, también vende verduras, frutas y quesos. Gertrudes tiene ganado y también elabora quesos.
Gertrudes es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy y solicita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Gertrudes son construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gertrudes is married and has five children who are in school. She travels to the community of Alpachaca where she buys cheeses to sell later at the market in Ayacucho. In addition, Gertrudes has a grocery store in the town of Satica where she sell vegetables, fruits and cheeses. She has cows and makes her own cheeses.
