Gertrudes is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank and requests a loan of 1600 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Her dreams are to build a house in the city of Ayacucho and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Cecibel Alexandra

texts.es:
Cecibel Alexandra Ragundi M. tiene 31 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.  

Cecibel es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Cecibel trabaja en el comercio vende ropa y perfumes,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para comprar carro y casa y dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Cecibel Alexandra Ragundi M. is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.

Cecibel is a member of the La Esperanza communal bank, which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. It is a community dedicated primarily to commerce. The group meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.

Cecibel works selling clothing and perfumes. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and sells them from a business in her house, and door-to-door.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand her business. The support of the loan would help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to have money to buy a car and house, and to educate her children. She likes to walk with her family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Arroyo Porá  surguió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 9º ciclo, es un comité antiguo opera con la Fundación desde el año 2006  con pagos excelentes, tienen un ahorro de 3.487.320  Gs. . 
La Directora General es la Sra. María del Pilar T. es casada con 1 hijo, su marido  es albañil, ella invierte en compra de ropas de un comercial donde consigue a buenos precios por la compra en cantidad, luego lleva a su zona y realiza la venta en forma ambulante y también sobre pedido.
 Comenta la Sra, María del Pilar que el crédito que recibe dentro del comité es de mucho valor para ella ya que cada vez que recibe   vuelve a invertir en su negocio y de sus ganancias paga la cuota de su comité y también es un ingreso importante para su familia.
 En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, blusa de varios colores y modelos para la temporada, shorts, jeans y otros.
texts.en:
This group from San Arroyo Porá neighborhood came together as a result of promotional activities in their area.  The group is in its 9th loan cycle.  It is a long-standing communal bank which has been with Fundación Paraguaya since 2006.  They have made excellent repayments and have savings of 3,487,320 Paraguayan guaranis.

The director of the bank is Mrs María del Pilar T..  She is married with one child.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  She buys clothes from a sales rep.  She obtains them at a good price because she buys in bulk.  She then transports the clothes to the area where she lives and sells them in an itinerant manner and also on request.

Mrs María del Pilar comments that the loan which she receives within her communal bank is very valuable to her since each time she receives it she re-invests it in her business.  From her profits, she makes her repayment to her communal bank and also has a considerable income for her family.

On this occasion she is requesting the loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, blouses of different colors and styles for the season, shorts, jeans etc.

loans.use: Purchase of t-shirts, dresses, blouses, shorts, jeans

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Duo Silidario Kayros De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
DUO  SOLIDARIO KAYROS DE SAN BARTOLO
La señora Nohelia Haydee, 20 años  quien se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles , nos comenta que su negocio existe gracias a la liquidación  salarial que ella  y su esposo recibieron  en una empresa donde trabajaban  cuando tenía 15 años, y por políticas uno de los dos tenía que retirarse, los dos decidieron retirarse, y  es así como ellos emprendieron con este negocio,  y tienen el anhelo de seguir invirtiendo pues le ha ido bien, pero requieren de mas capital, por eso solicita este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles   su hermana  la señora Shirley  quien se dedica a la venta de refacciones, dice que inicio con la venta de frijol preparado, volteados,  por lo que ella necesita de capital, por eso solicita este crédito para comprar productos comestibles por mayor para elaborar comida , teniendo así un mejor ingreso con la que colabora al sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
DUO  SOLIDARIO KAYROS DE SAN BARTOLO 
20-year old Señora Nohelia Haydee sells groceries. She bought the business with the settlement she and her husband received from the company where she had worked since she was 15 years old. For political reasons one of them had to leave, so they both decided to leave, and that’s when they started the business. Their greatest wish is to continue building the business as it has done well, but they need more capital. For this reason Nohelia is seeking a loan to buy more stock. 

Her sister Señora Shirley sells snacks. She explains that she is starting out by selling refried bean dishes, but she needs a loan to buy the ingredients at wholesale prices. This way she will have more income and be able to contribute to household expenses.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 58 year old Abu T.. He is married and has three children ages 4, 12 and 20. In 1980, Abu established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to generate income and continue to improve the living conditions of his family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 300000 SLL every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of  3000000 SLL in order to buy more stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250000 SLL. 

In the future, Abu plans to expand his business. He would also like build a house for his family and continue to educate his children to university level. Abu finds it challenging to meet the high cost of living and transportation in Makeni, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
El Señor Fredy Fernández Brañez vive en concubinato y es padre de familia de un hijo al cual apoya y ayuda en su educación junto a su pareja, hace como un año que vive con su pareja ellos viven en su chaco cuentan con una casita de madera que les sirve de refugio y de techo para dormir, es por eso que él trabaja como agricultor y como moto taxista  en la localidad de Ivirgarzama, en el cual esta hace mas de 1 año como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos y consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fredy Fernández Brañez lives with his partner and is father to one son who he supports and helps in his education, along with his partner. He has lived with his girlfried for one year. They live in a small wooden house that serves as a refuge and a place to sleep. It is for this that he works as a farmer and as a mototaxi driver in the area of Ivirgarzama, where for more than one year he has been an active member. The service he provides is profitable due to the high quantity of people that request this service due to its ease, speed and efficiency. The union has stops and turns for each affiliate in different points of the area if Ivirgarzama where people go to request this service.

This is the first time that the client has obtained a loan from our institution. It will be used to purchase a new motorcycle since the one he has currently has already completed its working cycle and so he can improve the service for his customers which will also improve his income and consequently his quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle for his job.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC WATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 58 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa para bebes, el socio también trabaja en el instituto nacional de cultura, el socio trabaja junto con su esposa vendiendo la ropa para bebes, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa para bebe. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa para bebes al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan, 58, is a member of the “SUMAC WATA” communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province and department.

He is married and has three children.  He alternates daily chores with the sale of baby clothes.  He also works at the National Institute of Culture.  He works together with his wife selling clothing for babies.  He wants to expand the baby clothes business.  He is asking for a loan to buy baby clothes at wholesale.

He is happy with the loan and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy baby clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora María B. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Patamarca en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza natural y cultural, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños.

La Señora. María tiene 41 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 22, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja solo para sus gastos, su segundo hijo es casado y vive  independiente, su tercer hijo estudia en la universidad y su ultima hija esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y hortalizas a las que vende en su propia comunidad, también cría  animales como: cerdos, cuyes y gallinas.
 
Se encuentra con su primer cerdito y fue invitada al banco comunal por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es tener un criadero de pollos más grande.
texts.en:
María B. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Floreciendo [Women Blooming]. She lives in the community of Patamarca in the city of Cuenca. This city is reknowned for its natural and cultural beauty. Its gastronomical variety captivates the palates of both locals and strangers.

María is 41 years old, married, and has four children aged 23, 22, 18, and 16. Her eldest daughter works independently to cover her expenses, her eldest son is married and lives independently, her younger son studies at university, and her youngest daughter is studying in a high school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a mason, and together they built their own home.

María works in agriculture, planting vegetables which she sells in her own community. She also raises animals like pigs, guinea pigs and hens.

This is her first loan. She was invited to the communal bank by her sister. She is going to invest in the purchase of chickens. Her goal is to have a larger chicken hatchery.

loans.use: Purchase chickens

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza U. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old and married with five school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a service-based business that provides motorcycle and vans repair services to local community members. This picture shows her husband, who is the main serviceman, and her son who helps them in their business. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

Liza joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided by her business. Liza is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase needed tools. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. lives in the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old, married and has three grown children. For the last 25 years, she has made a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) retail shop where she sells products people need daily such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks and beverages. She earns about PHP 4,000 a month from her work.

In 2002, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business  She has successfully repaid six previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 12,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell such as biscuits and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is divorced and has five children. For the past 10 years, she has made a living by selling items such as soap, steel wool and starch in Kokowada, Elmina. 

As a sole breadwinner, her priority is to bolster her earnings. She plans to do this by growing her business. The loan will allow her to purchase more items for sale. The extra profits will be reinvested back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: The loan will allow her to purchase more items for sale

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal, who creates artistic handmade items, is from Marka- Amman. She is a 43-year-old widow and the mother of five.

Through Souk Ayyadi (an initiative of Tamweelcom which was ushered into existence to expand clients' promotional base)  Dalal found that she could increase her sales and expand her client base. This developed her business and helped her to assess the market needs.

Dalal is requesting a loan of 1,200 JOD to expand her artistic projects and improve her profitability. An aspiration of Dalal is to open her own shop where she can sell her products independently, which will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand her artistic projects and improve her profitability

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es: Jhony tiene 21 años, vive con su esposa, ella se encuentra en estado de gestación y juntos viven en una casa que le fue heredada por parte de sus padres. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de animales como vacas, ovejas y caballos, actividad que lo realiza durante hace 3 años. Para ella este trabajo es muy importante por que gracias a ello pudo generarse los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Es así que comprar los animales tiernos y a un bajo costo, para luego engordarlos y cuando lleguen a un tiempo desarrollado los vende en la feria ganadera a un mayor precio, así recupera lo invertido adicional a sus ganancias. Por otro lado posee terrenos que son para cultivo, ubicado en la selva central, ahí siembra café, que es un producto muy rentable y de mucha demanda en el mercado. Sus planes es el de seguir creciendo en capital y extender la siembra de café. Es su primer crédito que solicita de manera grupal con MFP, se siente agradecido porque considera que este préstamo es un apoyo para mejorar su negocio y por ello se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar peones para que cosechen café, y cuyas ganancias  serán destinadas a la compra de más animales.
texts.en:
Jhony is 21 years old and lives with his wife. She is pregnant and together they live in a house that was inherited from their parents. Jhony sells animals such as cows, sheep, and horses, as he has done for  the last 3 years. For his wife, this work is very important because thanks to it, he can generate sufficient income to cover the family's necessities.

That's why he needs to buy young animals at a low cost, then to fatten them and when they arrive at a state of development, to sell them in the livestock fair at a higher price, thus recovering the additional investment and earning a profit.

In addition, Jhony has land under cultivation, located in the central rain forest. Here he sows coffee, a product that is very profitable and in high demand in the market. His plan is to continue growing his capital and extending the coffee plantings.

This is Jhony''s first loan as a group member with MFP. He is very grateful because he considers the loan helpful in improving his business, and he promises to be punctual in his payments. The loan will be invested in hiring laborers to harvest coffee. The resulting earnings will be destined for buying more animals.

loans.use: TO HIRE DAY LABORERS TO HARVEST HIS COFFEE CROP

loans.name: Leonilito

texts.en:
Leonilito G. is from the village of Aurora Zamboaga Del Sur. He is 36 years old. Leonilito is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Leonilito owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Leonilito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonilito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Leonilito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Leonilito is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Leonilito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Aijan's Group

texts.en:
Aijan T. is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to a driver. Her husband earns money by transporting passengers from Balykchi to Bishkek. Together they are bringing up three daughters and a son. The oldest daughter and the son study at university and the other children are at school.

Aijan herself works as a librarian at school. Eight years ago she was selling grocery products at the market, and then she saved some money and purchased a mini-bus “Mercedes Sprinter” for her husband. Since that moment her husband has been working as a driver. Aijan applied for the loan because they need money to purchase tires for the truck. In the future she wants to improve their living conditions and provide all her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase tires for the truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 26 bags of different types of groundnuts.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en: Dominador is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. He grows corn and has been doing it for 10 years. He earns about Php 30,000 per crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. Dominador is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow. In the future, Dominador hopes that his farming business will improve and support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow

loans.name: Quarashi

texts.en: Quarashi is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 26 years old and single with no child yet. He is a businessman with a garage and spare parts business in Katojo trading center, where he has operated for three years. At the moment, he has not employed anyone else since the business is still growing. However, he is able to generate about $106 as income monthly, and he hopes that this will increase soon. He is also involved in the sale of bananas from his plantation as his mother business, and his hard work has enabled him to succeed. His dream is to be able to increase production from his plantains as he continues to see his garage attract more customers. He needs to buy more spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Anabell Jessenia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, reside doña  Anabell Jessenia. Casada con dos hijos menores, trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias.
 La señora trabaja en el mercado municipal de Masaya, vendiendo todo estilo de calzado para niños, niñas, adolecentes y  adultos desde hace seis años, ella se ha preocupado por mantener su negocio con variedad de calzado y así siempre mantener la venta diaria ya que del negocio ha podido darles los estudios y alimentación a sus hijos. Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando doña  Anabell es la compra de calzado colegial, es por eso que  se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para renovar su crédito y así poder comprarle a sus proveedores los calzados que tienen más demandas en este tiempo, y obtener más ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Anabell Jessenia lives in the city of Masaya.  She is married and has two minor children.  She works arduously to give them the necessities.

She works at the Masaya municipal market.  She has been selling all styles of footwear for boys, girls, adolescents, and adults for six years.  She has been concerned about keeping a variety of footwear in her business.  That way she can maintain her daily sales.  Through her business she has been able to feed her children and give them an education.

One of the needs that Anabell is experiencing is the purchase of school shoes.  That is why she came to the Ceprodel office to renew her loan.  That way she will be able to buy from her suppliers the shoes that are in the most demand during this time.  She will get more income to supply her children with the necessities.

loans.use: to buy school shoes for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algún tiempo Filomena se dedica a la comercialización de aves de corral (pavos,gallina y patos), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.  También cuenta con una mototaxi que es de su propiedad, la cual la maneja su esposo para tener otro ingreso.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados, una vez que engorden poder ofertarlos a sus clientes y con las ganancias pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  Filomena con trabajo y empeño a logrado salir adelante poco a poco y su deseo es brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Filomena, 36, lives with her husband and children in her own home.  Her house does not have basic utilities; it is located in a rural area of the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

For some time now, Filomena has been selling poultry (turkeys, hens and ducks.)  She raises them in corrals that she has in the back of her house.  She feeds them with nutritionally balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they are fully grown, she sells them to her customers or in different markets in the area, and with the income she is able to pay for her family's basic needs.  She also has a mototaxi that she owns; her husband drives it to generate another income.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 600 Peruvian soles to buy poultry feed.  Once she fattens her poultry, she will be able to offer them for sale to her customers, and with the earnings she will be able to pay off the loan and improve her family's standard of living.  Filomena has managed to get ahead gradually with hard work and effort.  Her desire is to provide her children with other academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: buy nutritionally balanced feed and natural grains for her poultry business

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen, who is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family.  In business for 10 years now, she is requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her enterprise. In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her operation.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix vive en la zona de bajo Huayrapata su familia integra de su esposa Leticia y sus dos hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar, el trabaja con su vehículo trasportando materiales de construcción, y su esposa trabaja en una tienda que se encarga de vender medias deportivas como encargada de ventas, ambos aportan a la familia, el sr.  Félix como padre responsable se encarga también en llevar y recoger a sus hijas ya el trabajo de la esposa le impide hacerlo. Él necesita el préstamo de dinero para la reparación de su vehículo ya que para esta reparación tiene que comprar una nueva caja, motivo por el cual se pide el financiamiento con la institución.
texts.en:
Félix lives in the Bajo Huayrapata zone.  His family consists of his wife, Leticia, and their two daughters who are school age.  He works with his vehicle transporting building materials.  His wife is employed as a salesperson in a store selling athletic socks.  They both share the family’s support. Félix, as a responsible father, is also in charge of taking his daughters to school and picking them up since his wife can’t do it because of work.  

He needs this loan to repair his vehicle because he needs to buy a new transmission for this repair and this is why he’s asking the institution for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a transmission and for general maintenance.

loans.name: Sonia Margot

texts.es:
Sonia nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 28 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas en su propio kiosco. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El crédito que requiere Sonia es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo galletas, gaseosa, pasteles, chicles, caramelos y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Sonia, 28, was born in the Peruvian city of Cusco.  She and her partner have two children.  She now lives in the city of Urubamba where she operates her kiosk business.  She sells snacks, soft drinks, etc.  She has operated the business for six years and says that she is happy with her progress.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise for resale: crackers, soft drinks, pastries, gum, candy and other general merchandise.

The Senor de los Milagros de Urubamba community bank meets every thirty days in the city of Urubamba (Peru).  The region is famous for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and for Machu Piccu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela, de 44 años es una valerosa madre soltera de 4 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). El rostro serio de está trabajadora mujer, denota su constante lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Desde las primeras horas del día como hace 11 años, se dirige a cuidar sus cultivos de café y naranja, los cuales le proporcionan buenas ganancias en las negociaciones que realiza a los intermediarios que visitan sus 3 terrenos cultibables en cada cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasar la mayor parte en el campo; “construí mi casa dentro de mis plantaciones”, afirma contenta. Paralelo a esta actividad, ella realiza jornadas de trabajo, en cultivos de sus vecinos; quienes le pagan un dinero extra por su trabajo. Ahora está planeando sembrar en mayores cantidades, pues requiere de mayor capital, además se está preparando para la cosecha de naranja en el mes de octubre. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura podrá alcanzar sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Después de la cosecha de café, Manuela piensa limpiar sus terrenos agrícolas. Por ello de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para comenzar su trabajo. Asimismo varias calaminas para arreglar su pequeña casa.
texts.en: Manuela, 44, is a courageous single mother of 4 children who cares for them with a lot of love and affection in her own home, located in her native community of Kivinaki (in the central Peruvian rainforest.)  In the serious expression on the face of this hardworking woman, you can see her constant struggle to get ahead and support her children.  From the early hours of the morning, as she has done for 11 years, she goes to care for her coffee and orange crops, which provide her with good earnings through her negotiations with the intermediaries that visit her 3 plots of land every harvest season.  What she likes most about her work is spending most of her time in the country.  "I built my house in the middle of my fields," she says, contentedly.  In addition to growing her own crops, she also makes some extra money by working on her neighbor's farms.  Now she is planning to cultivate larger quantities, for which she needs more capital, and she also is preparing to harvest her oranges in the month of October.  She belongs to the communal bank "Flor de Almendra," and this is their second loan cycle with MFP.  With this loan, she is sure that she can reach her goals.  In addition, she pledges to be punctual with her payments.  After the coffee harvest, Manuela plans to clear the fields she uses for farming.  To do this, once the loan is disbursed, she will use the money to buy tools to start this work and she will also buy some sheets of corrugated metal roofing material to make some repairs to her small house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural tools and also to buy corrugated metal roofing material for the roof of her house

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 46 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, esta casada y es madre D. cuatro hijos D. los cuales dos ya son mayores e independientes y solo los dos últimos viven con ella y su esposo, en su casa propia. El trabajo D. Martha consiste en la venta D. abarrotes, así como la D. carne D. pollo, en ese mismo lugar ofrece también a su clientela cosméticos que previamente son elegidos por medio D. catálogos. Tiene 12  años trabajando este lugar y gracias a éste trabajo es que pudo dar a sus hijos una buena educación. Manifiesta que le gusta lo que hace porque dispone D. tiempo para dedicarse a otras cosas, entre ellas la D. cuidar a sus hijos. Martha piensa seguir trabajando para consolidar su negocio, y con las ganancias remodelar y acondicionar su casa con varias habitaciones para alquilarlos, pues el negocio D. inmuebles le resultaría mucho más rentable. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, en la que asegura cumplirá con el pago D. sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará algunos productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Martha, age 46, is a happy and enterprising woman who is married and the mother of four children. Two of her children are independent adults and only her two youngest live with her and her husband in their home. 

Martha sells groceries, such as chicken meat, and also offers her customers mail-order cosmetics at the same location. She has spent 12 years working out in this location, thanks to which she has been able to proviD. her children with a good education. She says she likes what she does because it allows her time for other things as well, such as raising her children. 

Martha plans to continue building her business and, with the profits, to remodel and air-condition her house with several rooms which she plans to rent as doing so would be much more profitable. This will be her first loan with MFP [Kiva field partner], to which she has assured that she will make her payments. With the amount she is taking out, she will buy products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es una joven mujer negociante que se dedica al comercio y a la venta de alimentos, actividades  que surgieron para apoyar a su numerosa familia fortaleciendo su ingreso. En su casa hay varios negocios, su padre tiene una tienda arrendada, mientras  su madre y ella se dedican a la preparación y venta de alimentos alimentos, trabajan diariamente y desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. A su edad de 21 años, tiene como meta principal terminar sus estudios universitarios y por eso todos los días se esmera en el crecimiento de su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará materias primas e insuos para las comidas   y  hará adecuaciones a su cocina y a la sala, pues  desea organizar la venta de sus alimentos en la sala de su casa,  ya que funciona en la terraza donde la lluvia muchas veces baja la venta y esto es uno de los más grandes desafíos que enfrenta.
texts.en:
Claudia is a young businesswoman who works in the retail trade and sells food. Through these businesses, she has been able to push forward in order to help her large family with their income. There are several businesses that operate in her home. Her father has a rented store while she and her mother prepare and sell food. They work every day from 6am to 3pm.

At 21 years of age, Claudia’s main goal is to finish her university studies which is why she strives to grow her business every day. She is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Doming and will use the money to buy ingredients and supplies for her dishes. Claudia will also make renovations to her kitchen and living room because she wants to have an organized space in her house for selling food. Her business is currently located on the terrace where it rains. Many times this has resulted in low sales, which is one of the greatest challenges that she must face.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her dishes and to make renovations to her kitchen and living area.
